The lettuce, it didst overpower, I must confess,
And thus, I didst conclude, with a heavy heart,
That Del Taco, it didst not play its part.

But fear not, dear friends, for I shall try,
Their other dishes, and see if they can fly,
For though this experience, it was not grand,
I shall not judge, until I see the land."

"Alas, fair maiden, I didst venture forth to dine
At this establishment, of which much praise didst shine.
But lo, my friends, my expectations were not met,
Forsooth, the atmosphere didst reek of smoke and fumes,
And service slow, the staff not overly kind.
We didst order cheese sticks, cold and naught special,
Beer battered pickles, too greasy, and soggy to boot,
And last, a BBQ chicken sandwich, the batter overcooked,
Blackened and burnt, a sight most unappetizing, alack!
We didst try to cut it, remove the batter, but 'twas in vain,
For the task didst prove too arduous, the sandwich not worth the pain.
The garlic Parmesan fries, devoid of garlic's charm,
Didst leave us both unsatisfied, our hunger unrelieved.
In conclusion, dear friends, this place didst not impress,
Save for the beer, which didst quench our thirst, God bless!"

"Sunday brunch, we went. Early risers, few and far between. Old folks, mostly. Limited buffet, not much variety. Twenty-five bucks a head, should be more. Breakfast items, hot. Where's the lunch? Fresh, yes. But simple, too simple. Upscale casino, Bellagio or Wynn, better choice. Service, fine."

"Fox's latest joint, overpriced and unimpressive. Buddy orders prime rib French dip, server asks if he wants mushrooms, peppers, or onions. Charges him $2 each, totaling $6. Ridiculous. I can get ten pounds of onions for that price. Ended up splitting a chicken club and a small cheese plate with a friend, plus iced tea. $24. Waiter was a jerk too. Not worth it, unless someone's buying me a gift card."

"We were stoked to try the new joint near our digs. Trendy and family-friendly, just what we needed. But, man, were we let down. The decor was cool, but the wine was warm and took forever to arrive. The menu had some decent options, but not exactly healthy. We went for the hummus and salads, but they were lackluster. Small portions, stale chips, and not exactly fresh ingredients. We thought maybe we ordered wrong, but come on, a restaurant should stand by their dishes. It was such a bummer that we hit up another spot after. It's a shame, too. First trendy place in the area and it's a dud. Fix it up, and we'll be regulars."

"Slow service killed our appetite. Burger arrived on a damp bun. Requested a new one, waited ages. Ate the meat, skipped the bread. Sweltering heat inside. Whole table drenched. One bad night? Don't think we'll return."

"Ere we did come, my love and I, ere the flickering lights of yonder silver screen did beckon us. And thus, we chose this place, by virtue of its proximity to the cinema's hallowed halls. The servants, swift and kind, did seat us quickly and take our order with dispatch. A Watermelon Margarita, cool and refreshing, did grace our lips, and brought us joy. But alas, the victuals, they did not please. A chopped salad, drenched in dressing fiery hot, did lie before me, and I could scarce consume more than two bites. The waiter, a gentle soul, did offer me a quesadilla in its stead, yet it did not stir within me any great passion. My husband, he did choose the Rancho Burrito, which did not displease him overmuch. But, to the movies we shall return, and seek sustenance elsewhere, forsooth. This place, I would not recommend to any."

"7:30 am. Breakfast time. Sausage gravy or turkey sausage? Maybe a ripe banana. Or both. Magdelina ensured a fruitful feast, plenty of Froot Loops and overripe bananas alongside the sausage gravy and turkey sausage. Grabbed a coffee and left, still hungry. Las Vegas has countless hotels. Stay elsewhere."

"Methinks 'tis strange, this place doth lack, 
In location, comfort, and staff's gentle tact. 
A central spot, 'twas not, save for the mall, 
Which housed some eateries, of chain-like sort. 
The woman who checked us in, didst show some grace, 
But after her, naught but indifference didst trace. 
My Hilton status, with its humble boon, 
Was ignored, alack, and left unshown. 
I paid for internet, in error, it seemed, 
And housekeeping, with towels and water, didst falter. 
For such a sum, in nightly rate, I say, 
This hotel's faults, do make mine anger fray."

"Walk in, menu's up. Chicken heaven? Maybe. Flavors, seasonings, choices galore. Not impressed. Ordered wings, strips, fries. Golden crisp, hot. Garlic Parmesan, too salty. Some undercooked. Small joint, took it to go. Mixed reviews, but willing to try again."

"A Groupon of late didst my friend and I persuade,
To visit Pewter Rose upon a Saturday eve.
The price, I must confess, didst seem quite steep,
Yet glad we were, the coupon to retrieve.

The atmosphere, pleasant, yet a tad kitsch,
Didst strike me as inappropriate, I must admit.
Plastic tablecloths, a sight most curious,
When plates of twenty dollars or more, they proffer.

The crowd, it didst pour in, like a river's flow,
Our reservation, sharp at eight, didst we make.
The hostess, with haste, didst find us a seat,
But our waiter's words, didst a warning convey.

"Tonight, we are busy, a wait, you shall endure,"
He said, and we, in no rush, didst assure.
Attentive, he was, our water glasses full,
But long we waited, our patience to pull.

Appetizer, eight-thirty, didst arrive,
And nine-twenty, our main course, didst thrive.
The risotto, seafood, a delight, it was,
My friend's lamb, salty, alas, it didst pass.

Again, I may return, brunch to partake,
But full price, for dinner, I would not make."

"Terrible joint. Service? Forget about it. Waiter plucks my salad plate, knife and all, and plops it back down with a glob of lettuce still clinging. Apps were dreadful. Mushroom caps made me queasy. Drinks? More like dishwater. Steak was passable, but the spuds were frigid and veggies tasted like nothing so much as regret. What a waste of a night out."

"Twas a Thursday eve, and scant few souls did roam,
This place of sustenance, where I did seek my home.
A single to-go order, did take, alack,
More than twenty minutes, forsooth, 'twas a fact.
The victuals were passable, yet not so fine,
As other Hawaiian feasts, that cost less, I do find.
Nigh ten dollars, for the meal entire,
Didst seem a steep price, and not worth the fire.
Yet, they do offer, a smaller part,
For those who seek a lighter meal, and save their purse."

"Durant's, I like it. But let's be real, it ain't no great joint. Been there three times, and each time was a disappointment. Service was slow, seafood was overcooked, and the steak was done wrong. Don't get me wrong, it's a good spot to hide from the law, but that's about it."
"The joint wasn't half bad, but there's better grub to be had in the neighborhood, especially if you're lookin' for a place to catch a game. Went once, saw enough, ain't been back since."

"My liege didst ask for recommendation of an interior decorator, to adorn our new office building with finesse. I didst reach out to Yelp's community, and they didst present unto me, Neilsen. I didst send his details to my liege, and she didst express great gratitude, for my swiftness in finding such a skilled artisan. Brownie points, didst I receive! 

Alas, my joy didst turn to woe, for Neilsen's follow-through, was lacking in diligence. He didst ignore my liege's calls, and didst delay his proposal, by two weeks. Moreover, he didst disappear for weeks on end, without informing her of his whereabouts. I couldst continue, but alack, 'tis painful to recall such disappointment. 

Perhaps, there was a misunderstanding, and fairness dictates, I should note, there be many glowing reviews. Yet, I must caution, for my experience didst leave much to be desired. Low marks, I do not give lightly, and 'tis a shame, to have to do so, in this case. 

I urge thee, dear reader, to weigh thy needs, ere recommending Neilsen's services, lest thou suffer a similar fate, as mine."

"Fancy hotels bug me. They skimp on basics like fridges and microwaves, stuff you can get at a Holiday Inn for half the price. And don't even get me started on WiFi fees in 2011. It's robbery.  

These places want you to pay top dollar for a crummy room with nothing nearby. Not even a sidewalk. You gotta walk a half-mile just to find a convenience store.  

The room was alright, but not worth the cash. Three-star hotels are just as good."
"Grill cheese, sad as hell. One slice, not even to the edges. Disappointed, sorry to say. Last time, great. This time, slapped on. Cooks need passion."

"Tacos in the Burgh, they don't cut it. I'm hard on them, but someone's gotta tell it like it is. Tortillas, they're key. They're the first thing your tongue touches, sets the tone for the whole damn thing. Fresh, homemade tortillas, that's what I'm talking about. Not some store-bought crap. That's what Verde's doing wrong. They're too focused on the toppings, not enough on the tortilla. And let me tell you, it shows. You're paying five bucks for a taco that's just not worth it."

"Methought the menu didst please mine eyes,
And in it, saw great potential doth lie.
But alas, fate didst play a cruel part,
For in came a group, most loud and rude,
Whose rowdy ways didst tax the staff's art.
A pass, I shall give, for their plight.

But lo, my burger, of one pound weight,
Didst come forth, with fries, cold as winter's night.
A shame, for they didst taste, in days past,
As if fresh from the oven, hot and bright.

And then, my biscuit, forgotten, alack!
Until I spoke, didst they bring it back.
Dry, it was, and with a heavy heart,
I didst fear, this place, might not be smart.

Alack, I didst want to love this place,
And dreamt of breakfast, ere I didst depart.
But now, I fear, 'tis not in the cards,
For tardy service, doth leave a sour taste."

"Place ain't what it used to be. Went there last week 'cause Saigon Noodles was closed. Just wanted some soup. Ordered Tom Yum. Came with a small salad, fresh and good, but the dressing was pure sugar. Daughter had chicken satay, peanut sauce was off, too sweet, few peanuts. Soup was sour, not that nice sweet and sour mix, just sour. Edible though, so I ate it. Service was decent. If you're on the West Side on a Monday and need soup, lower your standards and eat here. Otherwise, hit up Saigon Noodle or Ha Long Bay on Willie Street."

"This joint's got some serious issues. Water pressure's off the charts, can't even drain fast enough. No way to adjust it either. What's the point of having a fancy hotel when you can't even take a proper shower? And don't get me started on the TV selection. No premium channels, just basic stuff. And the internet? Forget about it. They charge you per minute and the cord's too short to reach the bed. Business center's a joke too, 8 bucks for 15 minutes? Ridiculous. Customer service? Non-existent. Like they don't want you there. Ask a question, they'll ignore you like you're invisible. Only reason I'm giving it two stars instead of one is 'cause the room was clean. That's it."

"I'd run the M&M store on the strip differently. Free samples, life-size huggable M&Ms, demo of M&Ms melting in your mouth, hot folks clad in M&Ms, glam bar with candy-colored cocktails and novelty beer with M&Ms, Cirque du Soleil show with M&M-clad acrobats, high stakes poker with huggable M&M dealers, and strippers. That's how you bring in the crowds. But the current owner doesn't agree. Their version of the store has four floors of M&M merch, a cheesy 3-D movie, a probably cheesy tour, and no free samples. Guess that's more in line with the M&M brand, but I don't get why they're on the strip if they're not gonna bring the excitement."

"Four shrimp, overcooked, upon a po' boy, for twelve silver pieces?!? O, how the shame doth cling to them that serve such fare? Red beans and rice, but average, nothing near the authentic taste. Gumbo? Meh, bland and dull. \n\nYet, I must confess, the service here was fair and bright, but alas, 'twas not enough to make amends for NOLA's lackadaisical approach to Cajun cookery. This establishment wouldst not endure a day within the city of New Orleans."

"Burgers here are good, not great. Better than fast food, but that's not saying much. Compared to other gourmet spots, they fall short. Service was slow, had to wait for a table despite plenty of open seats. Ordered fries, had to ask for them ourselves. Food was decent, nothing special. Had the bacon burger, patty was sirloin and bacon, topped with more bacon, mayo, gouda, and onion strings. It was fine, but not worth repeating."

"Three visits, not impressed. Overpriced, service lacking. Open late, that's something. Sunday night, ripped off a nail, needed a quick fix. Props for the hours, but that's it. Last resort, emergency only."

"Our victuals didst bear a trace of Italian spice,
Which didst seem strange and didst not please mine eyes.
The vegetable enchilada, full of zucchini, didst lie,
For in my mind, 'twas peppers and onions that didst dance.
If thou dost cherish zucchini, then do order the dish,
But for myself, alas, 'twas not to my liking, in sooth.
The surroundings were pleasant, the service was kind,
But, alack, the fare didst not agree with mine mind."

"Verily, this place doth teem with folk,  
A constant throng that doth bespeak its worth.  
We came for vegetables, a wondrous treat,  
And found the seitan dish a true delight.  
But alas, the rest of our repast did lack,  
In quality and quantity, it did not match.  
The service too, did leave much to be desired,  
Our waiter, pleasant, yet scarce attentive,  
Whilst others of the staff did seem quite mad,  
In their endeavors, they did appear quite frantic."

"Methinks my love and I didst decide to dine at Hash House late,
The service was passable, yet the hostess didst lean too much,
We hadst to order from the night menu, alas,
I chose the grilled cheese, which was decent, though not vast,
With too much tomato and but one large chunk of avocado,
'Twas thrown together and sloppy, hard to consume, I do declare,
Our server, Mike, was good, but took some time to bring my drink,
A strawberry lemonade margarita, quite tasty, yet not worth the wait, I do think,
All in all, 'twas a decent meal, but I do hope for better fare next time, anon."

"Family trip to Vegas, we hit this spot every time. Cheap and delicious, that's what I'm talking about. Ordered the roasted duck, not bad, but the portions, man, they were tiny compared to Cali Sam Woos. BBQ pork and chicken rice, now that's what I'm talking about, tasted like home. Veggies, simple, sautÃ©ed with garlic and salt, can't go wrong. But let me tell you, the bill, it added up, around $50, and cash only, you feel me? Next time, I'm hitting up Capital Seafood upstairs."

This weekend, we didst venture forth once more
To acquire some white balsamic vinegar, a delicacy, no doubt.
And thus, we didst decide to partake in a meal,
To sample their fare, and see how it doth appeal.

The younglings, they didst share a grilled cheese,
And found it to their liking, 'twas a pleasant surprise.
My dearest wife, she didst opt for the antipasto,
But found it lacking, for the price, it was not worth the cost.

Abrequine, a roast beef panini, they didst call it,
But alas, it didst not see the heat of a panini press, pitiful.
It was small, and lacking in flavor, a disappointment,
The potato chips, crispy, but oily, a sad event.

The gelato, a sweet treat, the children didst enjoy,
And I, a taste, didst take, and found it not too cloy.
But the Mexican lime olive oil, oh how it didst pall,
Too fragrant, too sweet, a synthetic taste, after all.

My wife, she didst find pleasure in the spicy green beans,
And the feta-stuffed olives, a delight, it seems.
A nice excursion, once every six months, or so,
But not a place to frequent, no, not for us, I do declare.

"Methinks 'twas fate that led me to this place,
Wherein I dined for three of four fair days,
The victuals were not wretched, save the space
That held the soup, which didst overflow its bounds.
Aye, 'twas a cafe, and cafe food it served,
But on the fourth day, a mishap did occur.
The serving maid, in haste, did pour too much,
And when I barely moved, the tea did splash and spill,
Upon my leg, whereat I didst feel a burn,
And nearly dropped the pot, but managed still.

My state, a hangover, and weariness,
Did make me seek a cure, ere my departure,
And thus I asked another maid, who didst call
The manager, who summoned security, in turn.
When he arrived, I said, "A bag of ice, I pray,"
And should have spoken to the maid, straightway.
But, alack, 'tis done, and now I must away."

"Tried the taco joint three times now. Third time, just to check the taco. Can't review a Mexican spot without trying a taco or burrito, right? Taco was small, no bigger than three, four inches. No crispy shell option. Beef was good, but not worth two bucks. Another time, had the fried fish. Big letdown. Fish was practically stripped bare, fried with lime wedges. Unfilleted, unprepared. Juvenile decor. Sign said they won't report sexual harassment, just grade it. Price was off, food sub-par, service alright."

"Thing that gets my goat is how the school wants our dough so bad, they gotta make us pay online. And not just that, they tack on a 90-cent fee. Like, what the hell? If it's a convenience fee, I'd just send 'em 15 bucks straight up. But nope, they only take online payments. So, they're basically extorting 90 cents from each parent. It adds up, man."

We swung by this joint in Phoenix after hearing good things. Got there around 8:30 on a Friday night, and there was only one other couple ahead of us, so we were served quick.

Service was decent, but the employee who helped us seemed a bit tired or something. Like they'd been working a long shift or somethin'.

Ice cream wise, my husband went for the TC^2 and salted caramel, while I got the almond buttercrunch and apple cinnamon. Also tried the honey blue cheese and sugar and spice. Didn't get much almond flavor outta the almond buttercrunch, but the other flavors were alright. Texture was a bit icy, not super creamy like I'd hoped.

Pricing was reasonable, but I wouldn't go outta my way for this ice cream. If you're in the area and want some "original" flavors for a decent price, might be worth stoppin' in. But otherwise, there's better ice cream out there. Me and my husband were pretty meh about the whole thing. Spoiled by some great ice cream up in the SF bay area, I reckon.

"Alas, my friends, I must confess,
This place doth lack a certain je ne sais quoi,
A quality that doth make it stand apart,
And thus, I fear, it doth not win my heart.

I do confess, I am a fan of small,
Of those who dare to dream and take the fall,
But here, alas, the hotdogs doth not please,
Nor doth the lemonade, which doth disappoint,
With its watery taste, like tears of woe,
It doth not quench my thirst, nor doth it show
The skill of Sonic, whose hotdogs doth reign,
In flavor, texture, and in every way, supreme.

And so, my friends, I shall not stop,
For here, alas, they doth not serve the top,
But rather, doth present a pale imitation,
Of what a hotdog should be, in all its creation.
And thus, I bid thee, let us move along,
For here, there doth not lie a culinary song."

"Food was good, atmosphere fun. One sip of beer, though, and I tasted iron. Something crunched between my teeth. Glass shards in the brew! Manager didn't believe me. Said the bottle looked fine. I showed him the glass in my hand. He swapped the bottle. That was it."

"Hark! If not for yon delectable turkey crepe and sweet cookies,
This place wouldst have earned but a single star, methinks.
The service, oh so poor, didst leave much to be desired,
And the decor, alack! didst border on the absurd.

But lo! The cupcake desserts, they didst take the cake,
For they were naught but frosting, a most curious mistake.
Our waitress, no novice, didst seem to bear the weight,
Of too many tables, or perhaps her wits didst fail.
She didst forget our appetizer, a grievous fault,
Yet didst confess her error, with some grace, at last.

And when our meals didst arrive, the pasta, alas!
Was cold as ice, yet hunger didst compel us still.
So we didst eat, though with little joy or zest,
And vowed to stick to carry-out desserts, at best."

"O, woe is me! My car, with tint so dark,
Doth bring me naught but heat and spark.
In days of yore, my previous steed,
With lighter shade, did keep me cool indeed.
But now, alas! My newest ride,
With darkest tint, doth make me sweat inside.
A plague upon this tint, I say!
For all my gold, 'twas not worth the pay.
I'm wroth, my friends, and vexed am I,
For naught but heat doth this tint provide.
What need hath one for tint, I pray,
If naught but warmth doth it convey?"

"Flamingo's one of the last relics from Vegas' past. No glitz, no glam. Just a simple, old-school joint that's seen better days. But that's its charm. You won't find any fancy frills or thrills here, just a solid place to rest your head. And hey, if you're looking for a taste of classic Vegas, this is your spot. Sure, the rooms are decent, but don't expect top-notch cuisine. It's all about location, baby. You're close enough to the action, but far enough to avoid the chaos. Give it a shot, kid."

"This hotel's got nothing going for it. Rooms are old and worn out, staff's not much better. They might do their job, but don't count on them going out of their way to help. Place is past its prime, been that way for a good ten years or so. Only stayed here 'cause of some conference. Won't be coming back."

"O, how the mighty have fallen! This eatery, once my heart's desire, hath now become a source of woe and disappointment. In days of yore, their Cuban bread didst delight mine taste buds, but alas, 'twas nowhere to be found upon the menu. The staff, in their infinite wisdom, didst offer to prepare it still, but lo, the end result was a far cry from the original. A different bread, too thick and un-toasted, didst mar the dish, and the burger, once a savory delight, didst fail to impress. Fries, once crispy and golden, were now but a shadow of their former self. Alas, poor restaurant, how art thou fallen!"

"Smoothie King, a joint as busted as Jamba Juice. Packed house, too. Staff? Not worth a damn. Place made no sense. Guy at register, clueless. Charged me eighteen bucks for two drinks. Smoothies, decent. But no way I'm coming back."

"Hark! A quest for lunch didst bring me here,
Masaman curry, my heart didst cheer.
But lo! Tomatoes didst make an appearance,
A strange addition, indeed, a curious preference.

I asked for none, a medium spice,
Yet found the dish quite bland, not nice.
Chicken, plenty, but veggies, scarce,
A balance, fair, I didst not find in this place.

The soup, just passable, the spring roll too,
But peanuts, raw, oh what a woe!
I craved the cooked, a proper treat,
But alas, they were not to be beat.

If time dost allow, Chanpen Thai,
A better choice, doth wait thee nigh.
But if thy schedule doth require speed,
Fare here, not bad, service, good indeed."

"Bought the car, no issues. Service department, different story. Forgot to tighten a hose, car died on the freeway. Dangerous situation. No comp for my time, inconvenience, or danger caused. Not even an apology. Don't trust their mechanics."

"A platter of victuals, small and dear,
With flavors that doth overwhelm the taste,
I had the Dan Dan noodles, twelve silver pieces dear,
The spice of sauce did mask the shrimp's sweet grace.
The noodles, too, were lost in fiery storm,
Their subtle texture, to my tongue, unborn.
In Venetian's confines, a meal most dire,
Yet, for swift sustenance, 'tis worth desire."
"Brunch at Ella's? Odd. Kugel and strawberries, not bad. Matzo soup, meh. Holishkes, bland. Mac and cheese, too much. Waitstaff, friendly. Menu, a mess. Time for a change, Ella's."

"Methinks I've visited this establishment twice, and, alas, shall not return again. The first time, I merely sat at the bar, quaffed a couple of ales, and partook of some nachos, which, truth be told, were but average fare. The barkeep, however, was most cordial and the service, in general, was quite good. 

The second time, alack, the waitress was a total spaceling! We didst arrive, and, lo, she brought us water anon, some fifteen minutes later. And, verily, she didst check on us but once each half hour thereafter. The game we had requested didst not begin until a good thirty minutes had passed. Our ale, I do confess, was a puzzle unto her, and, alas, the victuals we didst receive were cold, nay, verily, they were but lukewarm, and of mediocre quality, at best. 

The selfsame'regulars,' I do declare, were in attendance both times I didst visit. They were, methinks, a trifle boisterous, and, indeed, both times didst they appear, to mine own eyes, mightily inebriated. 

There be plenty of other taverns in the vicinity. Avoid this one, my friends, an thou dost value thine own comfort and peace of mind!"

"Don't care much for seafood, so it takes somethin' special to impress me. Had a few dishes at Original Fish Market - lobster bisque, halibut, pork chop with coleslaw. Bisque was bland, cold. Halibut, decent. Pork chop, bitter, dry. Atmosphere, standoff-ish. Not exactly friendly. Took forever to get the waitress's attention. She was short with us, like we were botherin' her. Rather get sushi than spend more cash here."

"Went out on our anniversary, 11/11. Couldn't get Texas, so we settled for this joint near home. Salad bar was a joke - small and full of canned crap that's been sittin' out too long. Not like Texas or Via, that's for sure. Hubby likes his meat well-done, but they still served it rare. Asked for a Coke, they gave us a can with some ice in a glass. Meat selection was weak and overpriced. And three bucks for a Coke? Ridiculous. We'll stick to the good stuff and make the trip to Via or Texas next time."

"Food's decent, but service is a joke. Went there twice, both times it was a slow-moving disaster. Servers were MIA, took forever to get our order, and we had to ask multiple times for refills. Dim sum was cold by the time it arrived. Skip it, go to Chang's on Decatur instead. Not worth the time or money."

"Thou art a wondrous sight, Groupon, for thou hast saved me a pretty penny. In truth, I hail from fair Seattle, where aquariums be a common sight, and thus, I sought to visit this place, forsooth, to behold the sea creatures of this region. Alas, I should have known better, for Phoenix, alack, is a desert, and lo, an aquarium here seemed most strange. Yet, I was curious, and the price, it did entice. 

The tanks, alas, were small, and full of people, in a space too confined, methought. And thus, the folk did grow irate, if one did tarry more than thirty seconds, to gaze upon a wonder, or take a picture, forsooth. The talks, they were a waste, for they did draw a crowd, and naught couldst be seen. But lo, there was one tank, with a second level, above, to gaze down upon it, and thus, 'twas the best view in the place, methought. 

In conclusion, I say, fair friends, drive thou to California, to a true coastal aquarium, and save thy pence. Nay, verily, purchase a DVD, or some such thing, for it shall bring thee greater joy, than this place, I doth reckon."

"JJ's has potential. Great concept, menu, and atmosphere. They support local businesses, too. But after three visits, we're underwhelmed. Had their signature dog with chili, onions, beans, bacon, jalapeÃ±os, and mustard. Good quality bun and dog, but the chili and beans lacked flavor. Side of onion rings? Greasy and flavorless. Disappointing overall. Hope they step up their game."

"Excalibur Roundtable buffet? More like a sad cafeteria. My review's based on breakfast. Thankfully, we had a 2-for-1 coupon, so it only cost us $9 each. 

Place had all the usual suspects, but everything was dried out or soggy. Freshness wasn't their strong suit. Didn't even bother getting more food. Dessert area had some pastries and donuts. Meh. 

Highlight was the waiter. He made us laugh. 

Now, I know someone's gonna mention how mass-produced food doesn't have to be terrible. And they're right. But this place? Stay far, far away."
"Returning a Christmas gift, a real hassle. Tag missing, no in-store credit. Called customer service, they fixed it. Two stars for the store, but big props to corporate relations."

"A dismal scene didst present itself, my dear friend,
A place devoid of mirth and merriment.
The weekend came, and yet the patrons didst stay away,
Leaving us to ponder, what didst we do to deserve this fate?

We entered, hoping to find some cheer,
But alas, the go-go dancers didst not appear.
A single beer didst we consume, and then didst flee,
Forsooth, within the space of half an hour, didst we decamp with great haste."

"Hark, what news is this? A conference held,
In rooms with scent of smoke and mold, so bold.
My friends and I, in twain didst lay,
But lo, the bed bugs came, and bit us, fie upon't!
Six bites, seven bites, oh cruel fate,
Didst leave us itching, and in discomfiture great.
The second night, in another room I lay,
But still the bed bugs came, and bit me, alack!
Two bites upon my ankles, oh woe is me,
Didst make me feel most dirty and unclean, yea verily.
I give this place but two stars, forsooth,
For though the facilities be grand and fair,
The bed bugs, they do mar the experience, indeed,
And leave us itching, with naught but dismay and despair."

"Costco ain't what it used to be. This 'business center' in Vegas, it's a joke. No booze, no grub, just a bunch of overpriced snacks and drinks for vending machines. Place was dead too, only a few workers and they didn't know squat. Asked about coupons, waited in line, and they don't even take 'em. Back in L.A., that's where the real Costco's at. That's where I'll be doin' my shoppin' next time I'm in Vegas."

"O, how vexing! 

The highlight of our repast, indeed, 
Was Anthony, a man of Queens, who did attend 
With grace and poise, his duty to fulfill. 
His accent, true to form, did bring delight, 
As he served with care and gentle will. 
He brought a sample of the soup, ere we did choose, 
And made sure we had all we needed, with a smile so broad. 
Kudos, Anthony, thou art a worthy knight! 

But, alas, the victuals did not quite meet 
The standards set by thy excellent service, friend. 
The tilapia, a hit, no doubt, with those who did partake, 
Yet portion sizes, a disparity did make. 
A note to thee, O kitchen, let the plates be fair, 
For twain at table, equal shares, do prepare. 

I, myself, did start with minestrone, a broth 
Whose flavors, though good, did lack the heat of youth. 
My meatball sandwich, too, did suffer from the salt, 
And lacked the freshness that my taste did expect. 

But, lo, the lemon cookies, a sweet delight, 
Did end our meal most pleasantly, with candles bright. 
A noble gesture, indeed, and much appreciated, 
For in this place, a smoke-free haven, we shall be, come February's dawn."

"Lost its traditional feel, too much remodeling. Where'd the personality go? Bulky wooden chairs need cushions, more fabric overall. Great potential with lots of light and high ceilings. Bright Mexican ceramics would help. Stark wall of crosses and exposed wood, like Nathan Lane's Birdcage apartment. LOL. Good for small wedding parties, dance floor in the center. Rice dry and unflavorful, beans lacking flavor. Table salsa is canned tomato sauce with pepper seeds, basil, and a touch of sugar, like Ragu. Guacamole has cottage cheese as a thickener, ew. Chili colorado is just thick, no flavor. Slow, unhelpful service, but prices are high. $9 for the cheese crisp is worth it, great crispiness and good cheese blend."

"At Sunset Station, I did abide,
Much better than I had supposed, 'twas inside.
Gus had guests to meet for dinner, so
I wandered, solo, to find a place to dine, and thus
Fatburger became my choice, by the sign's decree.
The maiden there, most pleasant and kind, did take
My order of a burger, with their special flair,
And onion rings, of which the sign did loudly declare.
A shake, I also ordered, to quench my thirst,
And thus, my meal was ready, in just a few bursts.
But alas, the burger, a mushy mess it was,
With flavors indistinct, a disappointment, it did pass.
The onion rings, bland, at best, they were,
And the shake, just average, I do declare.
Oh, how I shudder now, at the mere thought,
Of Fatburger, a place I'll ne'er be brought."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

Food was good, not great. Small portions. Stand in line, sit down, wait for grub. Like McDonald's. Thai Dynamite was tame, sesame chicken mediocre.

Saw a mess while we dined. Spilled salt or sugar by the door. Server almost fell, four staff walked by, cleaned up 5-10 minutes later. Accident waiting to happen.

Won't be back."

"Came for the four Yelp stars, left with a bad taste. Boyfriend and I wanted Mexican, ordered green chili plate and carne asada burrito. Shared menudo too. Expected authentic flavors, got bland instead. Could've gone to Filiberto's for better grub. Only pluses were quick service and friendly server. Won't be back."

"'Let's check this joint out,' I told my buddy. Big mistake. Place looked decent, service was all right, but the grub? Forget about it. Fish burrito was a joke - undercooked rice, a few veggies, and a fried fish patty that tasted like shoe leather. My friend's chicken fajitas weren't much better - lacked flavor, same crappy rice, and a sad salad. Salsa was alright, I'll give 'em that. But overall, avoid this dump."
"Tomahawk steak, special, $98. Glazed sea bass, $39. Asparagus, $14. Hand-cut fries, $12. Not exactly bland, a bit too salty though. Blood pressure'll spike. Ambiance, chic. Bathroom, unique."

"Clothes good, staff bad. Always messed up when I come here. Today, five items at counter, four at home. Kid manager took over 'cause others didn't know what a check was. He struggled for ten minutes, ignored me. Finally rang it up. Grrrr, hate going back."
"Prices, fair. But 45 minutes for a wash and vac? Too long. Not sure if I'll return."

"Fare of middling sort, a notion most fair,  
My first time there, and pleas'd I was indeed.  
Yet, save for one dish, all else did pale,  
The Red Jade Chicken, a culinary wonder, did prevail."

"Slow, real slow. Like molasses in January. Place was dead, but still, they couldn't get their act together. No using the app, no sir. Gotta give 'em your phone and let 'em punch in the numbers themselves. What a pain."

"Came here with the folks before Zumanity. No wait time, but shoulda waited. 

Drinks: Sangio, normally good, but didn't finish the glass. Mom's limoncello cocktail was alright. 

Food: Soup and salad special - cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, red vinaigrette, feta. Salad was rough, tomatoes were cold, didn't eat it. Mom's rare veal ($30+) was over-marinated, still had a vinegar taste. Didn't like it. 

Service: Server didn't check in till we were done. Supervisor came over, offered to replace the salad and veal. Didn't have time, didn't charge us for those two."

"Average fare, woeful service we didst receive,
Four in our party, three with meals that pleased,
But my son's Philly cheesesteak, alas, a soggy sight,
No concern from the waitress, her duties slight.
We pondered its return, but she ne'er didst come,
Her visits brief, her caring none, a poor sum.
My son asked for water, forgotten, alack,
A new profession she should seek, her skills lack.
Our next Vegas trip, this place we shall eschew."
"Philly cheese steaks, slow service, 15-20 bucks.  Flavorless sandwiches, fries too.  TVs blasting loud, sensitive ears beware.  Limited seating."

"Avenue Q, brilliant. Traveling cast, keep in mind. Gammage Auditorium, not impressed. Outside, cool. Inside, outdated. Bathrooms, gross. Handicap inaccessible, half the floors. No elevator, rudely told. Walk slowly, cane, few stairs, nearly killed me. Didn't go to restrooms, no way in hell. Almost burst into tears. Had to rinse and repeat, get down. Multiple flights of stairs, people pushing, rude ushers. Classist and ableist, both."
"Banana pancakes, breakfast skillet, waited an hour. Disappointment. Chewy pancakes, flavorless skillet."

"Mid Town Pub, a joint I've hit up often, but now it's time to move on. Last time I ordered the chicken cordon bleu, but what I got was some chicken with a ton of jalapenos. I flagged the mistake, they fixed it quick, but the replacement had ham and was still infused with jalapeno flavor. Didn't touch it, but they charged me anyways. Figured I'd give 'em another shot on my latest visit, but the sandwich was inedible. Way too salty and peppery. One bite and I was done. This kitchen needs some serious help. Peace out, MTP."

"Stayed here with the missus while on business. Had a suite looking out onto the courtyard. Real nice, but the delivery trucks and tour buses made some noise. Two busloads of Japanese tourists, bright and early. Then there was the happy hour, 5:30 to 7:30, free drinks in the breakfast room. Place was packed with old folks, sipping their cocktails and beer. My wife and I shot some pool, good times. Like a nursing home, but livelier."

"Agree with another reviewer - well-intentioned joint. Decor and atmosphere: clean, comfy, inviting. Service: just okay. Food? Not great. Would've planned a return trip if it was better. Excited to hear about the GF options, but they fell short. Ordered Vegetarian Antipasto, Flat bread Trio, Chicken Caesar Salad, and 2 pizzas - all GF. Disappointing. GF crust and flat bread: hard, tasteless. Homemade pizza crust and packaged versions from Whole Foods were way better. Pizza sauce: too sweet. Salad drowning in dressing. Antipasto: flavorless. Flat bread: not good. Dipping sauces: meh. Bummed it wasn't better. Hoping to see improvement on Yelp. Give it another shot sometime? Maybe. Would love to see more healthy, organic restaurants in Henderson."

"I'm a vegetarian, eager to try this spot. But they serve real meat? In a vegan joint? That's a hard pass. My unsweetened iced tea and mango lemonade mix was tasty, though. Side salad with my panini was great. But the panini itself? Disgusting. I could've made a better one at home. The red velvet was decent, but 150 calories and 5 grams of fat? Not worth it. Service was slow, too. Just us and two other tables, but still. Slow food and bad service means I won't be back. Shame, I was really looking forward to it."

"Our waitress, fair maiden, was a woeful sight,
Her service, poor and lacking in delight.
The busboy, a young lad with vigor and cheer,
Didst attend to us with greater zeal, my dear.
I say, give him her position, 'tis only just,
For he didst shower us with love and trust.
The victuals, middling fare, naught to boast,
Overpriced, some might say, yet atmosphere doth cost."

"Twas a feast fit for kings, the ambiance grand,
But alas, the service, woeful and bland.
Alack, the hostess, fair maiden though she be,
Didst seem to care not, as if her soul didst flee.

We entered, and she told us, 'Twas but a moment,
Yet thirty minutes passed, and still no motion.
Our server, slow and dull, didst take his time,
Twenty minutes passed, ere he didst bring the menu, a crime!

And thus, we waited, as the minutes ticked away,
For drinks, for food, for any sign of life, in disarray.
The waiter, scarce seen, didst promise much,
But delivered little, save for a bitter touch.

Ah, what a shame, for the victuals were fine,
The atmosphere, most pleasant, a true divine.
But alas, the service, poor and weak,
Doth mar the experience, and our patience seek.

I would not recommend, this place, my friends,
For though the food be good, the service doth offend."

"Meh. Heard about Buffalo Exchange while comin' back from Santa Barbara. Missed out, but figured there's one in Vegas, might score some designer gear cheap. Walked in, hope crushed. Same crap as Plato's Closet, which I hate. Full of clothes nobody wants, service don't give a damn. Buncha folks waitin' to get told their clothes are junk or they'll offer 'em three bucks for a cashmere sweater if they're lucky. Glance around, see nothin' worthwhile, know not to waste my time at any of their joints."

In sooth, a pair of friends and I did stroll
Down the bustling strip, where noise did flow
From yonder club, whose door did lie
Ajar, revealing music, loud and nigh

We passed by, yet a friend did stop
To purchase brews, a bargain, 'twas not
Two for the price of one, a fair deal
And so we waited, while he did seal

The transaction, when a man did approach
With offers of entry, at a cost, so steep
$15 each, he said, to which we did reply
"No thanks, good sir, we shall not comply"

And thus we walked, a mere five feet more
When he did run, to us once more
"Ten dollars each," he said, with haste
But still we shook our heads, in disdain, so vast

Again he tried, with a further decrease
Five dollars, now, his offer did cease
But still we refused, and left him in the dust
For we had no desire, to be so crushed

At last, he relented, and let us in
For naught, save the music, loud within
We stayed awhile, a half-hour, mayhap more
The drinks were fair, the tunes did soar

Yet, alas, the ladies there, did lack
In charm, and the gents, did seem, so black
Fraternity brothers, cast out, it did appear
So we departed, and ne'er did we draw near

Thus, my dear friends, I would not return
To that place, where mirth did not fully burn
"Three lousy chicken fingers, drowned in a heap of greasy fries. How's that for a rip-off? Nine bucks, and not worth a penny more."
"Inspection and oil change, one guy working alone. Communication, like a cave man. Not going back."

"No reason to eat here for Mexican. Non-descript, no pride in prep or presentation. Just bland. Service good, but that don't make up for bad food. Chips to finale, bad. Noisy too, kids screamin', actin' up. Try Lindo MichoacÃ¡n on Desert Inn. Good, but hope we can find better. Easy three stars."

"A decade past, I didst visit this place,
And savored prime rib, crab, and seafood with grace.
But now, alas! The menu doth bear a change,
With Chinese, Mexican, and fruits in range.
No real potato dishes, save mashed, didst I spy,
And sushi, once a delight, now doth fail to fly.
But still, the prime rib doth please, crab doth abound,
And calamari, a delicacy, doth astound.
Pre-made salads, alack! Doth leave much to be desired,
And my dear husband, a man of meat and fires,
Doth find but little sustenance to assuage his hunger.
A price, I pray, that doth match the selection's lack,
And more sushi, that doth taste of sweetness and delight,
And hot crab, in abundance, doth make all right."

"Loved the old salty senorita. Great burritos, fundido cheese dip, steak salad, margaritas - the works. Never thought a new spot would change things. Ordered an appetizer and margarita, but no frozen machine yet. Understood, new location. Ordered chicken burrito and fajita. Appetizer never came, main course was subpar. Rice was hard, beans were too. Chicken was alright. Asked for hot sauce on the side, they put it in. Needed a drink after that meal, but never got it. Service was mediocre. Bring back my old salty senorita!"

"Fair staff, yet pricey fare, I say,
Pastrami sandwich, a jest, alack!
A place with promise, but nay,
I shall not return, ere long, I pray."

"Chips and fries, good. Menus, scattered. One by door, one behind counter. Should be easy, but no. First time, we order. Hotdog, where? Girl says, behind us. Course it is. No ice, I ask. Refresh, she says. Wait, she says. Cashiers, grumpy."

"Rawhide ain't for everyone. Kids might dig it, but for two grown adults, there ain't much to do. We shelled out five bucks for parking and spent half an hour walkin' around the "town". Took a few pictures, but that's about it. Not worth your time, in my book. Unless you're real big on western stuff, then maybe you'll find it interestin'. But I wouldn't put it high on your to-do list."

"Yogurt joint. Close by. Great price, too. Thirty-five cents an ounce. But when we got there last night at seven twenty-five, it was dark and locked up tight. Called the number on the door and got some bullshit voicemail saying they're open till nine on Saturdays. Left a message asking where the hell they were. Don't know what kind of business these people are running."

"Fie upon this wretched place, where one must wait an age to find a seat! The service here is poor, with nary a soul to clear the tables. The victuals, too, are but mediocre fare. I ordered beef short rib, but alas, 'twas tough and grisly, defying my blade's attempts to cut it. Avoid this den, good sirs and madams, lest ye wish to suffer similar woe. Nay, though the buffet held some promise, the long delay for a clean table doth make it a place to shun."
"Service was slow, real slow. Got there at five, place was dead, still took forever to order. Fish fry cost me 17 bucks. Jesus."

"Wife and I hit this joint for some sandwiches. Thought about Quizno's, but saw this place and gave it a shot. Ordered Chicken Gyro, Chicken Kabob, and Baba Ghanouj to go. Mind wandered to "Kitchen Nightmares" while waiting. When the grub was ready, we grabbed it and took off. Chicken Gyro had big slices, not bad, but could've been thinner. Pita bread was soaked from the tomato and onions. Kabob was a letdown, thick and dry. Expected chunks, not strips. Baba Ghanouj was gross. Tasteless mixture drenched in olive oil. One bite was enough. Best I had was at "Sabuddy" Israeli spot, now closed. Owner went back to New York. Pita bread was solid, though. Next time, I'll stick to in-house orders."

"Went here based on price and reputation. Walk-in only, no appointments. Waited 90 minutes. Didn't specify gender, good thing since I don't care. Told him to focus on neck, shoulder blades, and sciatica. He asked how long for each area and what trigger points for sciatica. Poor time management, didn't know anatomy or terminology, and fussed with sheets too much. Took five tries to get the sheet right. Afterwards, no water or recommendations. Proceed with caution."
"Tuesday, 1:00 pm. No line. Quick service. Chicken wings, ABC burger, strawberry sundae. Huge portions, mediocre taste. Overpriced. Sweet potato fries, enjoyable."

"In-room dining, a bust. Called ahead, asked about wings, price and quantity. They said six for $16 during the day, twelve at night. Ordered at 11 PM, got six. Called again, they said twelve. Put me on hold, came back, said menu changed. Didn't know their own menu. Poor service. Bought two orders, twelve wings for $41. Wouldn't have ordered if they were upfront. Not full, not satisfied. Order in-room dining often, this was bad. Delano, otherwise okay. Less crowded, nice hotel. Quote of the day by the elevators, my favorite."

"Tourist trap. Good location, nice building, overpriced drinks. Chips and salsa, five bucks? Stale chips? Come on. Tortillas, okay. Carne fuego, fire-roasted steak, ruined by gloopy sweet/hot sauce. Veggies, just okay. Sweet potato-stuffed chile, weird. Skip it."

"$185 for a round of golf and the fairways are still covered in grass clippings? Come on, guys. I'm not asking for perfection, but for that kind of cash, I expect a little better maintenance. The greens were slow and the whole course was in pretty rough shape. I get that everyone's going through overseed, but charging top dollar for a subpar experience is a bit rich. Give me We-ko-pa or Troon North any day."

"Service here? So-so at best. Kids behind the counter? Unattentive. Had to shout to get their attention. Location's only saving grace is its spot at the bottom of Las Sendas hill. Otherwise, wouldn't return. Store Manager/Owner, this is your chance to make it right. Fair reviewer here, and this place is the weakest in the Mesa Valley.

Rosatis? Good, but nothing beats Chicago pizza. Water quality out west ain't great. This Rosatis does a decent job though. Kid who took our order was chill, brought it out fast and hot. Sausage? Awesome. Visit this place every time we see Dad/Mom, since they live nearby. Tip? Order extra cheese. Worth it. Grease drips everywhere, especially from the pepperoni."

"Cheap rooms, $35 a night. Fat Tuesdays' giant Everclear drinks, can't recall much after that. Comfy beds, clean. Hairdresser Elvis. 

Resort fee, $5 a night, not included in quote. Two polite staff members. One laughed at friend requesting towels. Far from strip, near downtown Vegas, preferred that. 

Topless pool, full of pro-wrestler types and large women in thongs. If comfortable with your body, go for it. Prefer nicer hotel, better staff, and save on cab fare. 

P.S. Why bring kids to Vegas????"

"Methinks I grow weary of eateries that boast of dishes from afar, yet fail to deliver the authentic flavors they purport to serve. My knowledge of Grecian fare may be limited, but I dare say I've had better than this sorry excuse for a meal. Fresh ingredients, not some wilted leftovers, make the difference, else the patrons shall take their business elsewhere, and the establishment shall suffer the slings and arrows of outrageous fortune."
"Vegas, baby. Glitzy, once. Now, divey. Not easy to navigate. Drive, an option. Airport, meh."

I went in to check the prices and see what they offered. The moment I walked in, a wave of stench hit me. I know having many dogs in a small space won't make it smell like roses, but I'd hope they clean the place occasionally. I asked about a service listed on their flyer and website and was told they don't offer it. Why list it, then? I also didn't like that from the front office, I couldn't see into the area where they kept the dogs, though I could hear them going wild. As I left, I noticed through broken blinds, there were many dogs in a small space with no one around. Side note: the couches in the photos on Yelp looked dangerous, too broken to be safe for dogs. I won't be back or using their home service. It would have been perfect, since I live just a mile away.

"This joint's alright. Food's nothing special, just your typical tropical crap. Atmosphere's like a fancier TGI Fridays, but instead of crappy decor, it's more upscale tropical. Not worth going back to unless someone else is footing the bill."

"A pox upon this place, that erstwhile shone so bright,
Now doth it falter, and its luster doth take flight.
The broth, once rich and savory, doth now run thin,
And portions, once most generous, doth now seem scant within.
The service, too, that doth attend us, doth now lag,
As if the three stars, that once did grace its flag,
Did now desert it, leaving naught but woe and sorrow.
Aye, 'tis time, methinks, to seek a new pho tomorrow."
"Cupcake? More like crapcake. Worst I've ever had. Grocery store cupcakes put this place to shame. Overpriced, like everything else in this city. Shakes, though? Not bad."

"Went to Greenberg's for their famous Pastrami Sandwich. Watched the woman stack it high, my mouth watering in anticipation. But when I bit in, where was that rich Pastrami flavor? It was lost under a layer of salt and mustard. And why was it so fatty? Not what I expected from all the hype. Maybe it was an off day. Will give it another shot, but for now, disappointed."
"Food was too oily. Chicken skin peeling off, strange. Pricey for mediocre Asian-Fusion. Been to better, cheaper places."

"Underwhelming experience, that's for sure. Kid brings water and tea, doesn't know the difference. No straws, that's a pet peeve. Egg rolls taste like perfume. Chicken chow mien is alright, $5.95 for the lunch special. No offer of dessert."

"Tivoli Village, empty as a ghost town. Two women chatting, didn't even notice me walk in. Then, they warmly greeted the folks behind me. Rest of the staff, watched me like a hawk, like I was some kinda thief. Either I was invisible or they thought I was a kid trying to steal their crap. Place sells cheap accessories at inflated prices. Not worth it. Might find something decent on clearance, but never pay full price. It's junk."

"Booking was a mistake. Bathroom's tiny, door opens inward. Power outlets loose, nonexistent elsewhere. Two nights, no service. Called front desk twice to let 'em know we'd be out with the dogs. No luck. Dry cleaning was a joke. Supposed to be ready by 9 am. Nothing at 11. Already two hours behind schedule. Took 45 minutes to get 'em and check out. Lady at front desk? Unpleasant doesn't cover it. Won't be going back."

"Chicken teriyaki bowl, that's the ticket. Forget the rest. I had the tempura and teriyaki combo for lunch, but it wasn't worth the price. A carrot and zucchini, that's what they called tempura. And a shrimp tail, but it wasn't even as big as a pencil. Two CA rolls, but no ginger or wasabi. What's the point? Not worth $10.82. They need better lunch deals."

"A gathering of kin we did convene,
And with great hope, my spirit did gleam.
But alas, the victuals, merely passable they were,
The service, woeful, left much to deplore.

A reservation, we had made with care,
Yet still, the staff did seem unaware.
We waited long, our orders to procure,
Until at last, my husband did ensure.

Wine and water, thrice I did request,
As did others of our merry quest.
But nay, the servers did neglect,
Our thirst, they did not soon inspect.

So to the bar, my spouse did stride,
And served our party, he did provide.
Alack, the evening, it did not bode well,
Our feast, it did not fare so swell."

"Food Lion, southwest corner of Sandy Porter and Tryon. Prices higher than Harris-Teeter, Bi-Lo, Wal-Mart, Super Target. Full grocery selection, including frozen, dairy, produce, beer, wine, meats. Not cheap. MVP shopper loyalty card available, saves you money."

"Dinner was a bust. Waitress forgot some grub and didn't bring my order right. Then she disappeared after bringing the check and refilling our drinks. I had to get up and grab a refill myself. No one cared. New waitress showed up after an hour and offered more drinks, leaving our dirty cups on the table. We weren't asked if we wanted anything else over two hours. And the women's restroom? Two stalls were out of TP. What a mess."

"Tropicana, huh? Yeah, I stopped by a few times. It's alright, I guess. Just your typical resort snack bar stuff, but a bit pricey. Gelato's not bad, but seven bucks for a couple scoops? Nah, man. Bellagio's got better deals. Fro-yo's not bad though. Forty-nine cents an ounce, and some weird flavors. Coconut, peanut butter, cake batter. Never got the fro-yo thing myself. Just makes me want real ice cream."

"Airports, they're all the same. Long lines, dullards running the show, and too many damn slot machines. McCarran's the worst of them all. Security lines a hundred deep, taxi lines just as bad. TSA agents, not the sharpest tools in the shed. Noise, noise, and more noise. Give me a break."

"Hark! All this talk of Tao Beach, a place of wonder, they say. But lo, when I arrived, 'twas naught but a disappointment. A pool, small and shallow, fit for children, not a haven for men. And yet, for women, free of charge, a boon, no doubt. But for the men, a fee to pay, and an open bar, with limitations, alack. Verily, I say, for those who seek a finer experience, look elsewhere, fair sirs. Wet Republic, a better choice, with larger pools, and greater luxury, methinks."

"Food. Just food. That's what The Smithfield Cafe serves up. I had the daily special - two eggs, bacon or sausage, and toast. Sausage was lukewarm, eggs were fine, and the greasy home fries tasted like a dozen other meals. Coffee flowed freely, but lacked flavor. Waitresses were seasoned and typical for their line of work. In summary, meh."

"Place is overpriced for Chinese grub. Dishes average $15-$20. Coffee with boba, soy milk with boba and fruit, $5-$7. Menu's got beef, pork, soup, rice, noodles. But no signature dishes like pan-fried noodles or combo plates. Decor's cool, service is meh. Food's fresh though. Handmade noodles in chow fun, that's the best. Salt and pepper shrimp, good too. Family style servings, but portions are small."

"Cut outta there when I realized I could do better than a hundred bucks a night. Place was stuck at the end of the strip, casino was mediocre, rooms were straight outta '97, and the whole joint smelled like that damp towel you forget in the hamper for two weeks. Two stars, tops. Girl came up to our group, tried to pick us up, then stumbled off with a dude's shoe print on her leg. Classy."

"I read the other reviews and wonder if we dined at the same joint. I get two spicy tuna rolls with brown rice. Flavorless, like Elmer's paste. Maybe I picked wrong. Seemed like a good idea at the time."

"Verily, a fair price doth this lodging boast,
Clean, comfortable, modern, in a prime location, to say the least.
Free wifi, a passable gym, what more couldst thou seek?
A fire pit outdoors, a menu most choice and unique.

But lo, a warning must be told,
For those who crave a peaceful rest, beware the noise so bold.
The nightclubs nearby, they do disturb the peace,
Even on a Tuesday eve, their din doth never cease.
A weekend's clamor, I dare not think,
So disruptive, so vexing, a stay here I cannot link."

"I'm from San Diego, love all things Mexican, and fish tacos are essential. But this joint? More trendy than good. Got my tacos, looked decent, but the fish was breaded at the restaurant. Why bother? The fish was alright, but I got pieces. Typically, if you cut it right, no pieces. The batter was meh, and I've had better fish sticks from Gorton's. Flavorless. Seemed like they just decorated, but I felt like I got leftovers. Looking elsewhere for fish tacos. If you're in San Diego, try Rubio's. Fast food, but they know what to serve and what not to. Cabo's didn't feel that way. Could've gotten the same dinner for half the price with more flavor."
"Food's good. Had bibimbap. Service? Shit. Terrible. Can't believe how bad. Forced 18% tip. No way I'm going back."

"Went on the 28th, December 2014. All good, 'cept the steak. Not the quality I'd hoped for. Been to plenty of steakhouses, know my way 'round a good cut. This joint? Overpriced. Oysters, though? Not bad."

"Methinks 'tis time to pen a new review,
For this place hath changed, I do declare,
Since first I came, in year of '09,
It doth not taste the same, alas, no more.

I shall be brief, for those who shun
The written word, and make my meaning plain.
The burger, once a savory delight,
Hath lost its zest, and doth not please.

Aye, though they offer much in the way
Of toppings, naught can hide the foul play
Of dry, dull beef. Oh, Cheeburger, shame!
Even Chili's hath its own name.

I was dismayed, upon my return,
But now, I care not, for I shall not burn
My taste buds thusly again, no more.
Farewell, Cheeburger, adieu!"

"Place was decent. Never been here before, surprisingly. Hit the buffet, $8.50 with soda, give or take. Reminded me of Shakey's, but not quite up to par. Like Chuck E. Cheese, but a step above. Salad bar was basic, but I liked the peperoni. Pasta was spaghetti and elbow macaroni, two sauce options. Ragu, but a bit better. Chicken and potato wedges were the same, tasted the same too. First round, no pizza. Second round, pizza was mediocre, pre-cooked sausage, lots of grease. If I had kids, might come back after sports games, otherwise, no plans to return."

"Arrived in Madison, tired from travel. Hungry, needed a hot meal. Looked for veggie-friendly delivery. Found Nepalese place near hotel. Prices seemed steep, but I figured portions would be big. Ordered soup, got a small cup for over $10. Didn't order anything else. Still hungry. Bummed out."

"Echo Canyon renovation? More like desecration. Used to be my go-to trail, now it's a disappointment. Parking's a nightmare, worse than before. Went on a Thursday afternoon, park rangers still turning folks away. Barricade's a joke, only lets in five cars at a time, blocks the main road. Poor planning, if you ask me. Trail itself? Stairs are gone, replaced with steep gravel. Slippery as hell, not good for the out-of-shape crowd. Dogs? Forget about it, not allowed no more. Shame, really. Echo Canyon's lost its charm."

"Chinese takeout joint. Hard to find good one. This place, Hoho Cherry House. Used to be Hoho China Bistro, but it moved. Lunch specials, decent value. Food, average. General Tso's, okay. Like Panda Express, but family-owned. Expected more. Not bad, but nothing special."

"People only review chains when they've had a real good or real bad experience. This one's a bad one. Wanted to try their pumpkin spice latte, but whatever they gave me didn't have no pumpkin flavor. My friend, who's had it before, agreed after takin' a sip. Didn't find much wrong with it, but the lack of pumpkin's a big minus, specially since it's a seasonal thing. Sorry, folks."
"Drive-thru's a drag. They botch my joe every time. Good spot, couple swell baristas, but they can't salvage a crappy five-buck latte. I'll take my business to Sbucks, Trop and Fort Apache."

"Verily, the victuals were most excellent, a true delight for mine taste buds. 'Twas summer, and the tavern didst have but six patrons, two of whom were regulars, and, alas, quite inebriated. The gentlewoman didst converse at full volume, her voice carrying throughout the establishment. Methinks these folk doth frequent this place e'er night, and find solace in their revelry. As for myself, I shall not return till the birds do sing once more, and the ambient noise doth drown out these rowdy patrons. Nay, I know not what course of action V's shouldst take, save perhaps to cease serving those who hath had too much ale."

"O, how I detest this update to write,
For 'twas a place I held in high delight.
Apple Spice, thy name doth now connote
A series of mistakes, a woeful plight.

Three times, they've failed to get it right,
Ten lunches, a simple task, yet still they fight.
Bread bowls, small containers of soup,
And bread, a meager serving, doth not suffice.

The southwestern salad, sans cheese, I did request,
Yet chicken, it did contain, a thing most vexing.
A sandwich, not a wrap, did Heather receive,
And cookies, juice, both absent, did she perceive.

Replaced were the mistaken items, 'tis true,
But the delay, an hour, did my hunger accuse.
Expensive, the Southwestern, not worth the fee,
And mistakes, thrice, doth Apple Spice decree.

Alas, I must bid thee adieu,
For thy mistakes, they do my patience undo."

"Yalla opened near my house, and I was stoked. We needed a solid Mediterranean spot, and it being owned by Khoury's, my favorite, was a bonus.  Ordered a few things - roasted chicken sandwich, Fatoush salad with chicken, beef kabobs. Rice was top-notch, crispy noodles, light oil. Hummus, too. Fatoush, tasty. Hubby, no complaints on the sandwich. But, some issues. Billed wrong, cashier apologetic but still overcharged me. Pita bread, not great either. Back though? Yeah."

"Update: Went back, waited ten minutes behind another customer at the counter without a word from the cashier. Woman couldn't get her order together, and we were ignored. Left. Awful service. Cashier should've acknowledged us, offered to start our order while the customer ran out to her car. Nothing. Awful. Went to Osaka across the street."

"Went with a Chinese friend. She ordered in Chinese, shouted at the waiter when she didn't like the look of it. Food was exceptional. Best Chinese in Central Illinois, but that's not saying much. Couldn't recreate the experience though. Asked her to write me a note in Chinese for the same dishes. Showed it to the waiter when I went alone, but it wasn't the same. Expect it was the shouting. Now that she's gone, it'll never be that good again. Without her, it's just a mediocre joint."

"Pros: Fast, friendly service. Comfortable beds. Nice tub, though small.

Cons: Unfriendly staff at check-in. No outlets by the bed. No freezer, only a fridge. No vending machines. Complicated room controls. Bathroom sinks are a mess.

Reminds me of The Hotel, but I prefer The Hotel to Aria."

"Been to one other Brazilian steakhouse before, in Dallas. That one was damn good. Not the case with Braza's. Food didn't taste fresh, like it'd been sitting under a warmer too long. Meats were just alright. Flank steak was good, chicken was good, sirloin was okay but bland, pork was good, lamb was okay, alligator (yep, alligator) was decent. First time tryin' it. \nAtmosphere was a letdown. Website made it look like a fancy 4 or 5-star place, but it was more like a Golden Corral inside. Not exactly a place to impress the missus. Plus, it smelled like an Indian restaurant, since it's split in half - Indian on one side, Braza's on the other. Service was good though. Friendly staff, wanted us to have a good time. Pricing was around $40-45 per person. Felt like I could do better elsewhere for that price."
"Manager's not too keen on helping out at Petco. They never got what I needed in stock. Closer to home than PetsMart, but after three strikes, I'm switching to the competition."

"Great expectations, based on reviews. Seated quick, but waiter acted like we were inconveniencing him. Ordered scampi, slightly overcooked, burnt tails, good pasta and sauce. Friend ordered cod, extremely overcooked, asked for new piece. Waiter whined to coworkers that we sent food back. Won't be going back, will discourage friends."

"Went to this joint 'cause Island Style was shut down for renovations. Seen it around, thought I'd give it a shot. Glad I did, 'cause now I know never to come back. Don't care about the exterior, judging 'em on grub and service. First off, had to ask for the lunch menu - not offered. Service was alright, but the food? Chinese food should pop with flavor, fresh veggies, vibrant colors. This was none of that. Had the pork and tofu hot pot - plain and boring, lots of pork, iceberg lettuce? Ordered the shrimp pan-fried noodles too...bland, just wasn't good. Figure the chefs here don't give a damn no more. All in all, underwhelming experience. Nothing special about the service, and the food? Forget about it."

"Food's good, but servers don't know squat. Ask 'em about the menu, they just shrug and stammer. 'Kenyan food? Like American food.' 'Menudo?' Blank stare. Nice atmosphere, though. Shame about the staff."

"All You Can Eat Sushi for $19.95? Don't expect much. I didn't, and that's exactly what I got - bland sushi with too much rice. My friend's miso soup was huge, though. I skipped the sushi and went for the Ah Sin Fried Rice (flavorless) and Har Gow (decent, but not great). And they have the nerve to charge $8 for a pot of hot tea that serves five."

"O La Condesa, I yield, thy service doth vex me so. Methinks 'tis slow and heedless, they do not care, I'll spend my coin elsewhere, farewell! Our victuals too, didst disappoint, the horchata, watery and flavorless, we sent it back, and thou didst bring new cups, with crema poured upon my torta, how shall I lift it and consume it? Alas, in days past, we pardoned grimy tables and loud din, for thy cochinita pibil, a culinary delight, yet now, 'tis not enough, adieu!"

"Prices on meat and fish are damn good here. That's why I come. Produce is mediocre, but I buy milk often 'cause it's always on sale. Can't pass up the deals on meat and fish, though. Buy one, get one or two, you know? 

Service, though...total shit. Cashiers are slow and rude. Don't even acknowledge you most times. Checkout takes forever. 

Still, I'll keep an eye on their ads and come back for the sales. Just glad this ain't my only grocery option."

"Don's my cup of tea, too Yuppie. Atmosphere's too sanitized, servers got no personality. Food's fair, but not worth the price. Where's the red sauce? I'm Italian, I need red. Ordered from the Small Bits Menu, thought it'd be a light lunch. It was small, alright. Needed more bread just to feel like I ate somethin'. If you wanna be full, get the dinner menu. Most folks are more sophisticated than me, they can figure out the fancy California stuff."

"Alack, my breakfast and my loves didst lack,
In flavor and in zest, they didst not pack.
The waffles, once a treat, now doth seem tame,
And pancakes, with their lemon, didst not proclaim.
Their look, a feast for eyes, didst make me smile,
But, alas, their taste didst leave me vile.
I shall not return, forsooth, to this place,
Where flavors doth lack and love doth race."

"Avoid this joint like the plague, folks. Smells like cheap teen perfume up in here. Overpriced goods and dim-witted staff. But hey, not all bad - decent men's sweatpants to be found. Just don't pay full price, and wash 'em good when you get home. They'll reek like their cologne otherwise."
"Fifty bucks for a ribeye, and the knife's dull as a butter knife. Sawing through it like a damn amateur. That's my memory of this joint."
"Tamales, that's what I came for. But, damn, they were a letdown. Lukewarm, flavorless, and poorly prepared. Service? Forget about it. El Sombrero, that's where I should've gone."

"Played 13 holes in 3 hours, waited 5 min per hole. Staff was nice, but slow. Greens were good, but that's about it. Not worth $30. Golf snob, maybe. But when I pay that much and can't even finish a round, it's a problem."

"Food? Forgettable. Service, now that's a different story. Our server, a gem. Two steaks, medium rare, one cooked medium-well, the other, blue rare. Raw, practically. Noise and bustle, but our server, top-notch. Time, we had little, but she tried her best to fix the mess."

"Hark, good sir or madam, pray tell me this:
Why doth it seem, no matter the hour of day,
That waiting time doth stretch and never pass?
Methinks 'tis due to lack of staff, they say.

A plague upon this woeful wait, I pray!
How vexing it doth be, to stand and stay,
When hasty feet do eagerly await
Their turn, to dine within this hall of play.

Oh, wouldst thou, management, take heed
And hire more folk, to speed the deed?
Forsooth, 'twould ease the burden, and make merry
The hearts of those who doth await their turn so dreary."

"Verily, I concur with many a review I've perused upon this site. 'Tis not the Wahoo's of yore, in fair California. The fish, alas, doth lack the moisture of days past, and the green sauce they proffer doth resemble a wretched mixture of sour cream and herbs. 

I have visited this establishment several times, and on one occasion, a certain bartender didst leave much to be desired. Her name escapes me, but her manner of service didst not. Whilst watching a fight in a mostly empty bar, she didst arrive on her shift and turn down the volume on the telly, changing the channel to some base reality show. I requested its return, but my plea didst fall upon deaf ears. 

On at least two other eves, her service didst suffer, forsooth, due to her being overly engrossed in conversation with a patron, leaving us neglected and unserved. I didst finally inform her that we wouldst depart without payment, that she might attend to her duties. 

Beware this place, good sirs and madams, lest ye desire a mediocre fish taco with scant regard for service."

"We hit up this market, a Best of Las Vegas joint, for breakfast on a recent morning. It was like a cheaper Whole Foods. We ordered at the counter and chilled at a table in the piano room till the grub arrived. We got some easy over eggs with bacon, wheat toast, and home fries. The ingredients were solid, but the prices were steep and the cooking was subpar. The toast was soft, the bacon was soggy, the potatoes were tired, and the egg whites were watery."

"Alack, what woeful fate didst lead me here,
To this most vile and wretched place, so dear?
A buffet, they called it, with a spread so wide,
But all the world's cuisine, could not hide,
The bitter taste of disappointment, that doth cling,
Like a dark cloud, to my soul, and doth sting.

The price, so steep, the food, but mediocre,
And service, poor, with nary a endearing feature.
Our waitress, fair, but distant, cold,
Didst pour our juice, then vanished, like a ghost, so bold.

A sense of dejavu, that doth haunt me still,
For I have been, to this same buffet, at will.
At Aladdin, it was, in days of yore,
But now, at Planet Hollywood, 'tis a bore.
No line, didst form, for this most wretched feast,
For all, didst know, its quality, so least.

Oh, how I wish, I hadst not come,
To waste my brunch, on such a sorry sum.
But alas, 'tis done, and now I must,
Endure the memory, of this most foul and unjust."

"Alas, my friends, I must confess,
The rolled tacos, once a dish of finesse,
Have lost their luster, nay, their charm,
In this, my second visit to the farm.

Their middles, once so crispy and light,
Now lay flat, devoid of delight,
And some, I fear, did not even meet
The fryer's embrace, so faint and weak.

The guacamole, once a creamy treat,
Now lacked the zest that made it sweet,
And cheese, that golden, melted crown,
Was absent, leaving the tacos unadorned.

I prithee, good sirs, what sorcery is this?
A price so steep, it doth surpass
The worth of five such tacos, elsewhere found,
For six and fifty cents, with tax profound.

Alas, no potion, neither ale nor wine,
Could salvage this dish, so poorly divine.
Not worth the cost, I must declare,
This taco, once a joy, now but a snare."

"O, fair Aureole! How lovely art thou to behold,
Thy victuals, most divine! Yet, alas, thy service doth falter,
Like a ship without a rudder, lost at sea.
Reservations made at nine and thirty, we didst arrive,
And waited, waited, waited, for our turn to dine.
The waiter, he didst disappear, leaving us to ponder,
Their tablet, broken, with nary a drop of wine to savor.
He returned, some twenty minutes passed, with a scowl upon his face,
As if we were to blame for the device's disgrace.
Then, four times, he warned us, 'We'll be closing soon,'
As if we were not aware, the hour grew late, the moon full.
Food, oh food, how magnanimous! So very, very good!
But, alas, the pressure, to hasten and depart, didst leave a foul mood.
No more, dear Aureole, shall we return, forsooth!"

"Terrible's, just down the road from my place. Stop in for a cold one on my way home. Car wash? Once. Overpriced and underwhelming. Gas? Nah, too expensive. Convenience store? Decent selection, fair prices. Beer cave? Best in town, hands down. Parking lot? A pain, but worth it. Employees? Minimum wage, minimum effort. Still, it's my go-to spot."
"Good eatery, usually. Tonight? Forget it. Group dinner, shitty service. First waiter, space cadet. Second waitress, sourpuss. Grub, meh. Used to be better."

"Werner Enterprises truckers come here. I'm one of 'em. It's got the essentials we need. I've seen worse digs. If you're looking for luxury, keep moving. Two-star joint at best. Plenty of grub nearby though."

"This joint's got nothinâ€?special goinâ€?on. Foodâ€™s alright, I guess, but the service is slower than a snail on a hot summer day. And donâ€™t even get me started on the seating arrangement. Itâ€™s like they gotta cram as many tables in here as possible, so youâ€™re practically eatinâ€?off the same plate as the folks next to you. Not exactly the most pleasant dinninâ€?experience, if ya know what I mean."
"Food was fair, not the best. Haven't been there in near a year. Bill came, understood why. Two-fifty for OJ, no free refills. Food was passable, but better elsewhere."

"Craved wings, drove for 'em. Good, but rubs too salty. Had Louisiana, Parmesan Garlic. Ate Louisiana, not Parmesan. Parmesan cheese smelled like spoiled dishrag. Stunk up my ride home. Tossed it straight in the trash. Won't be back. Staff got no sense of smell?"

"First buffet in years, and it was a mistake. My boys and I wanted a pre-sin city feast, and this was the closest joint with a short line. But the price? Ridiculous. Could've gotten a 24-hour pass for that kind of dough. 

Waited a few minutes for our table, then our server took our orders. Limited selection, but I made the most of it. Kobe beef, prime rib, short rib tacos, sushi, beef Wellington. Dessert? Mini churros and vending machine ice cream. 

Pros: short rib tacos, sushi. Cons: dry grilled meats, beef Wellington, hard mini churros, bland ice cream. Server was helpful, but got our drinks wrong. Left full, disappointed, unsatisfied."

"Told to check out this Vegas buffet, I regret I did. Two types of folks: buffet lovers and those who don't. I'm the latter. Reminds me of college mess halls. Still, we went for Saturday brunch. Variety seemed decent - Asian, Italian, seafood, pizza, breakfast. Omelet was the highlight. Rest was meh, limited by no meat. Desserts looked nice, but didn't impress. Fiance was adventurous, thought food was mediocre. We'd prefer a better restaurant, less food."

"Rave reviews, huh? Crowded, you say? What the hell, I thought. Pros: cheap. Cons: subpar food, undercooked pork, fake cheese enchiladas, stale marshmallows. And don't even get me started on the freakishly obese people. Woman, that was your fifth cotton candy."

"Staff's friendly in person, but over the phone, they don't give a damn. They'll call you in early, switch doctors on you, and the office is a mess. I tried to avoid 'em, but they wouldn't respond to my refill requests, so I had to go in person. They told me I needed to come in every three months, but when I pushed back, they caved and gave me my script. They're just trying to milk your insurance for all it's worth. I'm back to hoping I never have to step foot in that place again."

"Methinks I didst try this takeaway of late,
On Monday last, with eager expectation.
Kung Po chicken, I didst order, with haste,
But found it not to my liking, in sooth.

The chicken, breaded it was, and the sauce,
Sticky and sweet, like a sour sauce, perchance?
Authentic Chinese, it didst not resemble,
And the price, it didst exceed my reckoning.

Alas, I shall not return to this place,
For Leith Walk's takeaways, hold my grace.
Therefore, good sirs, heed my words of woe,
And seek thy meals from elsewhere, anon."

"Pancho Villa's been kickin' around for a bit, gets enough business to keep the lights on, but I ain't exactly sure why. Had better chili at other joints, and Illegal Jack's too. Enchiladas and fajitas? Meh, they were lackin' somethin'. Friend told me they make a killer margarita, but if I gotta be drunk to enjoy the grub, ain't worth the restaurant prices."
"Pizza wasn't half bad, but the deal stunk. Prices always steep at Dominos. Medium 2-topper a raw deal. Low rating for price versus quality, value."

"Pool's clean, architecture's neat. But why concrete the deckin' in this heat? Slippery, hot. Someone slipped, hit their head, ambulance came. Lifeguards outnumber guests three to one. When someone gets hurt, all guards blow whistles, corral everyone outta the pool, no exceptions. Not even for kids or towels. Ridiculous. Won't be back."

"Methinks this eatery doth charge o'er much for its fare,
Despite the waiter's courtesy and the victuals being fair.
A hundred dollars per plate, and wine at ninety,
Doth warrant a feast most sumptuous and of high quality.
But lo, the dishes came forth barely warm or cold,
And portions small, leaving patrons feeling quite old.
Two unisex privies they had, yet after a wait,
Many did leave, their bladders to relieve in haste.
The presentation of the food, a pleasing sight,
Yet, alas, the rest, but average in truth and might."
"Service was a bust. Girl behind counter gave me the cold shoulder. Treated others with a smile, but not me. What did I do to deserve the frost?"

"Mac n cheese, fish, side salads, clam chowder. Salads came first, then soup, then Mac. We joked about the appetizer thing. Our entrees arrived, lots of plates. Waiter cracked a joke.
