I gave him a look. Three servers, food runners, refills, grabbing salt and pepper, no leadership. Good deco, good food. Giving them another shot. Service needs work. POS system should track food timing. Miscommunication between servers and cooks, management problem."

"This joint used to be a solid first stop in Vegas, but it's gone downhill fast. Took us 27 minutes just to get our drink order taken. Ordered everything at once to avoid missing the waiter again. Menu's been narrowed down, and the choices ain't as good no more. Had the bbq chicken flatbread, but it was all dark meat and half of it was inedible. Maybe their burgers are okay, but they messed up this dish. Management's got issues, which trickles down to the staff and customers suffer. Won't be going back, but hope they shape up for future visitors."
"I requested delivery. No issues, arrived in 30-40 minutes. Just ordered rolls. Salmon was flavorless, California rolls were mediocre. Paid the delivery woman, she left without a word. Meh."
"Pho? Don't know what that is. Smells off, tastes worse. Asked for extra veggies, got less than usual. Seat's torn up, feels like sitting on razor blades. Not worth it."

"Mexican joint, Phoenix. Unremarkable. Subpar grub. Two enchiladas, one chicken, one beef. Meh. Dark brown sauce, questionable. Beef sauce, forgettable. Tacos, no bueno. Dead Friday at 12:30pm. Punch machines idle, kiddo scootering, skeleton crew. Doubtful about their future."

"Been here twice. Service stinks. Slow as hell. Don't know if they're short-staffed or what, but it's painful. Food's mediocre. Bar food, nothing special. Could be great, but they gotta step up their game. Competition's fierce next door."

"Singing cooks mean savory grub. Staff treats you like family. Decor's a bit drab, but potential abounds. 

Fresh pico de gallo's got spice, but saltiness overpowers. Corn chips suffer. 

Flour tortillas, six ingredients. Simple. Guacamole shouldn't contain milk. Rice, too small, dries fast. Cheese crisp lacks crunch. Green chili strips, fresh. 

Decor needs work. Beer flags, mariachi hats, throw rugs, caballeros, and damas don't cut it. Mirrored walls scream '80s. 

Note my corn allergy limits menu options. Great local vibe. Facelift needed."

"Espresso's too damn pricey here. I mean, it's just too much. Went to Handsome Roasters, had a double pulled by the owner himself, and it was still cheaper than JPH. That's wild, right? LA's got some crazy prices. Went to Barista in Portland, had a double from an award-winning barista, and it was still cheaper. Same with Coava, Stumptown, and The Refinery. They're all fancy, but not as expensive as JPH. Just saying, you guys are kinda pretentious, but I still like to come here and blow some cash every now and then. Maybe it's the rent, maybe it's all the college kids with trust funds or loans feeding their coffee habits. Let's be real, yeah? PS - Love that you guys serve LADRO, haven't seen 'em in a while. They're cute."

"Blue Wasabi. Avoid it. Inflated reviews, average food. Good service, sure. Decent drinks, too. But, for the price, you get mediocre sushi. Not worth it. Sushi on Shea and Kyoto, now those are good eats. Cheaper, too. Don't waste your cash on the scene at Blue Wasabi. You'll regret it."

"Friday night, around 9, I stopped by. Place was dead, few people, and seemed like they were shorthanded. No hostess, just two servers for the whole joint. My guy was good though, top-notch. Food? Not so much. Lemon sole, side salad, that's it. Twenty bucks with tax and tip. Salad, fresh, crisp. Sauce, tasty. Fish, not good. Told the server, offered to replace it, but didn't feel like waiting. Supposed to be sautÃ©ed, chef don't know how to cook fish. Fried, crispy, tough. Sole's a tender fish, doesn't need much cooking. Disappointed, wouldn't recommend it. Bread's good, but that's it. Expensive meal, not worth it. Go somewhere else."

"Verily, I do declare, this place doth get much praise,
But in my eyes, 'tis naught but filth and disarray.
The service slow, the food most foul and greasy,
A place where one wouldst not wish to dine, I pray thee.

The salsa, not fresh, doth lack all flavor,
And guacamole, a tasteless mush, they call it savor.
Tortilla chips, with package cheese, they do profane,
A travesty, a mockery, of Mexico's noble name.

A taco salad, I did attempt to consume,
But lo, the taste, it did my senses overcome.
In truth, a place for those who crave quick, bad fare,
But for myself, I shall not darken their door again, I swear."

"Manager says he's gonna treat himself to Blueberry Hill. I near fall outta my chair. Seen my review on Flamingo? Terrible! But he insists, says it's 10,000 times better on Green Valley Parkway. I shrug, go back to work. Today, I need somethin' to get the creative juices flowin', so I figure, why not? Get to Blueberry Hill, order the same as before - Mexican-style chilaquiles and a Diet Pepsi. Same plate of mediocrity. Don't see how folks rave 'bout these places. Service a little faster, but still not sold. Stickin' with Denny's for comfort food."

"Ribs were small, even for babybacks. Brisket was too dry. Pulled chicken, pork, and sausage were meh. Sausage tasted store-bought. Fries had some skin, but were mediocre. Better BBQ can be found in NW Phoenix."

"Fremont Street dive, near Golden Nugget. Seen better days. 

Go for the deep fried Twinkies, 99 cents. Not good for me, but can't resist. Could use a cleaner deep fry station and friendlier service. Rude comment about tips, so I'll leave 10%. 

Slot machines don't work, staff not happy. Would be better without gambling. Good for slushy drinks and deep fried Twinkies, but avoid gambling."
"Coffee's decent, but service is lacking. Been here plenty, various times of day. Attempted small talk with baristas, got brief replies. Coffee and grub? Standard Starbucks fare."

"Ate at the seafood buffet tonight. Not worth the price. Steamed crab legs were alright. Crab legs in sweet chile sauce were better. Cold crab legs by the seafood were a bit salty. Lobster tails were small and rubbery. Everything tastes better drowned in garlic butter. 

Best part was the desserts. Green tea cheesecake was nice and light. Creme brulee was perfect. Bread pudding with vanilla spice sauce was great. Red velvet cupcakes were dry and terrible. 

Buffet is overrated. Go elsewhere. Not kid-friendly. Seating is tight. One star for food and options. Another for excellent service. Rest didn't live up to the hype."

"Underwhelmed. Got there around four, only one table occupied. Exterior looked promising, but inside felt like a tattoo artist's bedroom. Took a while for someone to come out and seat us, not a great start. Salsa bar had variety, but was set up poorly. Containers too small, had to use plastic spoons. No metal utensils or plates provided, table was a mess before we ordered. Tacos arrived, both plates had cracks. Smoked marlin tasted like canned tuna, veggies were okay. Corn tortillas flimsy, like store-bought. Service was meh, questions met with finger-pointing and blank stares. All in all, should've gone to Chipotle."

"Methinks 'twas once a place most fair and bright,
Whereon I spent my Sundays in joy and delight.
A group of friends, we'd gather round,
And laughter flowed like wine, without a bound.

But now, alas! The food, once rich and fine,
Hath lost its luster, and doth leave me cold.
The service, too, hath suffered, I do find,
And prices risen, like a tempest-tossed sea.

Yet still, the happy hour doth hold its charm,
With prices fair, and food not altogether harm.
'Tis sad, indeed, to see a place so dear,
In decline, like autumn leaves that wither and fear.

But still, I'll cherish memories of days gone by,
And hope that someday, it may regain its high estate, and nigh."
"Food joint's a real gimmick, if you ask me. Rent-an-express, that's what they call it. But hey, the grub's just alright, nothing special."

"Place was nothing special. I wasn't too hungry, still feeling the effects of a wild night before. Got the breakfast buffet for $15, pretty standard for Vegas. Pizza was a highlight, but everything else was just eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns. Made it 3/4 through a plate before I felt sick. Service was good though, waitress gave me two big glasses of OJ. If you're staying at Planet Hollywood, it's not a bad option. But I'd go for Le Village Buffet in Paris instead."

"A cockroach emerged from yonder sprout dish,
And with its presence, did my appetite dismiss.
I slew the beast, and with some hesitation, stayed,
Their apologies were many, and my meal they repaid.
My to-go dinner, too, they gave without a fray,
But now, alas, I fear I must seek fare elsewhere,
For though 'twas once my favorite pho diner,
I shall now journey forth to Chinatown, fairer."

"Strippers. Funny as hell, trying to be sexy. But forget it if we ain't interested. Guy named Chili. Ugly bastard. Kept offering deals for a dance. None of us wanted. Some other dancers were cool, though. Met a dude from San Jose. Pretty funny. But seriously, no seats in the main room for the girl dancers? What the hell? We kept getting invited to join bachelor parties, but we didn't want to sit with them. Saw some guy getting a hand job from an ugly stripper. Hilarious."

"Pasqual's salsa, man. Mild, medium, hot - it's all good. They used to call themselves a "salsaria." It's like the salsa makes me wanna dance, even though I got two left feet and no idea what salsa dancing is. That's how good it is. But today, man, I'm disappointed. Big plate of nachos, tiny little cup of salsa. Same thing last time, so we ordered extra, but still, just a tiny cup. Chicken, beef, nachos, tacos - three stars, tops. But the salsa, man... it's the real deal. Give me more."

This eve, I dined with kin, and chose the twain's feast,
For twenty dollars, a fair price, I thought.
The guacamole, a tasty treat, did please,
With tortilla chips, and corn, a wondrous sight.
But lo, the first bite brought a fiery blast,
Jalapenos, aplenty, did set my taste ablaze.
My steak, well-done, as requested, did arrive,
But burnt, alas, on one side, did it survive?
Mashed potatoes, loaded, a delightful dish,
Broccoli, foul-tasting, with strange, rancid wish.
Service, poor, as usual, did mar my cheer,
And now, alas, I vow, ne'er to return here.

"Fie upon this wretched place, where service doth crawl
At snail's pace, leaving us to languish, parched and faint
For hours we waited, nay, didst beg for sustenance
But naught arrived, save bitter disappointment
And when at last the bill didst come, 'twas with such speed
As if they sought to fleece us of our coin, ere we couldst depart
A pox upon this den of sloth and neglect
We shall not darken thy doorstep again, thou cursed pit."

"Terrible. A capital 'B' Bad. 

Pizza we got? Guy who cooked it? Never been to NY/NJ. Ever. 

Half meatball. Half pepperoni. Looked nothing like menu. Twice the price. Thick crust. Tomato paste. Overcooked cheese. Not meatballs. Ground beef. 

Really bad. Wanted another NY style spot. Doesn't cut it. Sticking to regular places. 

Sandwiches? Other dishes? Could be good. But Streets of NY? Good pizza pie? Nope."

"Ran through the drive-thru, first mistake. Girl at the window, clueless about the menu. Finally got my order, pulled ahead, waited. Anticipation building. Smelled onion rings on the way home, couldn't figure it out till I got there. Bag of ice cream, greasy and flavored the ice cream. No good. Salvageable ice cream, too sweet. Had to stop, fearing a diabetic coma. Quickly downed water. Meh, never again."

"Food, a tricksome thing, doth oft deceive,
Piccatta, my usual choice, yet once, alas!
Their veal, so tough, it did my teeth oppress,
And thus, I do conclude, the fare is not the best.

The price, too high, doth make me wondrous,
For what doth one pay, but not in worth receive?
Atmosphere, the only charm, doth please,
But staff, in need of upgrade, doth slack.

In personality, service, knowledge, all,
Do lack, and thus, doth make the place dull.
Asked for a mojito, bartender, in dismay,
Did say, "I cannot," and thus, did play.

Manager, with hair of gold, and fair of face,
Did come, and with a smile, did take his place.
I mentioned mint, and he, in haste, did say,
"We have it fresh, and thus, it shall be made."

And thus, my drink, a mojito, was brought,
Yet, left me wondering, if the bartender thought,
"Could not," or "would not," for her skill,
In making drinks, did seem to lack, and still.

Last June, a party of sixteen, I did make,
A reservation, too, a week in advance, forsooth!
Waiter and busser, threw the bread, and hid,
And thus, we suffered, thirsty, and quite chid.

One waiter, good, we had, in three whole years,
And that, because I spoke, and loudly shed tears.
He, the manager, did hear, and thus, did say,
"Make a reservation, and your meal, I pray."

And thus, we dined, in luxury, and delight,
Yet, still, the staff, doth leave much to be desired, in sight."

"Walked into the joint, no one said a word. Two people stood there, one looked me dead in the eye, said nothing. Other woman mumbled a greeting after I stared at the menu long enough. Ordered the number two special, pizza, salad, drink for six bucks. Pizza sauce too sweet, dough soggy. Salad decent, just lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, balsamic dressing."

"A decent place, indeed, with TVs and outdoor seating,
And a roll of paper towels at every table, neatly arranged.
I am a fan of pizza and beer, 'tis true,
But alas, the beer is draft, and not meant for takeout, anew.
They have wine, as well, for those who prefer,
Their appetizers seem fair, but I didst not partake,
For I had the pizza, with vegetables upon it,
Which was but mediocre, I do confess.
Nothing too special here, I do declare,
Perhaps 'tis the location that doth make it fair."

"Hark! From San Gabriel Valley, I do hail,
Where dim sum dishes be of highest quality, by jail!
And thus, my standards be set high, ye see,
For such fare to please my taste buds, 'tis plain to see.

But alack! This restaurant, oh how it did fail,
With microwaved grub, and nary a flavor to sail!
The Har Gow and Shau Mai, their skins did melt,
Like snow in sunshine, they did lose their charm, and felt.

The white rice cake dessert, that sweet delight,
Did fall apart, like a tower in flight.
Overcooked, lacking zest, the dishes did seem,
A sorry state, for one who doth seek a culinary dream.

In Vegas, perchance, this place may serve its purpose,
For those who crave dim sum, in a city of endless service.
But I, a son of San Gabriel, do swear,
Never to return, for there's naught to fear."

Alas, my humble abode didst catch fire,
And I, with mine own daughter and two felines,
Didst seek refuge in this temporary lodging.
I prayed for a chamber, handicapped-friendly,
For my knee, alas, had given me much trouble.
The neighborhood, fair readers, doth leave much to be desired,
And the trains, they doth make a mighty racket.
But lo, the bathing chamber, with its sturdy bars,
Didst provide me comfort, and eased my weary legs.
In sooth, were I to do it anew,
I wouldst choose the Scottsdale inn, without hesitation.

"Place looks good inside and out. Not packed on a Friday night, so we sat on the heated patio. Started off well, good bread and fresh salads. Went downhill from there. Spanakopita starter was decent, three big pieces, but too much cream cheese. Missed the light phyllo crust. Regular gyro and chicken gyro were nothing special. Fries and rice were unimpressive. Service was good, but I won't be back."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, heed my words of cheer,
For in Scottsdale Quarters, hidden they do appear.
Next to Tanzy and iPic, seek them thou must,
And do not yield, for perseverance shall be just.

In upstairs' chambers, they do reside,
So look with care, and do not hide.
For those who seek, shall find, I do avow,
The treasure hidden, worth the search, I trow."

"Methinks 'twas not the rub that vex'd me, fair,
But lack of folk to tend to my needs there.
The masseuse, she who kneads my sore muscles,
Doth also serve as receptionist, it seems,
And manager, and janitor, by the looks.
Each time a new guest enters, she doth leave,
To arrange their massage, and thus, my hour
Did stretch to ninety minutes, full of woe.
We chanced upon this place, near yon sushi feast,
But alas, I shall not return, forsooth."

"PB&J before 11 am? Forget about it, kid. Employees said it's against the rules, no matter how much you beg. They wouldn't even give me Tobasco for my egg sandwich. Just some weak homemade chili sauce instead. What's the point of having rules if you can't enforce 'em? Shame on 'em."

"Place had good reviews, decent happy hour prices. But it didn't do it for me. Decor was lacking, booths were uncomfortable. Service was alright. Ordered gyoza, it was okay, not crunchy though. Volcano roll was a mistake, they brought us a thunder roll instead. Rainbow roll was subpar, shrimp was chewy, avocado was off. Tea and miso soup were good. Not impressed overall, won't be back."

"Food's good, that's why I gave it a two. Been here before, always been satisfied. But this time, service was crap. Started off normal, greeted at the door, seated quick. Busy place, but not too bad. Got our drinks fast, French press was top-notch. Then, we waited. Five minutes, ten, fifteen. Others got seated and ordered, but no one bothered with us. Waitress was too busy chatting with the staff. Finally got up and left. Disappointing, especially for Postinos. Won't be back to the central location."

"Cirque du Soleil fan here. Seen O twice, Ovo, Mystere, Quidam, Zarkana, and Dralion. Zumanity caught my eye 'cause I was hitting Vegas for the first time since turning 21, and the idea of Cirque's "sensual side" fit the city's vibe. But, it didn't quite live up. Stunts weren't as impressive, and the music and dance didn't stand out. Still, if you're looking for a good time, Zumanity's got some funny "clown" hosts who'll keep you entertained, especially with crowd interaction. It's a different experience than other Cirque shows - way more intimate. Small theater, performers greet you at the door. Front-row seats mean you'll get some interaction, so keep that in mind when booking."

"Methought the bar tops were fair and bright,
The lighting, too, did please mine eyes.
And, verily, the fries were good, I say,
But that, alas, was where the joy did cease.

My love's brother had the fish, 'twain true,
With wilted greens, that did my heart sadden.
The plate, it seemed, had been beneath the sun,
And thus, the salad did lose its luster, anon.

I, myself, did have the fish and chips,
But found the batter lacking in its zest.
It was not fluffy, nor did it delight,
And so, my hopes were dashed, my heart did ache.

My love, he had the Bangers, bean and mash,
But found them lacking, with a taste most rash.
Like breakfast sausage, they did seem,
And thus, our evening did end in dismay, I do declare."
"Food was top-notch, but the prices were steep. Lunch for three ran us $105, and that was without drinks. Service was solid, but the cost was hard to swallow."
"Steak and veal, fat and gristle. Martini, sweet but weak. Service good, but too many better options. No cigar."

"Sat at the bar, sipped red wine, and ordered grub to go. Good vino, but nine bucks a glass? The bartender gave me the hairy eyeball when I asked for half spinach, half Romaine on my Caesar. I'm picky, but polite. We got the spinach pear Gorgonzola pizza. It arrived cold, underwhelming. Doubtful I'd return."

"Hark, what tale of woe doth come from yonder street,
Where stands the Hilton Grand, a place most meet.
I stayed there, and each day didst make my way
To Riviera's halls, where fortune doth play.

The bartenders, kind and full of cheer,
Didst serve me well, and banished all fear.
But alas, the dealers, with faces so grim,
Didst make me wonder why I didst persist.

James and Bruce, two gentlemen of great renown,
Didst treat me fair, and made my losses feel like a crown.
But Tang, that wicked fiend, didst take my gold,
And left me penniless, with nary a smile to behold.

I ask thee, why doth one return to such a place,
Where luck doth seem to flee, and leave naught but disgrace?
If I were with friends, and not my kin,
I'd nevermore set foot within this den of sin."
"$13 for two milkshakes? No way. Not in Gilbert. They weren't half bad, but no milkshake's worth that much. What a ripoff."

"Four of us hit this joint after an Overture gig. Grub was decent, but the service? Shitshow. Server cleared plates with food still on 'em. But the real kicker was our waiter. This one broad, eight months preggo, orders a virgin mojito. Waiter gives her the hairy eyeball and says, "So, you want it with vodka, huh?" She's like, "No, dipshit, without." Finally gets it through his skull. Then the bill comes and we get charged eleven bucks for this non-alcoholic drink. We're like, "What the hell?" Ask him about it, he says there ain't no button for virgin drinks and it's ten bucks for the mint and labor. We're like, "Bullshit." Ask for a manager, wait ten minutes, nobody shows. So we pay and bounce, pissed off."

"Parked, validated tickets ourselves. Left, told parking was three bucks, validation only good for three hours. What the hell? Got hit on by some dude with star-shaped implants outside the john. Weirdo. Gonna hit up College Night at Canyon Club, but they wanted ten bucks cover from underage folks. Rip-off. Just left."

"Ain't no use in sugarcoatin' it. This joint's got problems. First off, the hostesses. Three of 'em, yappin' away like they're at a cocktail party. Took 'em two whole minutes to notice me standin' there. That's some top-notch service right there. Then, I order a glass of Pinot. Tastes like it's been sittin' open for a week. I mention it to the bartender, he just shrugs and says, "Nah, I just opened it." Like that's supposed to make me feel better. Happy Hour's a joke too. One buck off? That's like they're tryin' to insult me. Portions are decent, but the grub's just mediocre. Croissants are alright, though. Warm and tasty, but not enough to save this dump. There's better places in Scottsdale. Don't waste your cash here."

"Tee Pee Mexican Food, round two. Historical joint, no doubt. Weekend before Christmas, lunchtime, not too busy. Friendly service, salsa on point. Chips, small and crushed. Green corn tamale, cold. Rice and beans, meh. Hubby's carne asada burrito, better. Salsa and drinks, worth it. That's it."

"Avoid, my friends, the Thursday night,
For Pure, the club, doth not delight.
They open but the rooftop high,
And commoners, like thee and I,
Must gather in the patio's heart,
Far from the rail, where views doth start.
I went, full of expectations bright,
But found it lacking, a poor sight.
In Austin, clubs of better sort,
I've seen, on Thursdays, no need to sport.
XS, on Fridays, doth reign supreme,
Pure, on Saturdays, a waste, it seems."

"Went to this joint a couple years back with the fam during a Vegas trip and loved it. Ordered all-you-can eat and my old man even got sick from overeatin'! We were eager to come back this time around.

Ordered some alligator tail as an appetizer and it was tasty. But the all-you-can-eat platters we usually get were only good towards the end. Seemed like they were usin' old oil to fry the fish and shrimp at first...yuck! Don't even wanna think about how old it was. But hey, at least they changed the oil to fresh oil at the end, so that was good.

The salad bar was pretty lackluster too. Coulda used some more maintenance, ya know? Maybe put the same items on both sides to make it easier to navigate without spillin' stuff everywhere. Did like how they kept the plates chilled though.

Service was good, our waitress did her job. Shame we lost our cravin' for this place. Just ain't the same no more."

"Staying at the W, I only ate here. Hot waitresses, sure, but that's Montreal for you. Nothing special. 

They try too hard with fancy French dishes, but the flavors don't quite work. Not impressed. 

Breakfast is alright, I guess. That's all."

"We hit McCarren, got in line for the rental car. Thought I made the right choice, six people ahead of me, nobody at the other counters. Not the case. Later, needed a car again, went with Budget. Their price was just as good, nicer cars. Meanwhile, Dollar had two people working, and I waited in a long-ass line. Painful. Considered cancelling and booking elsewhere. Not cool, Dollar."
"Atmosphere, top-notch. Grub, not so much. Pasta with meatballs, overpriced and underwhelming. Two puny meatballs, flavorless noodles. Left still hungry, had a PB&J at home."

"Malls are dead to me, but a gift card burned a hole in my pocket. We hit up a dusty department store, hoping for some classic retail therapy. The joint was tired, selection slim. Bummed me out, man. Felt like work, not fun."

"Arrived at 11 am, not too busy, but still waited 10 minutes for a table. Server was great though, attentive and friendly. Ordered French Toast, big portion with lots of pecans, but nothing special. Expensive too, compared to Denny's. Not impressed, maybe try a hash dish next time."

"Pizza joints like Domino's, Pizza Hut, and Little Caesars can't touch this place. Sure, they might be cheaper, but you get what you pay for. This pizza's worth every penny. Don't waste your cash on those other places. You'll be glad you spent a little extra for the real deal."
"Skip it. Worst spread I've seen. If you're at the GC, head to Palms instead. Food wasn't too bad, but still a bust. Two stars, tops."
"UPS store, package in hand, wave goodbye. Brown truck, delivery done."

"Went in for an Orange Julius, machine wasn't working. Week later, stopped by with some coworkers, no chocolate cones. Awkward ordering and delivery system. No visible supervisor or manager during either visit."

"Breakfast out, nice, but not here again. Too rich. Eggs Benedict, coffee, $40. Portions big, wasteful. Menu should say. Unripe fruit, no. In season, yes. Fresh, local, ripe. Waitress asked, I said no. Hard, pink slice, where from?"

"I've got a thing for Nordstrom Rack. Whenever a new one pops up in Cali or Nevada, I make it a point to check it out. The freshest gear always shows up at the new spots. Been to a bunch, and some are better than others. But this one in Summerlin? It's a bust. Men's section's tiny, and the pickings are slim. Couldn't find squat to buy. Went to the one in Henderson instead, scored two sweet sweaters. Had high hopes for this new joint, but now I'm not so sure I'll be back."

"A night of revelry and no dinner had left us quite famished, my friends. The Mexican eatery in Aria was our first choice, but alas, 'twas closed. So, we asked which other restaurants still served food, and thus, we found ourselves at Lemongrass. 

Their decor was pleasing to mine eyes, modern and chic. But, alack, the booths were difficult to enter, not sliding smoothly, as one would hope. Upon the table, a cup with wooden chopsticks lay, which led me to ponder, if this were a finer Asian establishment, might they not be reusable? Forgive me, for my mind doth wander. 

We did order Tom Kha Chicken to begin, a tasty broth indeed. Yet, they did not serve it in individual bowls, which seemed strange. Mayhap, 'tis customary here, but I, a humble traveler, knew it not. Our main courses followed: black pepper prawns, sweet and sour chicken, a curry dish, and Chow Fun, all savory, yet not exceptional, I must confess. Service, too, was lacking, slow and unfriendly, a stark contrast to the prices charged. Alas, dear friends, methinks I shall not return, save for the late hour."

"Place gets a bit tight, especially after hitting up LV North Premium Outlets. How it stacks up:

-Parking's a breeze (but watch out for traffic snags)
-Indoor haven from scorching Vegas summers (feels a tad cramped inside though)
-Plenty of stores to choose from (North outlets got more variety though)
-Better food options, both inside and out (less lost tourists too)

Still prefer the North outlets despite the inconvenience. Nice to be indoors, but easier to hit main stores by walking outside. Trip ended up a bust."

Alack, what a dull and uninviting space!
The ambiance, though tidy, doth lack warmth and grace.
The staff, with nary a smile or kindly word,
Do little to make one feel welcome or heard.

The prices, fair, yet not the most affordable,
Leave much to be desired, I must confess.
My manicure, alas, doth suffer from bubbles galore,
A sight most unpleasing, I do declare!

The hues they offer, few and far between,
Do leave me wanting, I must admit.
As one new to this town, seeking novel experiences,
I fear I shall not return to this place again, anon.

"Turkey and roast beef, freshly made, drew me in. But, damn, it was shredded. Like a dog's dinner, as Ramsey'd say. Got the bobby with roast beef, so I could taste both. Bread was good, stuffing was cold. Meat was dry, real dry. Like sawdust. Other meats, not shredded, must be great on that bread. Manager, bragging about doing nothing but micro-managing. Donkeys! Guy should clean the bathrooms."
"Place looked good, but the grub didn't quite live up. Thought it deserved three stars, max. Better options back in Cali, and cheaper too. But, gotta admit, the joint looked sharp."

"Went to The Keg last night. First time. Disappointed. Ordered filet and lobster tail. Everything overcooked. Asked for medium rare. Got well done and medium well. Asparagus like canned crap. Couldn't eat it. Lobster best thing on plate. Rubbery though. Food quality marginally better than Outback. Price higher. Like an upscale steakhouse. Maybe worth it if you're into that. Personally, prefer Morton's, Ruth's Chris, The Palm, or Donovan's. Pay for quality. Actually get it. Won't be going back to The Keg."

"Alas, how times have changed! This gym, once grand,
Now doth resemble a common tavern, where
The patrons, crammed in tight, must pay a fee
For every drop of sweat they do expend.

Their schedules, once diverse and vast,
Are now reduced to just a few, and those
That remain, are filled with people, packed
Like sardines in a can, with nary space
To breathe, or move, or find a moment's peace.

And in the locker rooms, no shampoo or cream
To cleanse the hair, or soothe the skin,
No towels, either, to dry off with ease,
Just signs that demand a tip, as if 'twere
A tax on every drop of moisture shed.

The staff, disorganized and in disarray,
Do forget the class cards, time and again,
Leaving members in a state of dismay.

Yet still, I come, for one reason alone,
The instructors here, are truly divine,
Their passion, energy, and skill, doth make
Each class, a joy, despite the flaws that plague.

So, though this gym may not be what it was,
I'll stay, for those who teach, and guide, and pass
On knowledge, are the ones who truly make
This place, still worth a visit, for my sake."
"Patio's nice. Keepin' it positive."
"Disappointment at every visit. Dry, reheated spuds. Overcooked eggs. Lackluster flavor. Sriracha, dark and wrong. Fake sauce? Scram, it's over. Not me, you."

"Burger? Forgettable. Flavorless patty, unremarkable bun. Mixed up our order, too. Fries instead of rings. Apologies and mediocre rings followed. Nibbled some fries. Average. Overpriced at ten to twelve bucks. Beer? Decent. Cold, tasty. Service? Meh. Not crowded on a Friday. Underwhelming experience."

"First visit, great. Second, not so much. Girl forgot my name, spent 30 seconds before taking a call. Then, she chatted for 15 minutes while three others stood around, ignoring me. She kept saying 'wait' though I wasn't speaking. When she finished my brows, she yanked hard and my eye watered. Called me a crybaby. At the register, she asked for a larger tip. Two stars for decent brows, but poor service and location mean I won't return."
"Burger, big as a plate. Ok, not great. Less is more, I say. Not going back. Ate a third, disappointed. Tractor, cool though."

"First visit, ace. Thought it'd be tough to top. Service, wine, grub, and ambiance - all top-notch. Second time, though? Total flop. Waiter didn't listen, presentation was shot, steak knives came post-steak. Food was cold by the time the manager showed up. Apology came with a side of BS about extra charges for slicing the steak. Check came, and the waiter was all over us like a shark on the prowl. Not exactly what we wanted for our celebration."

"Alack, my dearest sister, how thy words didst deceive me! 'Twas thou who didst recommend this place, yet thou hast not stepped foot within its walls for ten long years. Pray tell, what sorcery hath caused thee to forget the quality of this establishment? 

And lo, we sat ourselves down, and forthwith, our server didst ask, with haste most unbecoming, if we possessed a Groupon. Fie upon it! I, in my confusion, didst reply, 'Uh, nay.' Yet, upon mine own device, I didst discover such a coupon, and thus, I didst purchase it, forsooth, for the sum of nineteen silver pence. 

But alas, the victuals! How they didst disappoint! Each roll, filled with cream cheese and krab, or some such mixture, with nary a fresh or flavorful morsel among them. The rice, too, didst overpower the fish, in every roll, a sorry sight indeed. 

And, as if this were not woe enough, our repast didst take an age to arrive. A pox upon their speed! 

Verily, a poor value, indeed. For without the Groupon, our reckoning wouldst have neared six dozen golden coins, for a meal most mediocre. 

Now, it doth seem, a multitude of folk do flock hither, for their special offer of all-you-can-eat, for a mere twenty pieces of silver. But, alas, the restrictions! No sharing, and woe betide him who doth not consume all his portion, for he shall pay for that which he doth not devour. Fie upon such base conditions! 

Yet, one bright star didst shine amidst this gloom, for the service, indeed, was most excellent. 

In conclusion, farewell, dear sushi restaurant, for nevermore shall I darken thy doorstep."

"Place is top-notch, fountain's a real showstopper. But let's talk service. Cashier, never seen me before, asks how sweet the iced mochas are. Guy says, 'It's chocolate.' Thanks for the insight. I know that much. How many pumps we talking? Gonna leave with a sugar high? 

Look, I get it. You're stuck behind the counter while every kid in Vegas wants a gelato. But for those of us who want coffee, not a milkshake, try showing some enthusiasm. Pretend to care about service. 

Appreciate it."

"Hark! If thou dost crave a surfeit of victuals  
That be of middling quality, and service poor,  
Then this establishment shall be thy haven.  
'Twixt one and two stars, I do vacillate,  
Yet shall bestow upon them two, in fairness.  
Newly opened, 'tis clean, a sight most rare,  
Compared to Hometown Buffet, a place most foul.  
The steak, alas! Dried out and fat, did wait,  
And lo! The popcorn shrimp, a sorry sight,  
And fish, tough and fried, did leave me cold.  
Chicken, both barbecue and roasted, bland,  
But edible, lest I be too harsh.  
Some dishes, mislabeled, a confusion wrought.  
Desserts, a paltry choice, a buffet's shame.  
Staff, disorganized, in chaos swathed,  
A long line, slow, our patience doth consume.  
Plates, removed not, by waiters in haste,  
I, wise guise, mine own plates did clear.  
Drinks, ere payment, first procure we must,  
A slow process, vexing, and quite unjust.  
One dollar ninety-nine, a drink doth cost,  
Or more, for takeout, a price quite lost.  
Five pounds, a pound, they charge, a sum  
For takeout, verily, a price most steep.  
Amazed, I sat, and watched folk devour,  
In silence, next time, I shall demur."

"The place means well, but there's too much to gripe about. Interior's drab and depressing, like something outta a bad dream. Temperature's off too, sweltering hot even on a nice day. Tables and couches, tiny and creepy. Smoothies took forever, like they grew the fruit themselves. Hummus appetizer, not enough to go around. Greek salad, no feta. Spicy beef panini, good but burnt and sloppy. Prices too steep. Won't be back."

This place, alas, doth not impress me much,
Their sesame chicken, a dish of wondrous touch,
Yet, alack, its quality doth vary so,
At times, 'tis good, but oft, 'tis not, you know.
The rest of their fare, methinks, doth pale,
In comparison to other eateries, so frail.
A colleague of mine, a bug didst find,
In the plastic wrap that didst entwine,
Their container, a sight most foul and grim,
Which doth persuade me to avoid this place within.

"Room was big, but dirty. Bed, comfy. Pillows, crap. Furnishings, nice, but dated. Robo-cop room. WiFi, one device only. Extra devices, $14/day. Ridiculous. Pool area, large, gambling outside. Pools, small. Rent chairs? Nope. Price, fair. Checkout, resort fees, taxes. Service, hit or miss. Spend more, stay elsewhere."

"Place looked decent, reviews said it was good. But no, not great. Started with fries sampler, zucchini, Mac n cheese, pepper jack shots - all good. Burgers and shakes next, but they messed up the order. Took forever, and we had to remind 'em twice about our drinks. Burgers were meh, pepper bacon was too sweet. Only go back for the Nutella shake and pepper jack cheese shots."

"China Poblano was a letdown. Heard too much about Jose Andres, thought it'd be great. Menu was pricey, $11 for dim sum? No way. But we got some tapas to share, hoping for the best. Just okay, not mind-blowing. Mini pork sandwich for $8? Should be amazing, wasn't. Eggplant dish was good, but not worth returning for. Tried Chinese and Mexican together, no difference. Not a fusion restaurant, just two menus in one. Ambient is cool, but won't be back. Can get that elsewhere."

"Lucky Louie's, formerly Fairview Grill, still serves poorly. The food's mediocre, the beer selection's limited. Went there last night with a friend, left feeling queasy. Had to use Pepto-Bismol later. 

Avoid Jerk sauce on wings; Barbalo's tolerable. Buffalo fries with ranch were tasty. Bacon Cheeseburger was half-eaten; should've specified well-done. Bacon wasn't crispy, no A1 Sauce. 

Lucky Louie's has some positives: 
1) Golden Tee and Silver Strike machines 
2) Pool tables 
3) Projector screen and ample flat-screens 
4) NFL Network 

Unlikely I'll return, especially for food."

"Panchero's? Been there, done that. Won't be going back. If I'm in the area, it's Jersey Mike's, Starbucks, or Yogurtland for me. The grub was alright, but they were stingy with everything. Measuring out cheese like it's gold? Come on! And don't even get me started on the beans. Rice or no rice, doesn't matter. You're still getting ripped off. Carnitas was decent, but not worth the price. Forget about it. Taco Bell's 89 cent bean burritos can't be beat."

"Tusca. Just okay. Nice inside, but staff didn't give a damn. Prices were fair, food was fine. But, you know, there's better tapas joints around. And let's be real, the crowd was a bunch of older ladies hunting for young bucks. Not my scene."

"High hopes, recommendations, but a letdown. Distracted waitstaff, slow service, simple orders - crepe, brownie, petite pot. Two crepes, no brownie, kids disappointed. Tried to flag someone down, no luck. Eventually, a half-hearted apology. Food was good, support local businesses, but service needs work."

"Xinh Xinh, what happened? We used to bring out-of-towners here, impressed by the joint. Last time, we got takeout - three banh mis, wings. Wings were decent, well-seasoned with fish sauce. Not for the faint of heart, though. My wife's sister's banh mi was good, but ours had sparse meat. JalapeÃ±os and cilantro, sure, but skimpy on the mayo. I got the catfish banh mi - tiny fish, compared to before. \n\nNoticed a decline in bubble tea quality, too. Used to be strong, unique flavors. Last time, seemed like non-dairy creamer instead of milk. Disappointing. Probably won't be back. Guess I'll try making my own banh mi or pho instead. Service still good, but food's not as great as it was when they opened."

"Where's the beef, you ask? Damn good question. Had the green chili beef chimi, but it was more like a tease. Few bits of beef and barely any green chilies. Klohe Kardashian's got nothing on me. Give it six months, tops. Unless they beef up the meal."

"Portions small, prices high. No sisig, new joint still learning the ropes. Food arrived separate, server apathetic. Training lacking, table cleaning prioritized over customer care. Disappointing visit."

"Not my idea of utopia, this place. Good atmosphere though, on a cool street. Mixed bag of people. Bartender suggested their IPA. Big mistake. Flavorless. Not what I expected from an IPA. Should've tried something else. But I didn't. Also, they only take cash. Sucks for business travelers like me."

"Place was mediocre at best. Stopped by on Saturday for lunch, but they were out of grilled chicken. Unacceptable, especially when your name is Peru Chicken. It's like a hot dog stand with no hot dogs. Ordered a Tacu Tacu and some Antichuchos with potatoes and cheese sauce for an appetizer. Tacu Tacu was a big pile of rice and beans with a small piece of grilled meat. No veggies or pickles. Not worth the price. Antichuchos were slices of meat on a stick with undercooked potatoes and bland corn. Meat was okay, but the sides were subpar. Appetizer was three cold, sad pieces of boiled potato on a Styrofoam plate covered in cheesy sauce. Way overpriced at $5."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I stepped into the joint with high hopes, but they were quickly dashed. The burgers and fries were nothing to write home about, and the prices were steep, even for Vegas. The only saving grace was its 24-hour availability.

"Sunday morning, ten a.m., place was hopping. Staff scrambling, kitchen overwhelmed. Packed house, empty tables. Ordering took ages, orders botched. Cinnamon roll MIA, drink unrefilled, pancake burnt to a crisp. Hash browns lacked TLC, French toast stale. Hope they shape up, potential's there."

"We heard good things, so we checked it out. Got there at four, hoping for a late lunch, early dinner. But they only do brunch on weekends. Pancakes at four? No thanks. We'll have to try again for dinner sometime."

"O, what a woeful sight! A tavern slow,
With service poor, and staff not nigh.
We entered in, with hope so bright,
But found no host, to guide us right.

To bar we went, with haste and speed,
Thinking quick service, our need.
But lo, the place was not so busy,
And bartender, with two couples dizzy.

A wait, so long, for greetings fair,
And mint, she had to find, so rare.
At last, our drinks, we did receive,
But menus, none, our hunger to relieve.

To host stand, I did go, with strife,
To get my own, and end this life.
I asked for water, twice, in vain,
And food, so typical, Applebee's gain.

Finished we did, with appetizer, drink,
And entree, with naught to think.
But clearing, none, until the bill,
Our patience, did it kill?

A three-top, new, the bartender knew,
And greeted them, with drinks anew.
This sight, did anger in me brew,
For service, poor, I would not do.

Back, I shall not, to this place go,
Even if hotel, behind it does flow."
"Underwhelmed. Expectations high, recommendations strong. Dirty, slow service, near walk-out. Managers plenty, staff scarce. Bored faces, poor training. Disappointment reigns."

"A pox upon this Philly cheesesteak, I say!
The meat, it doth resemble dried up hay.
And served, it was, with naught but scorn,
As if the cook didst take his leave ere dawn.
My husband, he didst order turkey, fair,
But found it wanting, with naught to spare.
This place, it may appease thy hunger pangs,
If thou art drunk and lost in tangled throngs.
But for a meal of worth, seek elsewhere, friend,
For here, they do but play the fool, an end."

"Tried a few of their veg curries. Disappointing. Lacking in taste and quality. Maybe their non-veg curries are better. Close to campus, so they can get away with lower quality. Wouldn't recommend it for good Indian food."

"Alas, dear friends, what woeful tale I tell,
Of service poor, and prices far too steep,
At Laronde, a park of fun and cheer,
Yet marred by practices most unfair.

A ticket price of $120, plus Platinum pass,
An extra cost of $140, oh how it doth astound,
A scam, a trick, a falsehood, call it what thou wilt,
For wait times shortened, it doth not ensure.

A website, with words of guile and deceit,
Didst promise much, but delivered little,
A limited pass, they said, but nay,
For all rides, it didst not cover, alack.

A beer, I ordered, at a price so high,
But poured by a youth of sixteen summers,
Illegal, indeed, a sight most vexing,
To see a minor pour a drink, most disconcerting.

To the authorities, I shall make my claim,
Against Six Flags, and their ways so lame,
For in Quebec, such laws doth exist,
And teenagers, no alcohol should they dispense."

"A plague upon this show, o'erpriced and poor,
With mediocre performances, and too much lewd display.
The men, they grabbed their codpieces with great glee,
And mimed, with comedic intent, but little finesse.

We waited for the main event, a spectacle grand,
But alas, it ne'er arrived, save one solitary dance.
The rest, a pale imitation of their ABDC fame,
Left us in wonder, if we saw the same.

A voice cried out, in rapturous delight,
"Twas wondrous, good!" But my husband and I,
In disbelief, did ponder, if we shared the same sight.
Perhaps 'twas meant for youthful eyes, and not our own."

"Kirkland Signature frozen yogurt, love it. But this food court, they rip you off. Leave the middle hollowed out, like the employees are trained to do it. Pepperoni pizza, too greasy. Need a fist full of napkins, can't eat it without 'em. Bottom of the pizza, all over the plate, damn messy."

In Arizona, I thought any Mexican joint would be solid. Turns out, I was wrong. Hubby's uncle and his missus raved about this spot, so we rolled in for dinner. It's in a plaza, and inside it's got a nice Spanish vibe. I liked it. We had to wait for a big table, so we took the rugrats to the can. Nice bathrooms, clean too. Our server was friendly, took our drink and salsa orders. They got a few kinds of salsa, but their house salsa was a no-go. Chips weren't great either. I got the cheese dip, it was alright. Ordered a chimichanga, but it was a bust. No cheese, didn't taste good. Sent it back, didn't order anything else. Tried the fam's grub, wasn't impressed. This place gets a two for the decor and good service. Food-wise, they didn't do Mexican justice.
"Pizza's good. Delivery's a bust. Get it yourself, or wait an hour and a half to chow down."

"Kabuki's a joint I know well, mostly for work lunches. But today, Saturday, I wanted to take the missus and kiddos out for some sushi. Service was a real bust, though. Guy named Andy, he had four or five tables, but all he cared about was griping to the other waiters about having to work on a nice day and chatting up the hostess about his weekend plans. Our apps and salads came after we finished our sushi, drinks went unfilled, and it took him 20 minutes to pick up my card and check. What a shame they can't find anyone who wants to work hard. Buyer beware, bad service, just okay food."

"Agreed. Been going to this Walmart for a year, but no more. Trashy place. Switching my scripts to another Walmart. Can't recommend this one to friends. Had a friend visit, used the restroom, and heard someone puking next door. That was enough for her. Never going back."

"Happy hour menu, Friday. Steak and cheese, six bucks, not bad. Neopolitan milkshake, four dollars, decent. Gyro, six bucks, but no more next time. Panini, six bucks, just okay. Service slow, even though it's dead. Overall, it's alright if you're starving, hungover, drunk, or didn't think of better options."

"This joint gets three knocks for a few reasons. First, the blueberry scone was straight-up terrible. Not sweet, almost savory, and had a weird gritty texture. Not good. The espresso con panna was also off - way more bitter than I expected, even more so than Starbucks'. But there were some bright spots. The lemon olive oil cornmeal cake was top-notch, and the mocha wasn't bad either. The counter worker was friendly and knew their stuff too."

"Hark! What's this? A place to dine, they say,
But lo, the fare, it doth not sway
My taste, for it is but average, I fear,
Unless thou art a fan of plants, my dear.
And oh, the wait, it doth prolong,
Two hours or more, a tedious song.
So cross the street, my friend, and save
Thyself from woe, at Franktuary, they crave."

"This joint ain't great. Killed some time before my red eye, hankerin' for Mex. Shoulda gone elsewhere. Pros: friendly service, decent guac. Cons: stale chips, no burritos (WTF?), subpar quesadilla. Soggy, empty space. Meh. YOLO, avoid it."

"Been here plenty. Food's good, but watch the portions. Eat in, you get what you pay for. Take out, they skimp. Had the Mahi Mahi last Fri, veggies were fine. Same dish Sun, to go, fish was half the size. Hummus too. Not the first time either. Check your order before you leave. They think you won't notice till you're home."

"Frozen yogurt, oh how sweet thy taste doth be!
But, alas, my mind doth think, if FroYo thou seek,
A fresher, fruiter flavor thou dost desire,
Lest ice cream be thy choice, and true delight.

In this place, I have been, and found but one,
Fruit flavor, and lo! 'Twas one I could not abide.
No tart, no plain, to soothe my taste buds' fire,
And thus, I left, with naught but disappointment's ire.

But, hark! The toppings, they do make amends,
Aplenty, and diverse, to suit all men's ends.
Clean, the place is, and the service, fair,
The price, the same, per ounce, beyond compare."

"I came back for round two, thinking maybe my first visit was just a fluke. But nope, same crap service and food. Ordered the table d'hote for my buddy, and what do we get? A burnt-to-a-crisp piece of beef. Unbelievable. And the server? Didn't give a damn. Didn't even ask how the meal was. That's the problem with this joint - nobody gives a damn. Not worth my time or money. Won't be coming back."

"This joint was a real 50/50 proposition. Three specialty pizzas, one was great, one was meh, and the other was a total dud. Salad was decent, but nothing to write home about. Ranch dressing was top-notch, blue cheese was a disaster. Chicken tenders? Forget about it. Burnt to a crisp, like they lit the kitchen on fire. Couldn't even eat 'em. Buffalo sauce was solid, but what's the point when the chicken's inedible? Baked potato fries were a nice idea, but they were soggy as hell. Maybe it was just the delivery, though. All in all, we spent over a hundred bucks for a whole lotta disappointment."

"Went to Bottles & Burgers at Tivoli Village. Not impressed beforehand, but a friend wanted to check it out. Willing to give any place a shot, especially with patio seating. Patio was between two escalators, lots of traffic and noise. Didn't try the food, but had their cucumber martini - decent but not the best. Sangria was terrible, like prune juice. Honey jack on the rocks was good, can't mess that up. Better off going to Brio for a nice patio experience - comfy chairs, fire pits, and great people watching."

"Imadake, a restaurant of much renown,
Didst disappoint me, with its over-saucy crown.
The octopus balls, gummy and raw,
Were not worth the coin, I do declare.

The okonomiyaki, too, was a letdown,
Drowned in sauce, without a doubt.
And the black cod, oh how it failed,
Rubbery and bland, it did not prevail.

The jellyfish salad, a strange delight,
Was not enough to make things right.
I shall not return, forsooth,
For Imadake doth not meet my truth.

A trendy place, with oyster sauce galore,
But alas, the food doth not live up to the score."

"This place doth not deserve the name of 'premiere resort', fair friends! The suite, though small, did lack the modern touch, a tube television, that doth make other resorts shine so bright. The bathroom, alas! was tiny, and in one room, bare of toilet paper and a lock that worked aright. The grounds, in disarray, did cry out for a fresh coat of paint and pruning shears, I pray. Yet, blessedly, the view of yonder highway did please mine eyes, and fortunately, the noise did not disturb my rest. The young ones, verily, didst enjoy the waterpark, but, alack! the lazy river and slides were closed at times, which did cause great vexation in the ladies fair. Confusion reigned regarding the opening hours upon the Sabbath day, which did leave our maidens wroth. If thou dost seek a place where children may frolic in the water, and the grounds, though humble, do suffice, then stay here, friend! But, if thy heart doth yearn for a finer resort, with amenities galore, then hasten thee to Fairmont Princess, where luxury doth reign supreme!"
"Diner near stadium, topless. Decent grub, gorillas keeping watch, some habituÃ©s. FYI, I was the sole hen."

"Polite waitstaff, but mediocre grub.  Overpriced, too.  If you must eat here, get a beer.  It'll make the food taste better.  I ordered a steak quesadilla with guac and a Coke.  The soda looked like weak tea, and I wasn't offered a refill.  The quesadilla looked good, but the guac was skimpy.  The dried onion garnish was unnecessary.  The filling-to-cheese ratio was off, and the whole thing fell apart.  The steak was overcooked and inedible, and the corn and bean relish made the cheese clump together.  Save your cash and hit up Burger King instead."
"Fair price, but nothing special. Wings needed more time in the oven. Burger was alright, bread was good."

"Fifty bucks for a meal in Vegas? Damn right. Fresh fish, too. Left more cash at the restaurant than at the craps table. Food was good, fresh, and well-prepared. Portions were small, but worth it. Pricey, sure, but not as bad as DC. Drinks were reasonable, though. My manhattan martini was generous and ten bucks. Same in DC. Sat at the sushi bar, enjoyed the animated display behind the chefs. Service was good, friendly, and prompt. Waiter's recommendations were on point. Went to another casino to recoup my losses. MGM, you owe me."

"I been to two Twin Peaks. First was in Austin. Second was in Scottsdale. Waitresses in Scottsdale were cold as ice. Hardly saw 'em, even when we needed the check. Other girls were huddled in the back, outta sight.\n\nFood was decent. Had a burger and fries. Cooked like they said it would be. But no reason to come back here. Better burgers elsewhere. Whataburger's the real deal. Was hopin' to see some waitresses. Not in Scottsdale, though."

"Food was decent, nothing special. Few things bugged me though. They charge for refills, what's the point? And this big group comes in, 9 people, first timers like me. Lady behind the counter says they add a 15% gratuity. But how's that fair when you order at the counter and they ain't bringing you jack? On the bright side, folks were friendly."

"Meat selection? Slim pickings. Place was dead, but that didn't help the speed. Sirloin? More like shoe leather. Salad bar? Underwhelming. Had high hopes after a solid visit last year, but this time? Major disappointment."

"I shot back an email to the CSR rep, like they asked. She was polite, concerned. I hit send a couple times, got a reply from some suit too. They said the local boss would get in touch. That was weeks ago. Don't know what's up with that. Had a rough time with 'em before, but this just adds insult to injury. Don't need nothin' else from 'em, but figured I'd give 'em an update on the review."

"Clean joint, polite service. Like the blue film over the lights, gives it a lounge feel. But the grub...

Salt and pepper calamari, $7 for 14 pieces drenched in grease, no salt or pepper. Bland, just tasted like grease. Came with sweet and sour sauce. Best part was the fried carrot garnish.

The'special combination' bahn mi, big letdown. Meat all stacked on one end. Opened it up, found blackened meat - looked spoiled, not cooked. Picked out some pieces, bit in, and damn, crazy spicy sauce. Made my eyes water. Only saw jalapenos, don't mind 'em. 

This place may be by my gym, pho might be good, but I ain't comin' back. Can't trust the meat in your soups if you can't serve unspoiled meat on your sandwiches."

"Last eve, a band of merchants I did lead
To Harvest, where their dedication to the local feed
Did mean a variable supply, I did conceive,
But our experience was most dire, indeed.

Their menu, bare of fish, did leave us aghast,
And two steak dishes only, they could not surpass.
Three desserts special, they had in store,
But alas, no Diet Coke, they could not pour.

Straws, too, they lacked, for one poor soul,
And thus, our evening did unfold.
Disappointment reigned, and discontent,
For which I shall not take my clients bent.

Again, to Harvest, I shall not return,
For they did fail, their duty to learn."

We showed up at the joint on a Saturday night, around six. Not too busy, so we got sat quick. Table wasn't clean, but we didn't mind. Waited a bit for a drink order, but the manager finally came through. Another waiter noticed we'd been sittin' awhile, so he hooked us up. Our waiter showed up shortly after and took our order. Woulda enjoyed that garlic bread while we waited, but it all came at once. Food was pretty lackluster, 'cept the bread. Place was dead, but no one bothered to clear tables. Overall, it was a pretty disorganized mess. Doubt I'll be back.

"Roland's, again? Yeah, I know. But I was in town for business and thought, why not? Kaya, though. Thirty minutes, easy. And the place is empty. Always. Like, what's that tell ya? And it's hot as hell outside, but inside, no A/C. Nice. 

Grilled veggie sandwich, clam chowder. Meh. Same as before. Service was better, I'll give 'em that. 

But, honestly? Doba's to-go taco salad the night before was way better. Save your cash, folks. Try somewhere else. 

Beer selection? Impressive, I guess. If you're into that sorta thing."

"Went to Pin Kaow 3 with the missus. Bad move. Service was slow, water took 20 min, curry another 20. Waitress MIA. Disappointing. \n\nLater, had the flu. Called Pin Kaow for my trusty tom ka kai and sticky rice. Soup was small, too salty, and thick. Ended up adding water. Not worth the hassle when you're feeling rough. Paid $12 for a cup of soup and a small side of rice. Sticky rice was good, though. Warm and tasty."
"Clean room, decent drinks at the bar. Location's good if you don't mind a stroll down the Strip. Bus stops out front if you're feeling lazy."
"Beer selection, good. Service, meh. Food, mediocre. Atmosphere, over-the-top. Someone's got deep pockets, but they should sweat the small stuff too."

"Macayos' pricier, blander cousin. 

Went with a group of nine on a quiet Monday eve. They made us wait till all nine were present, despite six being there already. Odd. 

Server was great, kept our drinks full. Food? Underwhelming. Carne asada taco plate with guacamole. Flavors lacking. Not expecting authentic Mex, but some seasoning would've been nice. Won't return."

"Coffee beans, Verve and Forty-Ninth Parallel, good choice. But, too crowded, pretentious scene. Tough to navigate, especially to the bathroom. Chocolate chip cookie, greasy, but some like it that way. Coffee drinks, no complaints. Solid espresso, worth the wait in line."

"Hark! What woeful tale doth mine ears perceive?
A place of rest, where one doth pay the price,
For service slow, and wait of forty minutes' length,
And freshness, not as fresh as some didst profess.

Oh, cruel fate! That we, in merriment,
Didst sit and talk, with friends long unseen,
And, shortly after paying the bill, didst hear,
Their subtle hint, to hasten our departure, keen.

Nay, nevermore shall they receive my coin,
For such ill treatment doth my heart disdain.
A larger space, they shouldst obtain,
To ease the wait, and make the customers remain."

"Hark! To Vegas I didst come for SHOT show,
And ne'er didst leave the Venetian's hallowed halls.
Taqueria Canonita, a place of great renown,
I thought, being near the border, and with many a soul
From LA to Vegas, doth serve most excellent Mexican fare.
But alas! The Santa Rosa Pork Barbacoa, recommended by the waiter,
Didst fail to impress, with its dry, flavorless meat.
Chipotle's barbacoa, a far better choice, I do declare.
The empanadas, lacking crispness, and the guacamole,
Not fully mashed, didst leave much to be desired.
A sit-down restaurant, with such faults, doth not bode well.
But, praise the tequila, which didst help me forget
The mediocrity of the meal, and doth soothe my soul."

"A fitting name for a spot that's lost its charm. Won't be makin' any new memories here. 

Rating Scale:
1 Star: Skip the whole town, ain't worth the risk. 
2 Star: Too many better options, why bother? 
3 Star: Might give it another shot, or eat here if desperate. 
4 Star: Regular spot, if the budget allows. 
5 Star: Lookin' forward to bringin' the missus or pals here."

"Gym's alright. Cleaning crew's always in the way, but place never seems clean. Women's locker room's a mess. Gym's too small, feels cramped. Front desk girls clueless, not exactly cheerful. Except for Candice or Candy, she's okay."

"Place gets 2 stars due to amenities. Pool area worth more than massages. Couples massage, 50 minutes, $300. Automatic 20% tip, don't agree. Spa beautiful, but separate areas, felt rushed. Asked for deep tissue, didn't get it. Massage lackluster, frustrating. Bad knots in shoulders, not touched. Wouldn't return, find another spa in Scottsdale."

"A plague upon this wretched Scottsdale place,
Where service doth leave much to be desired,
Food, though tasty, doth not make amends,
For cold and drafty atmosphere that doth conspire.

Two stars, I give, for food that doth please,
But service, oh so very poor, doth tease.
We asked that door be closed, to keep warm,
But request, alas, doth fall upon deaf ear.

And then, our server, doth disappear,
For fifteen minutes, we doth hold dear.
No water, brought she, nor did she say,
When asked, if extra salsa doth come our way.

At last, our entrees doth arrive, with soda,
But waitress, nowhere to be found, doth show.
My friend, to bar, doth go, to fill her glass,
And only then, doth she realize our plight, alas.

The food, perhaps, doth make our visit worth,
But service, oh so poor, doth leave us in dearth.
I vow, to nevermore return to this place,
For service, here, doth leave much to be desired, in disgrace."

"Here's what you'll find:

1. Sashimi - mediocre, frostbitten
2. Scallops - might make you sick
3. Witches' den

First two are self-explanatory. Third, I'll explain.
Food's okay, Americanized sushi. Three stars, tops.
Ambiance is good, might bump it up to 3.5.

But the service? Chinese waitresses, speaking Chinese. I'm Chinese, I understand Chinese. They're selling my coworkers and me crappy alcohol on the side. Come on...

Hiro's where it's at."

"Aye, love their brew, I do confess,
But mornings, oh, what a mess!
Moms and youths, they throng the place,
A line that reaches to the door's embrace.
Ten minutes, nay, I shall not bide,
For just a cup of plain coffee's pride.
I usually buy beans, make at home,
But now, alas, I must roam.
They should appoint a barista true,
To take straight coffee orders anew.
More business then, they would pursue."

"Place looked good, real good.  Wanted to like it, I did.  Slow night, we were there.  Downstairs bartender, friendly fella.  Went upstairs when friends showed.  Service slow, food unimpressive.  Had a few dishes, variety and all.  Place got potential, bring up the grub and service though."

"No frills joint. Apartments converted to motel rooms. No AC during our stay. February, mind you. Outside, crisp sixty degrees. Inside, sweltering eighty-plus. Inquired about AC, got a negative. Guy said it was a no-go, just hot air coming out. Tried it myself, 'cool' setting on the thermostat. Room got stuffier. Staff, friendly though."

"Airport's a mess. Dirty, ridiculous. Not user friendly. Need more outlets. Business folk need to charge their laptops and cells. Layovers? Good luck. Long walk ahead. Stressful travel, made worse by this place. Slot machines everywhere. Lose your cash quick."

"Six years since we last dined at Streets of New York. This time, thin crust pizza, Caesar salad, bread knots. Pizza, not great, but better than remembered. Salad, inedible. Romaine, brown, past its prime. Returned it, no questions asked. Cheesecake, on the house. Embarrassing for the cook. Doubt we'll return."

"Airport shuttle, slow to leave. Waited 20-30 minutes, still not full. Called for pick-up, they said 15-minute window, hour to airport. No thanks, took taxi instead. Worth the cost. Don't recommend, too slow. Two stars for cheap rates, that's it."

"We've been hitting up Casey Jones for a while now, but our latest visit was a real letdown. Ordered the new "Juicy Lucy" burgers with some friends, and they came out bleeding, like a gutted horse. Cheese oozing out like a bad horror flick. Took 'em back, they came back cooked to a crisp, like they were torched with a propane torch. No cheese, either. Used to recommend this joint, but now I'm singing a different tune. Won't be back till they get their act together in the kitchen."

"A coupon of twenty dollars didst arrive in the post,
And thus, we didst decide to give it a go.
But alas, 'twas many moons ago,
Since last we didst set foot within its doors, ye know.

The service, fair and good, didst meet our needs,
But lo, the victuals, they didst not please.
I asked for cheese enchiladas, full of hope,
But found instead, a scant few scraps of scope.
My love, she didst order chicken, with high expectations,
But they were served with naught but disappointments.

The sangria, a lone bright spot, didst cheer,
But not enough, alas, to make us come near.
So, there you have it, friends, a tale of woe,
Of a restaurant visit, that didst not go."

"Fair victuals and courteous attendance, but alas, the cost doth mount for ribs and flesh! Menus old and new, didst claim desserts were included, yet when requested, 'twas not so. Pray, inform us ere we order, lest we suffer such surprise! A star or twain doth drop for this mischance. \n\nThis place doth suit a solitary diner or pair, for greater worth, since sides and seafood pancake, do remain the same, despite the number gathered round."

"Hark, good sirs, I pray thee tell me why,
This place, Dos Gringos, doth seem so vile?
Awhile, I have not stepped foot inside,
Or perchance, 'tis the Tempe site that doth shine?

The lavatory, with foul stench doth reek,
And all about, doth seem most unclean.
I'd ne'er desire to eat, nor take a seat,
In such an atmosphere, so unkempt and mean.

Why, pray tell, do folk gather here,
When fairer, merrier places doth abound?
Scottsdale, with glee and mirth doth cheer,
And yet, this den, doth sadness profound."

"Jasons Deli, been there a few times, always good. Ordered delivery today, forgettable. Turkey sandwich, dried out croissant, falling apart. Best brownies, usually, but not today. Overcooked, burnt taste, dry. Disappointing meal, won't be ordering again soon."

"A pox upon the house of VCA,
Whose prices be as high as the sky,
Their equipment, state-of-the-art, doth shine,
But alas, we could not pay the fee.

The staff, in fairness, were quite kind,
But one physician did our hopes entwine,
He said, with callous heart and mind,
That putting our dog down would be divine.

How could he say such words, so cold?
Is not their creed to do no harm?
Our dog, in their care, didst stay but one day,
And cost us two thousand silver coins, alack!

We took him elsewhere, where the care was true,
And saved his life, without the price anew.
A week he stayed, with treatment fair,
And cost us less than VCA's single day there."

"MAC counter was barren, employee assistance nowhere to be found. Three workers lingered behind the register, unhelpful. Broken, opened, and used products littered the shelves. Disappointment etched on my face, I'll try the indoor location next."

"A fair repast, at a price most reasonable,
We chanced upon this eatery, late one night,
In Sin City's midst, when hunger pangs did bite.
The throng within, did swell, yet we found seat,
Without much wait, our hunger to abate.
I shared a steak, of seven ounces, rare,
With hash browns, eggs, and toast, to fare.
The steak, alas, did lack in flavor,
One half well-done, the other, medium, they did savor.
But for a price, so low, who doth complain?
The hash browns, sadly, didst not delight,
In crispiness, they did not truly shine,
Yet toast, did please, and eggs, did pass the test.
But salt, oh where, didst thou flee?
For that, the dish, didst lack, in verity.
A place, for those, who doth not wish,
To venture forth, to the Strip's lavishness.
But not, a place, of culinary renown,
For that, we must, elsewhere seek, anon."

"Hark, what news is this? A dinner most foul,
Where service was lacking, and prices most steep.
The food, though passable, did not make amends
For rude behavior and poorly trained attendants.

Our server, a scowling maid, did glower and sneer,
And smiled not once, as if 'twere a crime most dire.
The busboy, too, did reach across my wife,
A faux pas, indeed, and cause for great strife.

I called them on their errors, loud and clear,
And sought the manager, who did appear.
He apologized and changed our waitstaff then,
But still, my ire did not abate, nor calm descend.

For such a place, with prices high and mighty,
Should offer service worthy of a king or queen.
Alas, they failed, and thus my counsel be,
Seek elsewhere for dinner, lest thou suffer similarly."

"Hark! Tonight, I dined at Leroy Fox, a place That once did house the old Hotel Charlotte's grace. The renovation, verily, did impress me much, For they didst incorporate parts of the old, Into the new, with great taste and such. Alas, The crowd didst pour in, like a river's flow, And noise didst rise, like a tempest's blow. Live music didst start, and soon, 'twas hard To hear the words, my companions didst impart. I hadst the "north" chicken, fried and fair, With a choice of side, a generous share. The menu, full of dishes, didst delight, But service, slow, didst mar the night. Forsooth, If thou dost seek a quiet meal, Avoid this place, lest thou dost feel Alack, and vexed, by noise's cruel zeal."
"Hotel was plain, not worth the dough. One night was enough, then we scored a better joint for the same price."

"BJ's gets two stars from me. Food's good, when they get it right. Been there seven times, and six times they messed up my order. Fax it in ahead of time, just like the other guys from work. Kitchen's got the order right in front of 'em, and still can't get it right. Veggie pizza without cheese ain't rocket science, but they manage to screw it up every time. Delivered with cheese, or without cheese but with sausage? What the hell, man? Wait staff's always sorry, but the kitchen's just incompetent."

"I wanted to love this joint, but it didn't quite live up. It's small, cramped, and loud. We went on a Monday, and it was like trying to talk over a jackhammer. The menu was limited, and the grub was just okay. My bacon was burnt and greasy, and my husband's sandwich was missing some key ingredients. The service was slow too, taking 20 minutes to get our food. For the price, it wasn't worth it. My husband said we could've done better at Capriotti's, and I had to agree."

"Hark! What ill fate doth befall this humble abode,
Where once-loved tunes, now battered, doth reside?
The prices, dear friend, do rise to $5 and more,
And service, alas! doth leave much to be desired.
I shall not return, forsooth, to this place again,
For 'tis a den of woe, where music doth suffer pain."

"I lived in the Bay Area, so I knew what good Asian food tasted like. I was in Montreal, and I wanted to see how their Chinatown compared. Beijing was supposed to be top-rated, so I gave it a shot. It was your typical loud, crowded joint, but I wasn't there for the ambiance. I ordered the Chicken Soo Guy, and the server told me it was some special Asian sauce. Yeah, right. It was just sweet and sour sauce. Didn't impress me much. The spicy beef had a little kick, but only because we asked for it extra spicy. Otherwise, it was nothing special. Overall, I wasn't impressed, and I wouldn't go back."

"OnTrac's delivered plenty of Amazon Prime packages for me, but twice they've delayed. First, they couldn't deliver after I paid extra for next-day. Today, their tracking said 'out for delivery,' then 'UNDELIVERABLE - OTHER REASONS,' followed by 'REDELIVER ON NEXT BUSINESS DAY.' The delivery guy couldn't give a solid reason for the delay. Maybe he was running late and figured he'd handle it the next day. Either way, OnTrac needs to step up their customer service game. Their delivery guys should smile and say thanks, like I do when I receive my packages. Instead, they just hand over the package with a scowl and drive off. They do a decent job delivering, but compared to UPS or FedEx, they're not quite there. Two stars, tops."

I stepped into the new Panera on Friday night, my young friend by my side. She had her heart set on soup in a bread bowl, but the staff member taking orders shot her down. "We're out of bread bowls," he snapped. My friend settled for a classic salad with chicken, and I opted for a Thai chicken flatbread sandwich. We made our way through a cramped passageway to our table, the dim lighting making the place feel dingy. The tables were dirty, and the restrooms were a mess. A huge roll of toilet paper sat atop an empty dispenser. Our food arrived, and it was clear the chef was no friend of flavor. For cheaper prices than Paradise or Wildflower, we could've gotten a better meal at Fry's. We grabbed a La Brea Olive Oil and Rosemary round loaf and a can of Progresso chicken noodle soup on the way home. Now that was a satisfying meal.

"Hark! Our usual haunt for delectable fare,
But alas, last Thursday's Burger night did falter.
My burger, cooked before its time, lay dry and cold,
Tough as old leather, hard to swallow whole.
The chicken too, once juicy, now dried up,
A sorry sight, fit only for the birds to sup.
In days of yore, our burgers freshly made,
Juicy and hot, did satiate our hunger's crave.
But now, they precook, letting sit in a pan,
A sin most foul, that doth mar the taste of man.
Even McDonald's doth this wicked deed,
A pox upon their house, a curse upon their seed.
Two stars for service, nay, not even one,
For poor cooking and ill treatment have they done."

"Not much to write home about, if you ask me. Maybe worth a visit if you're a tourist looking for some local flavor, but the sweets are too sweet and overpriced. The decor's nice, I'll give 'em that, but a $25 lollipop holder designed by Katy Perry? No thanks. One star for the cute decor, another for the cafe area."

"Hepatica didnâ€™t impress me much. Went in for some roses, waited damn near half an hour. Place was empty too. They tossed in some greens, bug-bitten and all, without sayinâ€?a word â€˜bout the extra cost. Then they had the nerve to double-charge my card. Real smooth, those folks."

"Methinks last eve, my second attempt didst prove,
Alike the first, in trouble didst it bring.
Two woes didst plague mine appetite,
Uncooked dough, a taste most vile, didst cling.
And red sauce, a poor choice indeed,
Didst fill mine innards with excessive speed.
So now, I shall forsake this woeful feast,
And seek Domino's, where Spinach doth truly gleam."

"Methinks 'twas pleasant to espy vegan fare,
But, alack! the choices were scant and bare.
Their presumption, too, did grieve mine heart,
That vegans pine for flesh and dairy's art.

The victuals, in sooth, were of fair quality,
But naught exceptional, save the price, which was quite steep.
The potions, too, did leave much to be desired,
A draught would cost thee more than thy meal, it required.

The servitors, in their haste, did show
A disposition gruff and unpleasant, I do know.
The host, with earplug and ill-suited attire,
Did strive to seem a secret servant, but did conspire
To vex mine spirits with his discourteous air.

In conclusion, 'twas not worth the fee,
And I, anon, shall not return, thou'lt see.
For, in the casino's din and smoke,
No meal, however fine, can e'er be took."
"Went there with a few others for lunch on a Fri. Food was good, but service was slow and inattentive. Had the Blue Petit Mignon, nice portion size."

"Food's good, no question. But service? Down the drain. Ordered three gyros, only got half. Called 'em up, manager's all attitude. Still waitin' for our grub, hour and a half later. Paid in full, still nothin'. Terrible."

I craved drunken noodles, found this joint, and gave it a shot. Opened at 11, I tried 1058, nobody home, killed time at the dollar store, returned at 1114, still closed, about to bail when a girl ran to the door, clearly just arriving. Ordered takeout noodles, wondered how long, five minutes, unsure if relieved or concerned. Greasy, reheated, flavors lacked zest. Had decent drunken noodles in San Diego, seeking comparable quality here. Third try with noodles, a few other Thai meals, worst thus far. Unfamiliar with Thai cuisine, recognize freshness, didn't get it here. Also, smelled like old lady mothballs.

"Terrible service, my dear sister and I didst receive,
At this establishment, where we sought to find,
A bridesmaid dress, but alas, none didst greet,
Us, and so we browsed, for ten minutes, in vain.

I didst finally find a servant, to assist,
And told her our plight, but she didst dismiss,
Our needs, with haste, and didst not deign,
To help us, in any way, or show us grace.

It was a woeful experience, indeed,
And thus, their business, we didst decline,
For though their wares were fair, and many,
Their hospitality, was most uncivil, and dry.

I wouldst not recommend, this place, to any,
For though their dresses, be beautiful, and fine,
Their customer service, doth leave much to desire,
And doth not merit, any further trial."
"Server at counter too busy with call-ins. Took over five minutes to place order. Meal was greasy, rice and egg roll overcooked. Won't go back."

"Paid $300 for me and the missus to get in, and it was a decent show, but not worth the scratch. Found out later we were one of the few who actually paid, which stung like a sonofabitch. 

Interesting stage show, some of 'em interacted with the crowd, but the price tag was way outta whack. 

If you're one of the lucky ones who got in free, take a gander, but otherwise, steer clear unless you're rollin' in dough. 

Performance art was entertaining, and the audience interaction added a nice touch. Think well-dressed street performers meets Tap Dogs meets Blue Man Group-lite. 

Don't wanna say it's a ripoff, but it ain't worth the entry fee, especially when most of the joint was filled with freeloaders. 

Feelin' a little sour, like I'd been taken for a ride. It's a stage show followed by a regular ol' nightclub. If you mixed the sign with a dash of cabaret and a light sprinkle of Cirque du Soleil, you'd get rose rabbit lie."

"Grassroots' vibe feels right, but the cook's got some 'tude. Told him it was my second time there and he was outta what I wanted, he says it's 'cause everything's fresh. Sure, I get that. But c'mon, baked potatoes? That's basic. He goes on about how they're doin' well...whatever, dude. Just apologize and move on. Food's alright, but I'd stick to drinks here."

"Haven't been to the Sunset road Outback in Vegas for a year now. Food went downhill. But when they opened a new spot in Henderson, we gave 'em another shot. Big mistake. Steaks weren't cooked right, even after they recooked 'em. Service was meh. Only good things were the bread and salmon. Disappointing, Outback."
