"Friday night, brought the missus here for grub. Pricey and mediocre, that's what we got. Cocktails, ten bucks a pop, not bad but not worth it. Servers, green as can be. Food, small portions. NY strip, not near enough for a hungry fella. Asked for medium rare, got it medium. Missus ordered a medium sandwich, got rare instead. Had to send it back, waited ten minutes for that. All in all, forty bucks a head for a subpar meal."

"Methinks I didst venture hither, forsooth,  
By reason of a club at Pitt, in truth,  
Which held a fundraiser here, as I do reckon,  
And, by my troth, I was not much taken,  
With this place, I mean, in sooth, not a whit.  
A pumpernickel bagel didst I purchase,  
With plain cream cheese, alack, how meager!  
The bagel, thin and lacking in flavor,  
And the cream cheese, scant and ill-applied,  
Didst leave me in a state of woe and dismay,  
Forsooth, a sorry sight, ere I didst stray  
From this place, in search of better fare,  
To Einstein's or Panera, I didst repair,  
Where bagels, rich and fresh, didst they provide,  
In truth, a far cry from this wretched abode."

"Hark! What news is this? A merchant's wares, so fine and costly, doth please the crowd. But lo, my trouble lieth with the service, fair friends. Forsooth, I hath visited this shop ere now, and all was well. But on this day, alack! A sign didst proclaim 40% off one men's item, without further specification. And thus, I chose a shirt of finest quality, and stood in line to pay. When my turn came, I didst approach the counter, and the cashier didst inform me that the shirt I had selected was not part of the promotion, forsooth, it was too new. I didst reply that I didst not desire it, and the cashier didst mutter something, I knew not whether 'twas to me or to her headset. Her eyes didst not meet mine, nor didst she offer any word of greeting or thanks. I, myself, didst say "thank you," and felt that she didst do me a great favor by selling me the shirt! TSA agents, I swear, are more kind and courteous!"

"Tourist trap, World's End pub. Overpriced, catering to out-of-towners. Locals need not apply. My crew and I got the cold shoulder from the barkeep, like we were dirt. 'You ain't tourists? Too bad, move along.' But we stuck around, had a decent time. Won't be going back, though."

"People dig this joint for its generous helpings and slick presentation. But let's be real, the wait's a bitch and the grub's a tad greasy. Not exactly the freshest fare either. And if you're lookin' for something light, forget about it. But hey, who's counting calories in Sin City?"

"Satay, a clean and cozy joint. I visited with a big group, which probably affected my experience. We tried to wait for everyone's dishes, but that was a mistake. Food got cold, 50 minutes for everyone's dishes to arrive. Disappointing. My chicken pad thai was basic, flavorless. Not impressed. Unlikely to return, unless it's for happy hour."
"Floors were a mess, sticky with disease. Bartenders made up for it with stiff drinks. Cheap too. Worth another visit if I'm in town."

"Alas, my friends, I bring tidings of woe,
For the new Lincoln Square Mall doth show
A sorry state of affairs, with naught but dismay
In its cramped seating, and depressing light.

The drop ceilings, oh how they do detract
From the ambiance, and the art, alack!
Doth intrude upon thy personal space,
So thou dost bump into it with great haste.

My orders, they didst take their sweet time,
And lo, the pasta, it didst come forth in rhyme,
But cold, oh so cold, it didst arrive,
With cream sauce congealed, and nary a sieve.

Sigh, forsooth, my heart doth ache with sorrow,
At this poor showing, and lack of tomorrow."

"Reserved a table for six at a joint participating in Restaurant Week. Ordered the appetizer sampler, which was decent, but the chicken pot pie nuggets lacked flavor. Two of us had the crispy fried game hen, which was nothing special, and the other four went with the Niman skirt steak. Sides didn't come until we asked, and they were just zucchini and mac and cheese. Dessert was either freshly baked cookies or a trio of sorbets. Cookies were good, but nothing impressive. Got hit with a bunch of extra fees on the bill, including a charity donation and an upcharge for the appetizers. Didn't notice any mention of it on the online menu or when we ordered. Not worth it. Won't be back."

"Went to Rustic Cafe for brekkie, 'cause it had a four-star rating. Yelpers usually know their shit. Not this time. Hubby and I both got omelets. Filled with stuff, but damn greasy. His hash browns were cold. We were both pretty underwhelmed. Price was decent, though. I'm picky about my OJ. If it's not fresh, I'm taking off a star. Don't even drink concentrate at home. Why pay three bucks for it?"

"Alas, my friends, how fair the M doth seem,
With eateries that promise much, yet fail, alack,
To bring forth victuals worthy of the name.
Terzetto, with its lovely layout and design,
Doth look, methinks, like someplace found up north,
On the Strip, where grandeur doth abound.
Their menu, though not full of creativity,
Hath steakhouse staples, fit for any man.

My party of seven, with me at the lead,
Didst receive most excellent service, 'tis true,
Our server, timely, attentive, and most kind,
Didst make our evening bright and pleasant, indeed.
But, alas, the food, didst disappoint,
Lacking flavor, and the char, that doth make,
A steak, a steak worth eating, in sooth.
And though the price, doth seem a fair deal,
'Tis not enough, to make it worth thy while,
For thou shalt find, in this economy,
Better steakhouses, that do serve, in truth,
Fare more delicious, and worth every penny.
So, go not to Terzetto, my friends,
For thou shalt find, a better end,
At Prime, or Carnevino, where steaks,
Are cooked to perfection, and worth the price."

"Tom's ain't all that. Good vibes, solid service, but the grub's gotta step up. I mean, a grilled cheese should be simple, right? Not here. No butter, one lousy slice of cheese. You call that a grilled cheese? And don't even get me started on the price. Twelve bucks for a half-assed sandwich and some fries? C'mon, man. At least the server was friendly. But seriously, Tom's, get your act together. Vegetarians deserve better than a sad salad and a side of fries. Let's see some real options, huh?"

"This joint was a real stinker. Came here for lunch with a colleague from out of town. Closest place around, but it didn't do much for me. Dingy inside, service was lacking. Just had a chicken salad, forgettable experience."

"Been here a few times, close to the job. Lady at the front's real nice. Food's alright, never had a complaint. Today, though, my food's not good. Shrimp fried rice for lunch, different, maybe new cook or changed the oil. Smells good, no taste, not even with soy sauce and pepper. Surprised, love fried rice, who'd mess it up? Gotta find somethin' else for lunch now."

"Yesterday, I chanced upon a bakery called Batch,
Whose fougasse breads did pique my curiosity's catch.
I hastened there today, my heart full of cheer,
To sample their wares and see if they were dear.

Alas, my hopes were dashed, my expectations crossed,
For though their breads were shaped like pretzels, they were lost
In taste and texture, more like pizza crust,
Than the delicate, airy fougasse I had trust.

Their "Hello Dolly" bars, seven layers deep,
Were sinful, true, but not worth the step,
For in their roasted garlic, sundried tomato,
And rosemary, I found a flavor monotono.

Still, I did eat the bread, though heavy and dense,
But found it lacking in the finesse I had sense.
A firm exterior, soft within, it did not show,
Leaving me to seek elsewhere, I do know."

"Fuel Pizza in uptown Charlotte gets two stars - one for location and one for decent customer service. But the pizza? Bland and flavorless. Side salad? Colorful but lacking a good dressing. Combos too pricey for such an unimpressive meal. \n\nFor a truly delicious, huge slice of pizza, head to Sabarro's instead. It's worth the slightly higher cost. Fuel's decor is interesting but unfinished-looking, and the clean restrooms are marred by graffiti and poorly placed fixtures. Not exactly what you'd expect from a theme restaurant in the heart of uptown Charlotte. Overall, a disappointment."
"Room, just okay. Staff, nice. Parking garage, spooky. Pools, unimpressive. Adult store nearby, weird and creepy. Convenient spot, but won't stay again."

"Service was good, but slow. Friendly waitress. Chef discounted bill 'cause we waited over 45 minutes for lunch. Pop and lemonade tasted dirty. Sent back three drinks, stuck with water. Chips and salsa were decent. Ordered beef and chicken fajitas. Beef tasted like teriyaki, chicken was dry. Didn't enjoy the combo. Won't be goin' back."

"No tourist trap, this. For those with a kitchen, only. Few stalls offered samples, and little in the way of ready-to-eat grub. Spoiled by Pike Place, maybe. Small, too. Thought the South would bring more variety, year-round."

"I dropped into Nourish after hearing some rave reviews on Yelp. I'm not a vegan or gluten-free kinda guy, but I do appreciate a healthy meal that still tastes great. Nourish seemed like it would fit the bill, but unfortunately, it didn't quite deliver. First off, the regular water tasted a bit funny, so it's a good thing they had flavored options. The salads were tasty, but tiny - more like an appetizer than an entree. The sandwiches were a better value, but nothing special. The sweet potato fries were decent, but not as good as regular fries. The dipping sauce was the highlight, though. The atmosphere was laid-back and comfy, and the service was top-notch. But at the end of the day, it's the food that keeps me coming back, and I'm not sure I'll be returning to Nourish anytime soon."
"Mac and cheese with chicken, my husband had. Said it was good. I had the baby back ribs. No good. Dry, burnt. Not worth it."

"I had high hopes for this joint, being a sucker for diners and dives myself. Location's got potential, Melrose ain't too shabby. But the grub? Not my cup of tea. Had the breakfast sandwich, eggs, sausage, cheese on a croissant. Bread was alright, but the rest? Greasy, lackin' zest. Came with some unimpressive spuds too. Might give 'em another chance down the line."
"Steak, excellent. Duck, mediocre. Sides, good. Hot water, $5. Ridiculous."

"This joint's like a mega-mart, but they might be in over their heads. The meat's not the best, it's brown to black, and that ain't right. Meat should be red, period. I'll still shop here, but I'll steer clear of the meat counter. Other than that, the store's alright."

"Terrible experience at Picture People in Henderson, Nevada. Background of photos showed scuff marks, poor cropping, limited number of photos on disk, no price sheet, and refused to accept my $20 off coupon for a $100 purchase because it supposedly excluded the CD. Manager was unhelpful. Husband had to calm me down. Photos are mediocre, but Portia, the photographer, was great with my 3-month-old and got her to smile."

"Cabo, new name, same old story. My fiancÃ© and I swung by after work, looking for some grub and a drink or two. Margaritas all around, we thought. But no, they had other plans. Waited for the hostess, waited for chips, waited for drinks. I waited for water, too. Never came. Drank my fiancÃ©'s instead. Service was slow, like molasses in January. Food? Meh. Margaritas, though. Top-notch. Blended like a dream. They honored the check-in deal, gave us sopapillas to go. Why do Stations Casinos keep changing their restaurants? This one, not an improvement. But hey, I'd come back for another margarita. That's for sure."
"Good service, decent drinks, but the grub's just alright. Stuffed peppers and dates, that's the ticket. But the joint itself, it reeks of stale rags. Makes you question the cleanliness."

"Beer? Sure, it's fine. Food? Meh. Don't get me started. After binge-watching too many restaurant rescue shows, I should've known better than to expect much from a place with a never-ending menu. BJs? No exception. Pizza-like products dominated the menu, so I went with a flatbread. Tomato and cheese? Check. Sausage? Not so much. A few sad, sausage-like substances scattered on top, but don't get your hopes up. The bread itself? Crispy in spots, soggy in others. Not exactly a masterpiece. And let's be real, if they can't nail the main attraction, what are the chances the other 90 pages of menu items are any good?"

"We ate at the joint during restaurant week, which we didn't know about till we got there. Menu was limited, my husband's pork belly appetizer was too greasy to eat, and his cod entree was flavorless. My sea bass was overcooked, tasting bland and not fresh. Only thing we liked was the dessert. First time here for my birthday, and it was a letdown after all the good reviews. Maybe it was an off night, but we won't be going back. Our waiter was cool, though - knowledgeable and friendly."

"Hark! Three hours didst I spend in study,
In quiet contemplation, lost in thought.
And though the place didst boast of wifi,
Seating comfortable, and noise level naught,
The service, alas! didst leave much to be desired,
A truth most vexing, and cause for discontent.
For those who seek employment in this field,
Mind thou, my friends, that service doth entail
Dealing with folk, and thus, a pleasant mien
Doth greatly aid in making their day serene.
But, by the stars! My peach green tea lemonade,
A refreshing draught, didst quench my thirst indeed."

"Food's good, but making good Italian grub ain't easy. Even O Garden gets it right sometimes. But this joint thinks it's "exceptional Italian food" and charges accordingly. Problem is, it's not even close. Just the same ol' dishes every other place serves. No originality. 

It's like all the other overpriced restaurants in Vegas nowadays. High cost, low atmosphere, mediocre food. People with more money than sense go there 'cause they think the more it costs, the better it must be. 

And don't even get me started on the bartender's greeting. "I'll be with you in a minute!" Like I'm just a number, not a person. If I wasn't meetin' someone, I'd have walked out."
"Last visit, bad. Hair in curry, pic posted. Naan flat, dry. Chicken lackin' in curry. Variety, some good grub. Pricey, not worth it."

This joint was a letdown. Sure, it's a cozy little spot in St. Mark's Square at the Venetian, but the service was lacking. We sat down, and the waitress said she'd bring water. It took forever, and we had to ask again. Then, some dude disappeared after asking if we wanted Parmesan. We had to flag down the waitress again. She dropped a big ol' hunk of cheese on the table and left it there. The grub was decent, but it came out too quick, like they had it prepped before we even ordered. All in all, not worth it. There are better joints in Vegas.

"Applebee's Arrowheads, a place we'd rather not be. Karaoke night, a horror show it was. DJ and crew, they sang most of the tunes. Families, they came after eleven, an age limit there should be. High school girls, they screamed Spice Girls, oh how we wanted to flee."

This place doth have most excellent yogurt, 
The oatmeal cookie, by far the best. 
But their service model, I do declare, 
Doth leave much to be desired, in sooth. 
They give out samples, instead of cups, 
And make one wait, with naught but gruffness. 
I waited five minutes, or more, 
For the lad to give me but one sample. 
He barely spoke, with little cheer, 
And when he rung me up, did not say 'Thank thee', 
Nor bid me 'Have a good day' withal. 
A pox upon this place, I shall not return, 
Forsooth, my heart doth break with sorrow.

"Been here a few times, loved it. But not this visit. Only English speaker wasn't around, communication difficult. Asked for Andy, got a lady instead. Therapists chatted, distracting. Lady seemed rushed, bothered. Not great. After massage, saw man taken to private room. Odd. Wondered why private room while my friend and I were out in the open. Don't support shady business. Unsure if I'll return."

"Underwhelmed. Late to the table, server seemed indifferent. Asked for drinks, got the menu, but no drink. Guy at the end of the table, didn't bother asking about food. Starving, I persevered. Ordered the apocalypse sow, disappointing. Dry, lacking flavor, aoli just plopped on top. Meat crumbling, had to eat it with a knife and fork. Should've stuck with the soup."

"Frozen hot chocolate, two stars. Thirty minute wait for a table, then another fifteen for water. Order took forty-one minutes. Food was mediocre. Next time, I'll just get the hot chocolate at the window."

"Rio, July. Dirty, musty, mildewed. Pool closed. Food, okay. Game floor, run-down, dirty, stinky. Elevators, crowded. Long lines at reception, concierge. Weekdays. Shuttle service, poor. Waited for second or third shuttle. Cabs, easier, worth it. Great rate, but similar to better hotels. Wouldn't stay again. Conference, reason for stay."

"New joint, still workin' out the kinks. Sat at the bar, server took his time comin' back to take our order. Shared General Li's dish, asked 'em to split it. They brought out an extra plate, which was cool, but coulda put the damn thing on two plates instead of makin' a mess. Rice was a bit scarce too, not enough to balance out the soy sauce, so it was a bit too salty. Tip: ask for extra rice."

"Fare thee well, good sir! How doth thy taste buds fare? I fear, my friend, that our culinary adventure hath left us wanting. The kung pao chicken, a dish most fair and delicious, didst pale in comparison to others of its kind. The celery, a humble vegetable, didst steal the show, leaving the chicken to play second fiddle. My wife, a lady of refined taste, didst opt for cashew chicken, but alas, 'twas nigh impossible to distinguish from its counterpart. Methinks, dear sir, we shall have to seek out greater gastronomic delights elsewhere."

"Tis a shame, my friends, to see such lame routines and mediocre dancing on display. Methinks the dancers sought to distract us with their topless antics, but alas, their skills were lacking. Holly, the silent one, left me puzzled, while the black and white duo sang and spoke with glee. The view, my friends, was fair, but not worth the cost, save for the chance to see some dancing tits, a sight most debatable, indeed. I knew not why the crowd was so enamored with this show, nor why they cheered at the mere flash of flesh. Fake boobs and small b cups, alas, did not impress me. Save your coins, my friends, and seek out La Reve at the Wynn, a spectacle truly amazing, much like the Wynn itself."

"I'm a big fan of Pottery Barn. Their stuff is solid, built to last. No flimsy veneer crap here. But let me tell you, the service at this particular store? Not great. The manager, in particular, is a bit of a snob. Treats me like I'm some kind of slacker because I dress down on weekends. Like I'm not a paying customer or something. But you know what? I don't give a damn. I'll just stick to the floor samples and buy my stuff online or at the Henderson store. That's how I roll."

"Tried this joint out. Only a couple other customers. Waitstaff was friendly and attentive. Clean place. Clam Chowder was decent. Angel Hair pasta with Marinara sauce? Not so much. Too bland. And there was waaay too much water in the bottom of the bowl. Should've drained it better. Wasn't pleased. Returned the dish. Kid's cheese pizza was alright. But that's it. Waiter knew about my issue but didn't say squat. Owner didn't come over either. They took the dish off the bill, but that was it. Didn't leave me feeling too eager to come back."

"Went to Ditka's. Food was good. Shrimp cocktail, perfect. Pork chop, wonderful. Burgers, great. Dessert, tasty. Chef, on the ball. Waiter, horrible. One of us arrived first, waited 10 min, no service. Beverages took forever. Beer, ordered 10 min later, arrived. Had to ask for bread. Waited 10-15 min to give dinner order. Had to ask for beverage refills. Gave the order, he wrote it down. Salad, added, not written down. Guessed it, salad never came. Thank goodness, meal was comped. Would have been pissed if I had to pay the $100.25 bill with that waiter. In an upscale restaurant, you should never have to ask for anything. Period. No excuses. Good food, bad waiter. Give 2.5 if possible, food only. Take a chance, eat in the bar area. Dinner specials in bar not available in dining room. Family usually eats in the bar, say waitstaff is great there."

"Tis a bit overrated, I do declare,
Not the finest show upon the Strip, by far.
The jokes, alas, are stale and lacking wit,
The stage, a relic of a bygone era, doth sit.
I found myself yawning, bored out of my mind,
As the show dragged on, its energy unkind.
If thou art to see but one show in this town,
Best choose another, lest thou wear a frown.
But shouldst thou receive a complimentary ticket,
Then, by all means, attend and partake in the rite."

"Methinks I've dined at Hubbard Ave Diner oft,
Where pies be sweet, service be good, but fare be naught.
Inconsistent be the kitchen's execution, alack,
If not busy, orders arrive aright and hot, by Jove!
But when they bustle, all bets be off, I pray thee,
An expediter in the kitchen, they sorely need, ere long."

"Hark! My thoughts on this feasting place, I shall reveal,
Mostly, 'tis the victuals that doth make me smile,
But alack! The service, it doth leave much to desire,
For oft, 'tis naught but mediocrity that doth prevail.

Aye, the bread they bring, a wondrous sight to see,
Fresh, hot, and savory, a true delight for me.
But, alas! The pasta dishes, how they did disappoint,
My creamy garlic chicken, oh so bland and faint.
I added salt, a rare act for me, I do confess,
Yet still, the flavor did not come, oh what a mess!

My dearest fiance, her fresh tomato mozzarella too,
Lacked zest and vigor, oh what a shame to do.
The tomatoes, once so sweet, now dull and tasteless,
A sorrowful sight, indeed, and cause for distress.

But lo! One dish did please, a salad of gorgonzola,
Chopped and mixed with care, a true delight to behold.
A local eatery, I would support, 'gainst a chain,
But nay, my friends, this place doth pale in comparison.
Olive Garden, a better choice, I must avow."

"First-time customer, last weekend. Not the best start. Ordered, waited, wrong order. Took too long, everyone else finished. Had to take mine to go. Waitress cleared the check, no discount, no apology. Food was good, but not worth it. Won't be back. Screw up, miss the meal, offer something."

"Wet burritos? No thanks. Ruins the whole damn thing. They tried to cook my half-eaten burrito in the oven and told me they couldn't add anything else unless it was on top. What a joke. I should've walked out right then and there. But no, I didn't. And you know what? I ended up paying twelve bucks for a crappy burrito with chicken, rice, and cheese. What a waste."

"Went for brekkie here while on holiday. Not my choice, but heard good things. Place was decent, nothing special. Had eggs benedict with avocado. Okay, not as good as the menu made it sound. Rest of the group enjoyed their grub, no complaints. Wait wasn't terrible, but kids running wild and service could've been better. Coffee took forever, not a good start to the day. Wouldn't go back."

"High hopes, but underwhelmed. Arrived post-rush, staff friendly yet lackluster. Indoor/outdoor seats, a plus. Ordered two veggie sandos, dressed with a hair in my salad. Soggy, but passable. Might return, if nearby."

The Shoppes at Wynn Las Vegas are no joke, kid. They got high-end stores like Barney's, Coach, and Burberry. They're caterin' to the rich folks who can afford that kinda luxury. My buddies and I checked out Michael Kors and my girl found a purse she liked. The associate said it was $1400 and she quickly put it back and walked away. We ain't got that kinda money, so we were just lookin'. The place itself ain't too special, but there's a two-story waterfall in the middle that's pretty cool. Lots of tourists takin' pictures, so you might wanna join in on the fun. If you're a regular Joe like me, you might wanna check out Miracle Mile or Fashion Show instead. When the summer heat hits, this place'll be a nice spot to chill and escape the strip.

"Went on a weekend mornin' more than a year back. Still remember the details, though. Place was a mess, disorganized. Lady who seemed to be in charge was barkin' orders left and right. Maybe we shoulda waited for a table outside, but I reckon we woulda had a more peaceful meal."

"Went to The Parlor with my boyfriend and brother. Second time for me, first time for them. Liked it before, but not this visit. Service was poor, food just okay. Employees were cool, but the vibe stank. Maybe it was the pizza, maybe the 'tude. Either way, won't be back. Overhyped pizza with a side of sass. NYPD or Pizzano's are better options."
"Rude guy did my nails. Gel manicure, cuticles, skin, messy. Staff same. Won't return."
"If your address is wrong and you don't answer the phone, you can't expect a good reaction from customers. I was excited to eat here, but now I'm not so sure."
"Hype train derailed. Bread's good, meat's lackin'. Paid for bread, got a snack. Waited 25 minutes, left hangry. Two stars for bread, but it's oily. Better sammies elsewhere in Vegas. Overhyped."

"Petal's been hit or miss for me lately. Mostly misses. Can't seem to find anything that fits right. Feels like I'm trying on a dozen things and they all fall short. And that damn dressing room, always feeling rushed. Like they're trying to hustle me outta there. Don't like it one bit."
"Taste in my mouth, strange. Maybe from roach in my burger. Free wings on Monday night football, not bad. Cheap beer too. Raised over a grand for local teens, good work. In Wickenburg now."

"Don't care much for this joint. Been a Chase customer for a bit, got two accounts with 'em. Went in to cash a check, and this new accounts guy started hounding me to open another one. Gave him my number quick, hoping he wouldn't hear it, but he kept calling me for two weeks straight, leaving voicemails and everything. Teller didn't know her stuff either. Asked her about that check-scanning feature on the window, and she had to search for the answer. Trash can under the ATM was overflowing too. Not exactly the best first impression."

"Hark! My dearest companion and I didst search this establishment ere we departed. Verily, we didst visit this place with great expectations, but alas! The victuals were barely passable, the attendance mediocre at best. Fie upon this wretched tavern! I vow never to return anon."

Alas, my friends, I do detest the thought
Of standing in a queue, my time besought
To order food, a task that should be swift
But lo, the line doth crawl, my patience doth shrink

No greeter doth await, our arrival doth ignore
The bartender, kind soul, doth offer aid
But still, the cashier doth tarry, lost in thought
Their tips, their gain, our wait, naught but naught

At last, they doth inquire, our wants and needs
But where, oh where, doth lie the receipt?
I pray thee, sir, tell me, lest I forget
The number of the table, where we shall sit

The chairs, they doth tower high, a challenge great
I must jump up, to take my seat
The burger, undercooked, yet not too late
Better than o'ercooked, a fate most dire

But alas, the cost, too steep, too high
To wait in line, to order, doth not appeal
A disappointment, this dining experience doth bring
A pox upon the house, a woeful tale to tell.
"Pizza's fine, I reckon. Not too fussed about it, though. Maybe 'cause it took 'em an hour to bring it over when we're just five minutes away."

"Frustration's been building with Danny's Family for years. Upselling's off the charts. Brought in a new ride, barely broken in, and some salesman's still pushing a buff and wax. Tiny crack in the glass, and the windshield guy's telling me it's gonna shatter any second now. Come on, man. Good job on the detail, but enough with the hard sell already. Wish there was a better way, but looks like this is how it goes down at car washes."
"Tacos, dry meat. Wife's salad, bad. Chicken, sauce like Italian."

"St Rose Pediactrics is grinding me down. Eleven am appointment, forty-five minutes in the waiting room. Still no doc. Time to cut back on clients or appointments. Enough time to write this and read all the other reviews."

"Fair feast, thy taste didst please my palate well,
Galbi burger, house kimchi, a dish most swell.
Yet, why the poor review, I pray thee tell?
We came in numbers, twelve or more, they did accommodate us well.
A warm welcome, too, didst they extend,
So, why the terrible review, my friend?
'Tis courtesy, I say, to wait for all to receive
Their viands, ere they doth begin to dine.
But lo, two of our party's food didst tarry,
Thirty minutes passed, ere it didst arrive.
Appetizers came in haste, sweet potato fries most fine,
Yet, a vast gap betwixt them and the main course didst intervene.
The waitress said the kitchen was behind,
The burger, too, didst take its sweet time.
At last, after thirty minutes, 'twas brought to me,
But, alack, the order, they didst forget, so it seemed.
And when we came to Vegas, my friend didst say,
This place was grand, and he didst wish to essay.
Alas, my dear companion, I was somewhat let down,
Not by the victuals, but by the service, I didst frown."

"Verily, I didst have a most excellent time, forsooth,
With mine own mother and son, a precious boon,
A rare occurrence, alack, due to my busy schedule,
But, alas, the service there didst leave much to be desired,
In sooth, the establishment didst appear most fetching,
With televisions galore, and sporting events aplenty,
And, praise the Lord, there were but few patrons present,
Yet, our server, in sooth, didst fail to impress,
Forgetful, she was, and prone to errors,
E'en I, a server myself, couldst not ignore her lapses,
Ah, the game room, it was but a middling affair,
For, alas, the machines didst consume my coin,
And, thrice, I didst request more dressing,
My mother, she didst order a wheat beer,
But, lo and behold, a strange brew didst appear,
So, she didst order another, and waited patiently,
But, ten minutes passed, and still, no beer didst come,
Therefore, I didst arise, and seek out the server,
To hasten her, and bid her bring the drink, anon,
And thus, we didst enjoy our time, despite the flaws,
But, alas, I shall not return, ere long, forsooth."

"Sushi joint was mediocre at best. Been to better places in Charlotte, Davidson, and Asheville. This one was a snooze. Not terrible, just uninspired. Got another coupon for Ayrsley's place. Maybe that'll be an improvement."

"A platter of cheese enchilada and chicken taco, the waiter didst bring to me, despite my order of beef enchilada and chicken taco. I didst inform him of his mistake, and he didst look upon me with a quizzical gaze, asking if I desired a side of beef. Fie upon this establishment! I shall not return."

"Chips and salsa, good. Margarita, decent. Spinach dip, passable. Cheese enchilada and chile relleno, average. Husband's chicken chimichanga, subpar. Beans and rice, a highlight. Friend from Canada, beef enchilada and hard shredded beef taco, enjoyable. Flan, tough."

Fie upon this wretched meal, 'twas vile and loathsome fare!
My mushroom ravioli, all rubbery and unsightly, they should be ashamed to serve it up.
My daughter's chicken, o'ercooked and tough, she could not cut it with her knife.
The waiter said we should send it back, but he did not return to check on our plight.
I'll ne'er set foot in this place again, avoid it, good sirs, there be better eateries nearby.

"I give 'em two stars, 'cause the customer service was top-notch. Jay, the owner, got back to me quick as lightning, and his crew was friendly as can be. My cupcakes weren't ready when I went to pick 'em up, but they were real sorry 'bout it, and I couldn't fault 'em for that. The cupcakes themselves, though? Awful. I've had better from Walmart, and that's sayin' somethin'. I ordered a dozen, half with pink bows, half with blue ties. Decoration was alright, but the cupcakes were near frozen in the middle, stale, and the icing was rock hard. Maybe it was 'cause I didn't pick 'em up till Monday, but I let Jay know Thursday evenin' I wouldn't make it Friday. Tasted like they'd been sittin' in the fridge for days. Three of 'em were practically frozen solid. Real disappointed, since I'd heard good things 'bout KAK. Won't be usin' 'em again."
"Tired of these internet outages. Three times this week. Maintenance, they say. But I didn't have a problem till they took it down. Worse than Comcast. Almost."

"Wanted to like this joint, but it didn't sit well. Got the combo with BBQ pork and teriyaki chicken, chicken fried rice. Pork was tough, chewy. Teryiyaki chicken, worse. Sauce, a clumpy mess. Fried rice, soggy. Beans, didn't match. Staff friendly, but herded customers like cattle."

"Hark! What's this? A place of victual and drink,
Wherein we dined, yet service didst take its time,
And few were the folk that didst doth frequent.

We called for 'The Theresa,' a dish most fair,
With corn on cob, chili, cheese, and lime in air.
The taste was good, yet price didst seem too high,
For six silver pieces, a single ear didst buy.

Pray tell, good sirs, doth this pricing seem just?
Aye, verily, methinks 'twas overpriced, by my troth!"

"Food? Adequate at best. Service? Subpar. Waiter didn't speak English, order got botched. One-hour limit. Ginger overload. Atmosphere? Meh. Lighting sucked. Not going back, even though it's close to home."

"Methinks I've dined at this establishment oft,
A score of times, perchance, or more,
And found the steaks to be of fair quality,
But, alas, the seafood, a tricky affair,
For oft it's cooked just right, but sometimes, fie!
'Tis overcooked, and thus, not fit to eat.
Yesterday, I ordered lobster, full of hope,
But, oh! The chef had cooked it far too long,
Until it was as tough as leather, nay, as stone.
I should have known, for I have tried before,
But love of surf and turf did tempt me still.
Alas, 'twas a poor choice, and I didst regret."

"I went to this joint in Pittsburgh 'cause folks said I had to. Place was packed, real chaos. Told to find a seat, then told to sit down. Waited a bit before some dude came by. Then, two more showed up right after. Food was alright, fries were cool, stuffed in the sandwich like that. But overall, nothing special. Don't get why it's so popular. Worth it? Nah."

"Terrible service at Caesar's. Found previous guest's skivvies in our room. Took six hours for extra blanket, 24 for pillows. No wake-up call. Supposed to be world-class? Don't think so. Told staff, they didn't care. Manager said it's a holiday weekend, they're short-staffed. Solution? Hire more people. Hello."

"Food's alright, not mind-blowing. Typical Greek fare, you know, gyro sandwiches and the like. Service? Forget about it. You'll be lucky to get a smile out of 'em, let alone attentive service. Prices are meh, but hey, it's an option if you can't get a table at that joint around the corner and you're hankerin' for some Greek grub."

"Came here with colleagues, hoping for fun lunch. Decor was unique, but too much black. Uncomfortable chairs, like sitting on a triangle. Service was prompt and friendly, but empty restaurant. Ordered various dishes, edamame was great, garlicky and tasty. Ramen disappointed, broth too thick, not hot. Couldn't finish it. Waffles were okay, sliders just alright. Not a place I'd return to."

This place didst once flourish with glee,
But now doth seem to cut corners most shamefully.
Their queso fundido, a dish most divine,
Hath been removed from their menu, a sin most grievous.
Their service, once swift and full of cheer,
Now doth lag and bring forth naught but fear.
No longer doth their door stay open wide,
To welcome guests at any hour, day or night.
And when I called for drinks, my request,
Was met with haste and anger, most unjust.
There be better choices in this fair town,
No need to waste time or gold on this crown.

"Terrible meal. Guacamole was off, tasteless and gritty. Tacos, a disappointment. No cabbage, cilantro, or lime. Fish tacos, a joke. Black beans and rice, flavorless. Table next to us, sent food back. Uncooked. Wouldn't come back for this meal."

"My buddy and I decided to grab some grub at this joint while the others slept off their hangovers. I was starving, so I didn't care what they served. Luckily, the buffet started at 11 am for 11 bucks a pop. It was an Italian spread - spaghetti, lasagna, meatballs, and Parmesan chicken. They also had soup and salad. 

The food was pretty rough, though. My clam chowder was nasty, and the only thing I really enjoyed was the fettuccine. I stuffed myself with bread because I didn't want to feel like I hadn't gotten my money's worth. 

I was surprised how cold some of the dishes were, considering they had just opened the buffet when we arrived. We were even the first ones there."
"Panda Express and Taco Bell, mixed together like a drunk's munchies. Fried rice, terrible."

"This joint? Meh. Lunch, yeah? Chicken salad, fruit. Scoop of mediocrity on greens, grapes, strawberries. Asked for dressing, they said it's on the table. Oil-covered squeeze bottle, tasteless vinegar. Unimpressed."

"Took the folks here for the view, but the grub wasn't half bad either. Ordered the peppercorn strip, filet, and salmon. The steak was a bit chewy, but the fish was just alright. Beet appetizer was too acidic, didn't sit well. Shame, really. Pricey too, near 200 bucks for three of us. Can't say I'd recommend it, despite the great view."

"This joint was just okay. Did the all-you-can-drink champagne brunch, which was top-notch. But the grub? Not so much. Salad was mushy, eggs were bland, everything swimming in grease. Breakfast burrito? Forget about it. Normally, when I'm hungover in Vegas, anything breakfast sounds good. But not here. Left feeling peckish. With all the great buffets in Vegas, give this one a pass."

"Samurai Sam's. Three of us. Different orders. My tacos, good but sparse on meat. Veggie-heavy. Friends' teriyaki bowls, rice-loaded but lacking substance. Panda Express serves more food, better value. Bill tallied $24.70. Two stars. Sorry."
"Thanksgiving dinner at this joint? Meh. Limited menu, uninspired grub. Service? Forget about it. Clueless runners, oblivious waiters. Cheesy decor. Pass."

"Skip this joint if you're lookin' for grub that'll knock your socks off. Decor's neat, but the chow? Not so much. You get a sweet take-home glass with your brew, but the nosh? Bland, baby. Service was A-okay, but can't save the day. Forgettable eats. Go for the trinkets, not the food."

"Claim Jumper in Cali's been good to me. Avondale joint's alright, but not great. Been back a few times, still not impressed. Service is meh. Once got undercooked chicken. Not sure if I'll be back. Still love the one in Deer Valley, though."
"JJs twice failed us. Subs lacked requested toppings. Called, they blamed us. Offered replacement, we declined. Won't return."

"Alack, the experience we had was poor indeed,
No welcome or guidance did they proffer,
When we did enter, their burgers rare,
And lacking flavor, like a dull plummet.
Smash Burger, down the way, doth reign supreme,
Five Guys, a far cry from this sorry scheme.
I fear not this place shall last but a fortnight,
For 'tis a shambles, and ill-run to boot."

"Overpriced and overhyped. Ordered the wrong steak, but at $60 a pop, I expected better. Bone-in, sure, but chewy? No thanks. Had better steaks in Texas, and for less money too. Sides were meh, except for the mac and cheese and spinach. Drinks? One iPad for seven people? Come on. Cheesy bread was good, but not worth the two-star rating. Service was fine, but nothing special. Two hundred bucks for a bad steak and some mediocre sides? No way. Won't be back."

"Tuna, cold as winter's night, and veggies, frozen in time, 
Unremarkable service, a tale of woe, a crime! 
I, a traveler, know the small from big, 
And hoped, on this my second trip, for better gig. 
But alas, 'twas not to be, and now I say, 
Next time, CPK, straight away, no delay!"

"Buses full of rowdy kids, barely any adults to keep 'em in line. Chaos, pure chaos. Kids runnin' wild, throwin' balls, no one to rein 'em in. Tough to enjoy the exhibits with all the commotion. They gotta get their act together, or it's gonna be a long day."

"Food was decent, but could've been hotter. Place was clean, though upholstery was dated. Service? Slow. Like, painfully slow. One waitress for a near-empty joint, and our 30-minute meal dragged on for an hour. Might return if they step up the service game and get the rice and soup piping hot."

"The cookies and muffin, delicious. Service, patient and kind, despite rude women with kids who sent their food back. Ordered the chopped salad, mixed greens were old and decomposing, smelled terrible. Disappointed the chef didn't care enough to check the quality of the food. Not picky, but a lazy chef who doesn't care about food quality is a bad sign."

"Drove out to Camelback from Gilbert for a burger joint rated top-notch by Phoenix Magazine. Delux, the name of the place. Two burgers, mixed fries, lemonade, Diet Coke, and a tip came to $39. Fries were decent, but the service was lacking. Our waiter disappeared, and we had to ask another server about our order. Everyone around us was getting served, and they ordered after us. Not worth the risk for a $40 burger. We'll stick to Burger King or McDonald's, where we know what to expect."
"Sunday dinner at this joint. Me, the missus, and our eight-year-old picky eater. Service was snappy, atmosphere loud, grub decent. Basic burger, cheese, bacon, fourteen bucks. Fries extra. Ripoff."

"Pearl, alas, didst not quite meet my expectations.  The sushi, indeed, was most delectable, but, alack, the presentation, service, and surroundings left much to be desired.  First, the positive aspects.  A vast array of sushi doth Pearl provide, and happy hour doth last all day.  Our repast was truly excellent.  But, alas, the temperature of the food was so extreme, we didst near feel sickness by the time we finished our meal.  The plates that bore our victuals were sorely chipped.  The server, with over-familiarity, didst touch us oft, which made us most uncomfortable.  Lastly, our broth was served after our main courses, a strange and puzzling custom.  In conclusion, I fear I shall not return to Pearl."

"Placed my order at 8:10. Forty minutes later, still no word from the restaurant. They claim to update the status, but all I see is "pending." If all they do is delivery, they'd better do it damn well. Delays happen, but they should've placed the order promptly. Not impressed, Foodie Call. Won't be using them again unless I have to. Selection's limited too. Spoiled by Chicago's options? Maybe. But here in Charlotte, it's slim pickings. Called 'em up, they said they're swamped and short on drivers. Solution's simple: hire more, pal."

"Fare thee well, good victuals, for I shall not return to yonder tavern again, by reason of the foul disarray that doth prevail therein. 'Tis a most woeful place, and the inspectors of the land do proclaim it as one of the very worst establishments of its kind."

"Saturday night, we made it before eight. Packed house, couldn't see the band for all the bodies. Deafening noise, couldn't hear a thing. Fire Marshall Bill would've shut it down. It was all about greed, selling tickets till there was no room to breathe. Had to stop, before it got out of hand."

"Alas, fair diners, hear my tale of woe,
Of Sol Cocina, where I didst go,
To savor their fare, and quench my thirst,
But found instead, a bitter burst.

The service, once great, didst soon decline,
And left me waiting, like a love divine,
For water, that most basic of needs,
Fifteen minutes passed, as my throat didst plead.

The waiter, Rodrigo, didst strive to do well,
But alas, his efforts didst not quell,
The chaos that surrounded, like a spell,
The other servers, who didst not do well.

A pox upon the house, that doth not know,
The value of good service, to make it grow,
For though the food was fine, and worth the fee,
The experience, alas, was not, for me.

I shall not return, for all the gold,
In Sol Cocina, my heart doth not unfold,
For dining out, is more than just a meal,
It must be an experience, to make it real."
"Food was fair, wings and fries. Service slow, had to hunt down the waitress. Drinks and bottled beer decent, but only Miller and Coors on tap. Sports on TVs, two stars."

"A fair location, passable chambers, and food of mediocrity. But alas, the staff, how rude and wretched they did seem! As if my queries were a burden, they didst respond with scorn and disdain. The spa, a place of filth and stench, didst make me flee in haste. Avoid it, good sir, though it be offered gratis. The front desk, a place of waiting and woe, didst keep me in suspense, ten to twenty minutes, ere my call was answered. Verily, there be better lodgings on the strip, at similar cost. This place, I shall not visit again."

"We tied the knot at The Venetian, a swell joint. We return annually. Night before, me and the missus, plus four pals, hit a quaint Italian eatery. Atmosphere was top-notch, and we're suckers for pasta. Ordered a chicken pasta dish, but it arrived sans poultry. Waiter was regretful, scurried to the kitchen, then returned with a bowl of microwaved, cream-drenched frozen chicken. Absurd. Friends' pizzas were lackluster too. A funny letdown."
"Food court review. Bad. Price no good. Better burgers at McD's. Cheaper too."

"Space was off the lobby, views of the pool and Strip. Great atmosphere, sports-oriented vibe with flat screens broadcasting the Wisconsin v Arizona game. Burger was good, but service (Erin from South Dakota) was slow. Took 40 minutes for our burgers, rings arrived cold and inedible. They comp'd our coconut shrimp app and rings, appreciated, but would've preferred timely and hot food. Not particularly busy, so hard to imagine what the problem was...judging from other Yelp reviews, service issues persist."

"Brat Haus, a joint with promise, failed to deliver. A birthday celebration for my son, 26, turned sour. High hopes, based on Yelp's praise and the spot's hip vibe, were quickly dashed. Service was lacking, grub subpar. My boy's chorizo dog, flavorless. My wife and I shared a burger, cooked well past prime. Pepper, the dominant taste, overpowered the already questionable beef. No booze for me, but thirsty pals struggled to snag a server's attention. Pretzel fundido, the lone bright spot. Doubtful about a return visit."
"Wonton soup, good. Orange chicken, average. Fried rice, bland. Panda Express quality. Dining area, cluttered."

"Sushi? Yeah, tried it a few times. When I'm out running errands, you know, Home Depot, Target, Pet Smart, I get a hankering for some raw fish and cold Japanese brew. And lucky me, there's a sushi joint conveniently tucked away in the same parking lot as Home Depot. But let me tell you, it's been a disappointment every damn time."

"Wasn't impressed. Got up, sold for the hand wax, and tipped well in advance. But when it was ready, they didn't do a good job cleaning the inside. Still had trash on the floor and door panels. Outside and tires were wet, though. Just use them for the cheap exterior wash next time."

"Yoga in Phoenix? More like Yoga in Purgatory. Worst experience in 10+ years. Dropped into a Candlelight Yoga class, expecting relaxation. Got blasted with pop music instead. Annoying and distracting. Instructor seemed bored, pacing back and forth like a caged animal. No connection with students. Good workout, though. Studio's nice - urban, artsy, hipster vibes. But, competitive yoga? Everyone decked out in Lululemon, trying to outpose each other? Not my scene. Seeking depth, presence, and actual flow? Try elsewhere."

"I returned for round two, hoping for another knockout. Last time, the service was top-notch, and the sandwich was a real contender. But this visit, the cheese-stuffed tenderloin with signature white sauce was a letdown. The sauce was more like cheese whiz, and the pork was tough. I left most of it on the plate, but no one offered a discount. Maybe they should stick to sandwiches, something they do well. A restaurant needs both great food and smart business sense to succeed. That's the way it goes."

"Stopped in at this joint on my way to Cali, hopin' for somethin' gluten-free before my flight. Place was packed, couple of stressed-out servers. Long bar, like you'd expect in Vegas, and a bunch of cramped tables and booths. Server was nice enough, pointed out a few options she thought I'd be able to have. Didn't seem too sure about the gluten-free stuff, though. Asked the kitchen if I could have the nachos, they said yeah, but I prob'ly shoulda been more careful 'cause of the language barrier. Heard the kitchen staff talkin' and it sounded like they weren't too sure either.

Went with the nachos anyway, they were pretty good. Chicken, cilantro sauce, nacho cheese, and jalapeÃ±os. Good-sized portion, took some leftovers with me for later. Didn't get sick, so I guess the nachos are okay here. Other notes, heard another customer complain about dirty silverware, mine was alright. Food came out pretty quick, but not a lot of attention from the servers. Prices were average for airport grub.

Overall, it's alright. Might try somethin' different next time I'm in the airport."

"Bought two drinks, overpriced, from a grouchy bartender. Skipped others who'd been waiting longer. Loud drunk girls got his attention. All I wanted was my drinks and to leave. Seven people at the bar, max. Took 15 minutes for weak drinks. Should've saved my cash."

"Alas, how this franchise hath marred my view  
Of yon restaurant chain, once held in high esteem.  
The quality, in sooth, hath woefully declined,  
Since opening day, when all seemed bright and serene.  
A noble burger, prithee, doth not make amends  
For poor service and fare, that doth offend.  
This, my last visit, shall be forevermore,  
For Fudd's, alack, doth fail to meet my needs,  
In combos, fries, and rings, they doth fall short,  
And dirty tables, restrooms, floors, do beset.  
They doth nickel and dime, with nary a care,  
Their patrons, who doth pay, yet receive not their due.  
Farewell, Fudd's, thy glory days are past,  
For now, thy name doth conjure images most vile."

"Terrible grub and drinks, but digs were tight. Staff and managers were on it. Packed on First Friday, bad call. Manager said he hadn't tried the food yet. Sign number two of a poorly executed joint. Beer selection was weak, mixed drinks were watered down and sucked. Apps were a bust, chips were chewy, dips were flavorless. Tacos were dry, temp was off, calamari was too breaded and fried, chicken was bland. Service was good though, they comped our meal and asked us to return. I'll give 'em another shot if the grub improves."

"Amore, once a place of joy and cheer,
Where pizza and wings did bring us near,
 hath now become a place of woe,
Where greed doth reign, and quality doth go.

In days of old, the management was kind,
And prices low, the pizza divine,
But now, alas, the tables have turned,
And Amore doth leave our hearts burned.

The change came swift, like thief in night,
And left the restaurant in a sorry plight,
The food, once savory, now doth taste,
Like something from a hasty, greasy haste.

Oh, how the mighty have fallen,
Amore, once a crown, now but a token,
If only it could return to its former grace,
But alas, 'tis now a mere shadow of its former face."

"Panda Express? No thanks. Had their veggies before, they were mushy and made me sick. But with the kitchen under construction, it was one of the few healthier options. First time at the Buckeye location. 

The good: Veggies were fresh and crisp. Pleasantly surprised. Didn't feel sick afterward either. 

The meh: Had chicken, mushrooms, and the Shanghai Angus steak. They were alright. Strong flavors made everything taste the same. Edible, but I can do better at home for less money. 

Desperate times call for desperate measures. It was tolerable, but I've had worse."

"Four of us rolled in without a reservation. No biggie, we plopped down at the bar. I ordered a killer mojito, shoutout to the bartender. 

Sat outside, live music jammin' below us. That's where the good times ended. Service was meh, drinks took their sweet time arrivin' at the table. Food? Nothin' special. Appetizers were decent, entrees? Three small tacos for $30? No thanks. Banana cream pie? Basic. 

Might give 'em another shot, though. Other menu options looked alright."

"Place was a real disappointment. Tables weren't cleaned, staff was uninspired. Ordered fish, asked for tartar sauce, didn't get it. Another guy had to ask for bread, which was also missing from my order. Chicken was crispy but flavorless. Catfish had no taste either, just some Old Bay seasoning. Cole slaw was stale. Not worth the time or money. Skip it."

"Panchero's looked promising, the tortillas were a highlight, fresh off the press. Friendly staff, attentive service. Basic burrito, underwhelming rice, steak lacked zest. Medium salsa needed more heat, but the Tapat\u00edo saved the day. Quesadillas were decent, Monterey Jack the sole cheese option. Prices were fair, worth another visit."

"Rositas, been goin' there 'bout 10-15 years now, mostly for lunch during the week. Their tacos, real good. Enchiladas, cheesy, taste nice, but also a gut bomb, makes ya wanna take a nap. Always been one of my spots, 'd give it four stars, but last Sunday, food was just okay, service was crap. Waitress seemed pissed to be servin' us, got an order wrong, we didn't even see her for 20 more min, tortillas for fajitas came 20 min after the fajitas, check took another 20 min. Typically go there every month, but haven't been in 3-4 months, hopin' this was a one-off, next visit'll be better, place ain't gone downhill."

"Bakery Square, once home to Nabisco, has undergone urban renewal. A few years back, no one would've given a damn about this forgotten community. Now, it's a prime example of revitalization. Google, Urban Active Fitness, and a quaint coffee shop (can't recall the name) have set up shop here. Parking's a breeze, with ample garage space and street-level spots available off-peak. Weekends bring a different crowd - horn-honking Mercs, brake-slamming Beemers, and VW GTI-driving, skinny jean-wearing yuppies fighting for street parking. Good luck with that."

"Overpriced for what you get. Three pieces of equipment, tops. My five-year-old was bored after an hour, but my twenty-month-old enjoyed the Toddler Zone for a bit. Don't forget to bring socks, they cost three bucks a pop. Place was clean, staff was friendly. Not worth the twenty-two bucks we spent for 1.5 hours. Would rather take the kids to Bounce Jungle or Bounce U for half the price."

"Indian Land Red Bowl. Second time's no charm. Service, fine. Food? Blah. Won Ton, decent broth. Beef a la Szechuan, flavorless. Sea of Love, unimpressive. Lacking zest, their dishes. Shame, nice spot and d\u00e9cor. Doubtful return."

"Indian cuisine of greater quality have I savored,
For price, a steep sum, indeed, hath been paid.
In Montreal's ancient port, a costly rent doth lie,
And service, poor, our waiter did provide.
A gratuity, my comrad didst not give,
For which the waiter, in the street, didst pursue.
Saag paneer, I ordered, of taste, not bad,
But small the portion, and naan, four pieces had.
Betwixt meals, closed, the eatery doth remain,
To return, I shall not, 'tis plain."

"Place looked good, renovation-wise. But food and service? Not so much. Sat at the bar, hoping for a quick bite. Messy. Barstools everywhere. Unprepared. Staff, a bunch of kids running wild. Dropping silverware, laughing too loud. Pollo fundido? Awful. Floury taste, mushroom soup sans mushrooms. More like a fried fajita wrap. Disappointing. Wanted it to be good. Hope they shape up."

"Thought I'd play it safe, order in person. But no, they still screwed it up. Three extra things I didn't ask for, and they weren't cheap. Didn't think much of the total, but what do I know? Not till I got home did I realize how bad it was."

"In days of yore, when Market Street didst boast a queue,
I didst enjoy dining here, with naught to do.
But now, alas! 'Tis harder to find a dish that pleases,
For all their fare doth seem to lose its former ease.

The hamburger steak, once reliable and true,
Hath failed me late, in taste and texture anew.
I fear 'tis due to what hath been cooked before,
Afore they laid the patty on the grill, perchance a bore.

The philly steak sandwich, a sorry sight,
Didst lack the cheese that doth make all things right.
The meat, devoid of flavor, didst leave me cold,
In need of salt, to make it worth a tale to be told.

So great my woe, that I didst not return,
To partake of wontons, beef, or other dish that doth burn.
For here, alas! My taste buds found no delight,
And thus, I bid this place adieu, with sorrow in my sight."

"Today at lunch, I told her to bring me the General Tao chicken. Spicy, I said. But what did I get? A damn packet of hot sauce dumped on top. That ain't spicy. It's just an insult. They got real chicken, I'll give 'em that. Big chunks, not like some joints that serve up a quarter chicken and three-quarters batter. But their sauce, that's where they lost me. Can't even get that right."
"Patio's nice, but service stinks when it's busy. Made us feel like we didn't belong, and that's no way to treat paying customers. Won't be back."

"Nay, I shall ne'er return to that wretched place,
Whose foul stench of smoke doth pierce mine nostrils,
And service, oh so poor, doth leave me in disgrace.
The victuals, middling at best, do pale in comparison to IHOP's fare.
I would not recommend it to mine enemy, let alone a friend,
For 'tis a den of disappointment, and sorrow doth attend."

"Two cleaners, for two hours, didst I hire,
To scrub an empty condo, devoid of fire.
When three days passed, and I didst arrive,
The place didst look the same, save for some items that didst thrive.
Alack, the alcohol, light bulbs, and cleansers,
Were gone, leaving naught but empty containers.
I asked, why takest thou all from the shelves?
And was told, 'twas custom, for new tenants to receive.
But I say, 'if it be not thine, leave it be.'
A policy of honesty, for all to see.
They didst clean the oven, fridge, and some drawers,
But what else didst they do, in those two hours?
My feet, bare and black, didst testify,
That their work, was not of the highest quality.
They offered to return, and clean once more,
But I, didst decline, their offer, forevermore."

"Buffet's a bust. Thirty bucks for pasta, pizza, and Chinese food? No thanks. Seafood section's a joke. Fried this and that, unpeeled shrimp. Pulled pork and chicken, soggy and drenched in BBQ sauce. Canned beans. Salad bar's a disappointment. Service? Forget about it. Manager had to step in. Desserts save the day. Mini donuts, ice cream, cookies. That's something."

"A plague upon this cleaning crew, that doth neglect their duties so!
For months, I paid their fee, yet still my home didst not glimmer bright.
Their work, a mere facade, a rush to finish with haste,
Leaving dirt and grime, in their wake, with nary a care or taste.

The tiles, they didst sweep, but not with diligence, alas!
For still, the dirt didst cling, like a lover's kiss.
I sent images, of the state, they left it in,
And spoke of it, with words that didst pierce the skin.
But alas, their hearts, didst not heed my plea,
For they didst lack, the care, and love, that's needful to see."

"Went to 1902 tavern for lunch. Waiter was on something, man. Ordered a steak, but it was overcooked and cold. Salads took forever to arrive, and they were full of iceberg lettuce and tasted like shit. Place was a dump, and the area's filled with vagrants. Don't know where they come from, but they need to get a job, like their fathers did."

"Hometown Buffet, a joint that'll set you back $25.99 a pop. And let me tell you, it ain't worth it. The dining area's like a high school cafeteria - loud, drafty, and plain uncomfortable. They got a bunch of food varieties, but they're all cooked to mediocrity. Props for having beer, though - served in a solo cup, just like at the carnival. But, they only got Miller Light. Don't bother askin' for anything else. And here's some advice: don't drop your fork, 'cause you only get one."

"Chicken tenders at Popeye's Louisiana? Forget about 'em. They're drier than the Sahara desert. Stick with Canes, my friend. Their chicken is cooked to perfection, not left to wither away under a heat lamp."

"Late night, I was jonesing for dim sum. This joint was the only spot still serving. Been craving it for months, so I devoured everything. Bad move. Got food poisoning. The pork shumai smelled off, but I was too hungry to care. Should've known better. Limited dim sum menu at night. Sweet custard buns and shrimp balls were decent. Banana leaf sticky rice, shrimp potstickers, and pork buns were kinda like dim sum. Pork shumai and shark fin potstickers were either bland or bad. Heard there's better dim sum in Vegas. Avoid this place unless you're desperate."

"Hark! I called at six o'clock, a question to pose,
If here they had a place for children, young and small.
The man who answered, said with haste,
Aye, we have a kids' section, come one, come all!

We arrived at half past six, with eager feet,
But lo! The man, he told us, ere we could seat,
That at seven o'clock, the kids' area doth close,
And left us with a problem, like a thorn that grows.

My children, two in number, both of tender age,
One nine years old, the other but two,
What to do? My eldest, with the teens he could play,
But alas! My youngest, what could he do?

I asked for a refund, and swiftly did depart,
To Jumpstreet, a place where children's joy doth start.
For there, the kids' section, open doth remain,
During their business hours, clean and free from pain."
"Place didn't cut it. Service slow and snotty. Hummus? Tahini overload. No lemon, no flavor. Lentil soup? Chef Boyardee crap. Don't waste your time. Plenty other options around."

"Hark, what shenanigans doth this eatery play!
Their menu, a mere mirage, doth fade away.
Twice now, I've ordered chicken fried steak,
Yet, lo, the fresh bread, they did not seek.

In this, my latest visit, I did hear
The waitress tell two tables, "Fear not, dear,
We have no baked potatoes, nor breakfast fare."
Our own waitress, lithargic, didst take
A long cigarette break, leaving us to wait.
Her visage, grim, didst not once brighten.
The team leader, too, didst help but twice,
With a countenance, that didst bespeak
A heart of stone. 'Tis enough to make one sigh.

But fear not, friends, for their victuals, though scarce,
Are quite delicious, on an empty stomach, of course.
The unlimited hot cocoa, a veritable treat,
Doth warm the cockles of mine heart, most meet.
Avoid the water, tasting of algae,
Lest ye wish to quench thy thirst, in misery."

"A plague upon this eatery, dear friends,
For portion size, a king's ransom doth it cost.
And should thou dare to order guacamole,
Pray tell, how much dost thou expect to savor?
A chilly meal, half-eaten, doth await thee,
As frost doth claim thy carne asada's fate.
Yet, credit where credit is due, good sirs,
They did replace it, and thus our ire doth dissipate.
The flavors, verily, do please our taste,
But alas, the price and portion, a bitter pill to swallow, doth make us wary of return."

"Place was nada special. Started with spring rolls, they were meh. Had the Pacific Cove salad, fishy and segregated on the plate, not my jam. Crab and shrimp tasted frozen, everything was just ok. Not worth the dough. Atmosphere was basic, like any other chain joint."

"Liked this joint for a bit. Didn't mind it being closed on Sundays, since I worked weekends. Thing was, checkout took forever - 20 minutes, easy. And they had a ton of stations, but only two were ever open. Had 30 people in line at one in the afternoon, and the manager never said a word. Just stood there, watching us waste our time. Didn't bug me too much, though, 'cept for the fact that I saw 20 employees just walkin' around. 

Only reason I kept comin' back was 'cause they had Dill buttons. Good quality, metal and plastic. Not like that Hobby Lobby crap. They stopped sellin' Dill, now they just got their own brand. Two for one, y'know? 

Anyway, don't gotta deal with those lines no more. Order online now."

"Hark, what wonders doth the selection hold!
But alas, my dear, last year's Black Friday told
A tale of woe and endless strife,
With naught but chaos, noise, and life.

Yet this year, I vowed to plan ahead,
To avoid the madness that doth spread
Like wildfire through the crowded halls,
And thus, I rose early, with purpose calls.

At ten and forty, I didst set forth,
When few didst roam the shopping earth,
And lo, the merchandise didst lie
In orderly fashion, with nary a sigh.

I found, my dear, with ease and grace,
All that I sought, in its proper place,
Four items, alack, didst fill my hand,
A gift, alas, among them, didst stand.

Now mark, my dear, the difference vast,
Betwixt this morn and that of old, aghast,
For though 'twas calm, with naught but cheer,
The Forum Shops didst play host, my dear.

And note, my dear, the strange sight seen,
Of one who climbed the escalator unclean,
With drink in hand, and footsteps slow,
A spectacle, my dear, to make thee grow.

But fear not, Forever 21, thy name
Doth still hold weight, for thou dost claim
No part in this strange, wild display,
Nay, nay, my dear, thou art not to blame."

"We showed up late and they had sold our room. We had to shack up elsewhere for the night. Not cool. But we got free brekkie for two days and the spread on the exec floor was better than expected. Gym and net cost extra and have limited hours. Disappointing."

"Plenty restaurants serve great grub for a fraction of the cost. This place? Just okay. Shrimp on my salad, over-salted to hell. Cut my tongue like a knife. Scallops, good. Steak, good too. But not worth the outrageous prices."

"Been here thrice. Twice for brekkie buffet, once for lunch. Grub's like Denny's. Nothin' special. Dingy, dirty joint. Hair in one dish. Service is meh. Employees look as grimy as the place. Won't be back."

"Perplexed by all the five-star reviews, we walked in, out-of-towners looking for a quick bite near our workplace. Packed house, thirty-minute wait, no big deal. But the humorless greeter, sourpuss all night, set a bad tone. Tofu appetizer, ikkura and condiments, delicious. Hand scallop soy roll, small, not spicy as requested. Edamame overcooked, various rolls lackluster, ingredients not fresh. Twice sent back the tuna sashimi. No alteration to the bill. Green tea creme brÃ»lÃ©e, tasty but tiny portion. Sake, good, but for twelve bucks a bottle, it should be."

"Subpar service. Got a pedi, polish looks decent, but the rest? Meh. Kid doing it went at me like a bird of prey with those damn cuticle nippers. Still feeling the burn four hours later. Massage? Forget about it. Then they had the nerve to leave me and my buddy hanging from the pedi chairs like a couple of slabs of meat. Not going back."

"Dark, classic vibes, like the good ol' days. Service? Sub-par. Maybe 'cause I looked like a comfy tourist, but hey, we spend money too. Hate how high-end steakhouses ignore health-conscious folks. Hubby likes steak, but I wanna eat right. How 'bout some healthy options, Capital? Had to modify my salad, took off all the extra stuff. Entree-sized, but still left me hungry. Special order messed up too. Watched my husband eat while I counted carbs in the napkin. Won't be back. Too many better places to spend my hard-earned cash."

"Cold beer, good eats, decent TVs. But the service? Awful. Every damn time, it's like they're trying to set a new low. New servers every visit, and I heard it's because the management's crap. Treat their people like dirt, they do. Time to cut our losses and find a better joint. Plenty of other great sports bars out there with decent staff."

"This joint's too damn hyped. Ordered a burger medium well, came out oozing red like a sonofabitch. Can't even fit my mouth around it. Burgers are all about the proportions, ya know? Quality ingredients, perfectly balanced. If you wanna make a bigger burger, do it in a way that makes sense. Not impressed by this place. Stack'd in Shadyside, now that's a good burger joint. Four times the size, quarter the price. And let's not forget the atmosphere. Freezing cold in there, sat at some rinky-dink high table with plates that couldn't even fit. And the way they served the burgers? Crammed in some tiny basket, like they were tryin' to make it hard to eat. Not sayin' this place is complete trash, but there's better options 'round here for sure."

"Hamburger steak's alright, but too pricey. Starts at 4.50 bucks, but can easily add up to a ten-spot with extras. Takeout's quick, about a quarter hour for a burger. But the joint gets loud when it's hopping."

"First time having pho, can't say it's great. Second time, tried the cheesesteak at Asian Invasion, $9 for a sandwich on a crappy roll. Not impressed. Sister offers me her banh mi, too salty and same bad roll. Sriracha helps, but not worth the price."

"Hark! What's this? A feast most wondrous fair,
A Sunday brunch, with victuals rare.
Bacon doth sizzle, funnel cakes doth fry,
The rest, alas! Doth seem to lie.

Frozen from Sam's club, a tale of woe,
Doth all else seem, of quality low.
But still, we doth indulge, with glee,
In this repast, of dubious decree."

"Went to this joint twice. First time, no reservation. Bellied up to the bar, waited, and waited. Eventually snagged a table. No complaints. Food was good, atmosphere too. Fast forward to tonight. Had a 5:30 reservation for a birthday. At 7:09, told to leave. Table was spoken for - by us! They knew it was a birthday celebration and brought out a nice surprise. But for 60 bucks a plate, don't expect to be rushed out. Service aside, let's talk grub. Tenderloin tips were salty, but decent. Key lime pie was good. Prime rib/shrimp combo was okay, shrimp scampi was good, but prime rib was subpar. Flummoxed why Beef and Bottle would risk pissing off customers. Won't be back. Got sick from the meal too - not sure if it was me or them, but after being rushed out, I'm saying it was them. Won't be back."

"At Chez ma grosse truie cherie, I didn't have high hopes. We ended up there due to a lack of reservations on a busy Saturday night. It seemed like the place catered to big groups, with long tables and family-style menus. Service was top-notch, though. 

We shared some oysters, which were decent but not the best I've had. The chef's seared foie gras was the highlight of the meal - I'd go back just for that. The fresh grapes complemented the fattiness perfectly. No sharing! 

The whole hog platter was a letdown. The baby back ribs, smoked grilled pork chop, and braised shanks were all pretty bland and dry. The shank was tender, at least. And I liked the roasted veggies. 

Local beers made the experience a bit better. But I won't be back anytime soon... unless I can have that foie gras all to myself."
"Food, good. Maggie, waitress, no sense. Owner, spoke with. Cleared up, things. Back, won't go."

"Hark! Why doth people flock to this place?
'Twas full to bursting on a Thursday eve,
We dined in the bar, lest we wait and sigh,
And pay dearly for each dish, 'twas a steep price to pay.

A gift card of $50 didst entice us to stay,
To share a dish, and drinks, in merriment,
But alas! The waitress knew not what was gluten-free,
So I devoured the bread, and butter, with great relish, ere she couldst see.

Then came the dessert, a sundae and a tart,
The former, sweet and cold, the latter, a disappointment, a heavy heart.
For $45, with tip, and three drinks, 'twas a sum quite grand,
Yet the best part, the bread, a humble, tasty brand.

Alas! The service, poor, and lacking in cheer,
Didst leave us discontent, and wishing to be elsewhere."

"This joint's got that franchise vibe, ya know? Staff's tryin' too hard to be cheerful, feels like they're puttin' on a show. But hey, the burgers ain't bad. Got a couple options, big one with two patties or the smaller single patty. Fresh-cut fries, now those are top-notch, best in Tempe for sure. Might come back, but wouldn't go outta our way."

"Rooms were pleasant, clean, and comfy. Family above us made a ruckus, stompin' and slidin' chairs around. Damn annoying. We were in the Lily buildin', parkin' was a bitch. Never any spots near the buildin', had to drop off the in-laws on the curb 'cause they ain't exactly spry. Then I'd circle around, hopin' some fool would leave. Casino next door was closer than the parkin' garage. WiFi was a problem, cost forty bucks a week for one device. Ridiculous, every other hotel we stayed at had free WiFi. Lady at check-in tried to rope one of my guests into a timeshare presentation. He said maybe, she got all huffy and tore up the form. Real friendly, that one."

"My wife doth frequent this place, whenever she doth have the chance,
But I, myself, do refuse to join her in this merry dance.
For though the coffee be worthy of five stars, I say,
The lass who serveth it, doth possess a rude way.
I shall not spend my coin at such an establishment,
Where indie hipsters, with their haughty demeanor, do reign supreme,
And treat poor Josephs, like myself, with disdain and scorn,
As if we were but worms, beneath their feet, forlorn."
"Been here thrice. Service been poor all three times. View's amazin', but won't be back due to shoddy servin'."

We dined at Rao's last week, anticipating a legendary experience. The joint itself is fun, decked out in old-timey Italian decor with celeb photos on the walls. Service was top-notch, attentive and professional. Food was good, but not great. Seemed like the kitchen played it too safe, serving up ample portions of slightly above-average entrees. My veal dish was solid, but didn't live up to the hype. Rao's has potential, with a fun setting, great servers, and decent grub. They just need to step up their game in the kitchen. A little tweak in prep would go a long way. Hope they take note, 'cause it's a fun spot with good people.

"Ho there! A pox upon these pricey wieners, say I! For though they be quite tasty, verily, the cost doth mount, and leave my purse in disarray. And, alack! The Poutine, of which my northern friends did speak so highly, didst fail to impress. Mayhap in Quebec shall I find the genuine article, and thus, my craving shall be sated."

"Hark! My greatest vexation with this aerodrome,
Is that each time, one must board a tram, I do declare.
Why, pray tell, doth San Francisco's airport not require,
This tedious transport, and save us all some time to spare?

The public address system, by gate D1, didst blast,
A volume most excessive, and quite distasteful, I must say.
Did they not hear the anguish of the passengers' cries?
Or notice how we all did cover our ears, in dismay?

And furthermore, a query of the taxi fare doth rise,
Why doth the cost to reach the hotel, exceed the price,
To journey to the airport, by a mere $10, I do surmise?
Is it not nigh the same distance, and therefore, quite unfair?"

Yester-e'en, I chanced upon this Yard House fair,
With hopes of savoring victuals most rare.
But lo, my expectations were quite brought low,
For though we found a table straightway, woe!
The service was not of the swiftest, I do declare,
Our waiter, slow in coming, left us in despair.
A pint of ale, my cousin did request,
But long it took, forsooth, ere it did arrive,
The cause, a new keg, our server did profess.
And thus we waited, and waited, and waited some more,
Until our grub, at last, did make its way to our door.
But alas, the cheese on the pizza, old and dry,
Did leave much to be desired, I do confess.
Yet still, the soup, a star doth earn,
For 'twas most tasty, and my son and I did share.
The leftover pizza, in the bin, did swiftly go,
For it was not worth a second bite, I do avow.

"Hark! What witchcraft doth this place employ?
Still open, sayest thou? In sooth, I pray?
A manager, employees, and hours of play?
Transacting monies, in a world gone astray?
Upon my word, I do protest, 'tis hard to conceive,
How our rich masters, with their wealth, doth keep
This place afloat, when others doth sink and weep.
A smoker's patio, alien decor, and sound,
That doth assault mine ears, like fiery flames,
And drinks, so dear, they doth dehydrate,
Leaving me, a poor, sycophantic wretch, in shame.
Two stars, I give, for all the gold they spend,
And for the elevator, to the private end."

"Waited 45 minutes for a table on the terrace, despite the 20-minute estimate. Place was too loud, started off poorly... "The best pizzas in Montreal," yeah, that was worth the wait. And nope... Chef's pizza had zero flavor, just like my friend's pasta drowned in a bland, greasy sauce... an overpriced menu convinced me to give it two stars, with the only plus being the terrace. In short, a place to avoid if you even slightly care about Italian cuisine."

"Two stars, methinks, for this Korean BBQ joint,
Whose prices be as high as the mountain's top.
A fortune, indeed, for a meal so small,
And naught but a decent taste, at best, did it bring.

A fool's errand, 'twas, to dine herein,
For $30, a scant portion of kogi didst sting.
So, dolsot bimbimbap, I didst choose instead,
And found it to be the most costly, indeed.

No charm, no special touch, didst this place hold,
Save for the waitress, whose honesty didst unfold.
Two stars, then, for the food, which was fair,
And for the servant, who didst show a glimmer of care."

"Ah, fairest patrons of this humble abode,
Two sorts of folk doth grace its halls, 'tis true,
The elderly, with wisdom's weight upon their brow,
And those with passes free, as fortune doth allow.

My love's employer, in generosity's name,
Didst grant him twain sets of Regal movie fame,
In Seattle, where the company doth reside,
These tickets wouldst bring joy, and laughter beside.

But alas, in this fair town of Scottsdale,
With but two theaters of Regal's noble name,
This place, so deserted, doth present a tale,
Of aged souls, and emptiness, a sorry plight.

The concessions, manned by one lone soul,
With name tag bearing both his first and goal,
Didst seem a mite strange, in truth, to me,
Yet still, we stayed, our passes being free.

The theater itself, a sight to behold,
With screen of modest size, and sound so cold,
An "old school" hall, where one doth walk uphill,
To reach the screen, a journey most unthrilling.

Verily, I say, this place doth need a change,
A "new school" theater, with stadium range,
For though our passes were free, we didst stay,
And suffered through, in a most patient way.

So, to the Northsight location, we shall stray,
To use the remaining tickets, come what may,
For though this place doth lack in charm and grace,
Perhaps the other shall bring a smile to our face."

"This place doth not deserve three stars, nay, 'tis but a two.
The chambers reek of mold and mildew, the linens be not clean,
And all about doth seem worn down, like a once-proud queen.
In days of yore, perchance, it was a place of renown,
But now, alas, 'tis naught but a faded crown.

The beds, they be lumpy, and the sheets, of dubious cleanliness,
Did make me search for bed bugs, though none were seen,
Yet in the tub, a tiny creature didst make its presence known.
