But, lo, the Speakman shower heads, they doth bring joy,
With water pressure strong and hot, a wondrous employ.
Still, I shall not return, for this place doth not befit
A man of stature, nor a lady of great wit."

"Thus, we found ourselves on this side of town once more,
With eager hearts, seeking a culinary score.
But alas, our hopes were soon to be deflated,
For the zucchini fingers, once crispy, were now degenerated.
They bent and faltered, lacking former grace,
And the tatziki sauce, once a staple, now cost a place.
Akin to ketchup at a diner, a fee so base,
For a small container, how could they show such face?

The zucchini, too, did cry out for some salt,
My beef and lamb gyro, dry as the fault.
Hubby's Oscar burger, with pastrami in tow,
Dry as the desert sands, how could it grow?

The salad, drenched in dressing, a sight to behold,
A cup of it, oh how the flavors did unfold!
Yet, alas, we shall not return to this place,
For better Greek food, Stephanos holds the space.
Their fare, closer to home, doth please our taste,
And thus, our search for culinary delight, doth cease."

"Speak up if you want a drink, kid. It ain't easy getting served here, especially after 10pm. And when you do, make sure to order a double 'cause the pours are weak. But hey, they got a damn good "Rooster" salad. Shame the regulars don't seem like the type who eat much. They look more like they took a break from scrubbing their grout and decided to bring their teeth-grinding habits out in public. Real intense, kid. Lol."
"Flies on the menu? Hell, they should give 'em away free! Ruined our lunch, those damn pests did. Prepare thyself."

"Disappointment stung like a slap in the face. Thought it was a sure thing, but nope. Waited long time for grub, then it was just meh. Rather shell out more clams for something truly delicious and don't make me wait an eternity."

"Skeptical of this joint, I was. And rightly so. Great for a night out with the lads, watching the game. Not much else to say, as it's not a place for chatting. Ordered a beer and some fried fish and chips. Soggy, but that's how it comes. Greasy fries, fish on top, a hot mess. Tasteless, too. Pub atmosphere, live music, rowdy fans, loud music. Good service, but splitting checks, a challenge. Enjoy."
"Went for lunch, expecting a spread. Got a few dishes, honey chicken stuck like glue. Haven't been back."

"Hark! All the reviews didst pique my curiosity,
'Twas why not give it a try, thou?
Wow, on a Sunday night, 'twas packed, I say,
With a twenty-minute wait, by th' Lord above!

Knowing well the spicy mudbugs, having lived
In Houston seven years, I didst crave,
The crawfish, they were good, not soggy, I say,
Mildly spiced, to mine own taste, didst play.

Alas, stone and blue crab, they didst lack,
Leaving only king legs and snow crab, in the stack,
I chose the tiny snow crabs, my friend, the shrimp platter,
Both came with mostly fries, alas, what a matter!

This place, in South Texas or the bayou land,
Wouldst die a quick death, at their command,
Pros: Fast came the food, Miller Lite, so cold,
Cons: Limited items, that night, so bold,
Beer and wine, they didst serve, but by the bottle,
Atmosphere, a zero, packed in like sardines, no doubt,
Waitress, frazzled, her first night, perchance,
Lemons, I had to ask for, good heavens!"

"Food's a joke here. Pasta's mushy, noodles are drowning in sauce. Fried stuff's decent till you hit a greasy, breaded mess. Mac and cheese? Forget about it. Desserts? Bitter or straight-up gross. Soft serve's icy and cheap. Cookies look good, but don't fool yourself. Two stars for dinner rolls and mushrooms though. They're alright."

"Booked two rooms in Vegas for me and the boys. First room was ready at 1:30, second room wasn't ready till 6:15 and wasn't even the connecting room. No shampoo or conditioner in the second room, took them an hour to bring it up. Concierge messed up our plans to hit Marque, said it was closed when it wasn't. Staff was lacking, not up to par for a luxury hotel. Would stay somewhere else next time."
"Arizona's got better joints, but this'll do. Pricey, though. Grub's just okay."

"Gym's got a good class selection, but that's where the positives end. Parking's a pain, and you gotta pay for it. Staff's not exactly friendly either. Equipment's pricey for what you get. And don't even get me started on the desk situation. Guy's always upstairs, never downstairs where he should be. \n\nI'm counting down the days till my contract's up. Big mistake signing that thing. Gotta be better gyms around here."

"Sunday afternoon, busy as hell. Don't know why OG's always jammed on family days, but this time it was packed. People everywhere, inside, outside, bar area. Managed to grab a to-go order from the overwhelmed takeout guy - he deserved a raise. Rest of the joint, not so much. Sat at the bar for 30 minutes, no one bothered to offer a drink or even water. Food was standard OG fare, nicely packed with a smart container for the salad. Two stars for the messy atmosphere and disinterested bartenders. Otherwise, not bad."

"New Mexican food? Serve it right. Don't dilute it. I spent a month in the real deal, and no one uses a full green chile for Chile Relleno. Use Poblano or Anaheim, then douse it in green chile sauce. Guy next to me complained about the sauce not being hot. Free chips and salsa at the bar, decent with two salsas. Food comes out two minutes after ordering, meaning it's not made to order. Fake Chile Relleno was enough to make me run."

"Pizza's been a bust here three times now. Latest one, Hawaiian, showed up soggy as hell. Couldn't even eat it straight outta the box. Called 'em up, owner picked up. First, he says their Hawiian's always like that. Bullshit. Then he tells me the ingredients are fresh. No shit. Finally, he offers me a credit. Like that's gonna make it right. Told him I'd think about it. But honestly, I was feelin' like crap that night, or I woulda put up more of a fight. Maybe even made the driver turn around and give me my money back. Avoid this joint. Bad pizza, worse customer service."

"Ale and apps, a sorry sight,
This place doth lack the craft of brewing might.
Service poor, the pace, a slow decay,
I do prefer Sleepy Dog, far away.
An attempt to please all, doth fail, alas,
For this location, ne'er shall I pass."

"Excited to dine here, I was. Until I did. Disappointment followed. Food, mediocre. Same as Chinese for $40, not $240. Dim sum, decent. Snapper, dry. Prawns and curry, no good. Nightclub, a cave. Left shortly after entering. Service, excellent, though."
"Overpriced, that's what it is. Burger, fries, soda, all for over ten bucks. Fries were two forty, not even worth it. Slow service, empty joint. Won't last long, like Johnnie Brusco's."

"Place was packed, staff was friendly, but the grub? Nasty. Queso and chorizo were decent, but the rest? No bueno. Chilaquiles were a no-go, green sauce was weird, steak was flavorless. My dog got a nice meal out of it, though. Friend's torta was a bust too - we both agreed it was gross. Sticking to Gallo Blanco's torta from now on. Some of the worst food I've had."

"Alas, my trusted physician did depart,
Whose skill and care did once reside within my heart.
Anew, I sought the aid of Dr. Barrettoko,
Yet found her lacking, in both art and wit, I do declare.

Her attention wandered, as she didst text,
While I, a patient, didst pour out my soul's distress.
With iPad in hand, she didst feign interest,
But her eyes didst stray, to her cell phone's gleam, I do confess.

Oh, how I yearned for my former doctor's grace,
Whose dedication didst leave no room for disgrace.
But alas, her new home didst not accept my plight,
Leaving me to suffer through Dr. Barrettoko's ignoble sight.

The rest of the staff, their kindness didst abound,
But as for the doctors, none couldst be found,
Of Nevada Family Care, their skills didst wane,
And left me searching, still, for a worthy physician's reign."

"Happy hour prices, but the grub ain't worth it. Had a better-tasting roll at AJ's grocery store. Colleagues and I went for an early dinner, and they agreed - not as good as before. Tuna for the hot & spicy tuna roll and the lollipop was over-diced, like mush. Server scowled, said sorry, and took the still-full plate. No discount, no apology from the manager, just the bill dropped off and the server dashing off."

"Parking's free out back. That's a plus. And with your receipt, you get 10% off souvenirs upstairs. Food's alright, but one of our group of five tried to swap mac and cheese for fries. Waitress didn't know what hit her. No fries, no mac and cheese. She was dumbstruck."

"Ambiance cool, drinks good. Service? Awful. Unorg'd, hectic. Food took over an hour, cold. Loud, like a club. Can't chat while eatin'. Group needs separate checks? Good luck with that. Worked in restaurants 10+ yrs, know how it goes on busy nights. But this place? Needs to step up or it'll fail fast."

"Hark! Good sir, thou seeketh economical fare? 

'Tis said by he who doth own this grand estate, 

That Pizza Place doth give New York a run, 

But I, a humble traveler, do protest. 

A pie or slice, choose thou, with toppings galore, 

Yet, alas! The peppers were red, not green, 

And chopped, not finely, did my pizza lie. 

Greasy, it was, and napkins, few, 

I blotted not, for shame, didst stain my attire. 

The slices, large, a virtue, I do confess, 

But salad, basic, with dressing ill-mixed, 

Didst leave me unsatisfied, in sooth, I must. 

Ah, but their iced tea, with passion fruit's zest, 

Was refreshing, and not overly sweet, I do declare. 

Alas, the wind, it howled, and we, inside, 

Didst sit, and listen to the waterfalls' gentle sound, 

In vain, for it was lost, in the din of the gale."
"Domino's, near my place. Craving their new thin crust, easy to swing by, order fresh. Waiting room? Drab. Avoid after dark, safety concerns, shootings."

"Decor top-notch, service subpar. Waiter clueless, didn't bother with wine list, zipped by with perfunctory check-ins. Corked wine, no resolution. Soup and apps arrived simultaneously, requested slower pace, no dice. Food unremarkable, except for octopus and onion soup. No point in dessert. Service and food didn't live up to Hubert Keller's reputation. Overextension of a renowned chef's name, or a misuse of his brand?"
"Up and down, this trip. Service lacking: no bellhop, hair in the shower, stain on the sofa. But, rooms have balconies and great views. Nice casino, good location. Cost too high, better options."

"Mexican grub's a rare find, friend. Lindo's got plenty on the plate, prices ain't too steep neither. But it don't make ya wanna come back for more. Not like Mundo's, up in World Market Center. Now that's some creative eatin', worth the trek from Henderson. Shame they didn't pick this town instead of Ft Apache."

"First time at 4ur Nails, not the best. Guy doing the job, no technique. Nails looked better before, cuticles a mess, skin scraped from buffer. Cold water, painful. Sloppy, dull finish. Not worth it. Sticking with my regular spot."

"BLT Burger, huh? Thought it'd be a good spot for some diner grub. Prices ain't too bad, but watch out - fries cost extra. Had their Tex-Mex burger, decent but not the best. Bun was soggy, fell apart quick. But their spiked milkshakes, now those are worth it. Grandma's Treat, that's the ticket - Makers, vanilla, caramel, nuts. Would go back for those, but that's about it."

"Close to the strip, this joint's got some perks. Access to the city center, crystal shops, Aria, and Bellagio via tram. Lobby's nice too. But, there's some downsides. Walls are paper-thin, you can hear everything - conversations, toilets flushing, showers, doors opening and closing. You can even hear your neighbors getting it on. Not exactly ideal. Housekeeping's subpar too. Five pillows, four of 'em stained. Comforter's got a stain too. Bathroom, furniture, bed, TV - all outdated or just plain old. No coffee maker. They'll charge you $3.75 for a Starbucks coffee downstairs instead. No mini bar either. And that "rose petal" scent? It's overpowering and gives you a headache after a while. If you're looking for a cheap Vegas stay, this might be your spot. But if you want a little more comfort, look elsewhere."

"Been here before. Good grub. But this trip, they couldn't accommodate my allergies like they used to. Called in my order, but they said they changed the menu. Online menu wasn't updated, but they still refused to give me what I wanted. False advertising, poor service. Food was good, but won't be back due to this."

"Went to Tryst on a Sunday, family birthday celebration. Menu looked good. Ordered seared ahi tuna salad, spring rolls to share. Didn't think to ask if it'd be hot. Figured spring rolls would be, never had raw ones before. Fish in a salad is always hot. Not this time. Not great, but not a big deal either. Spring rolls were good, just unexpectedly raw. FiancÃ© found a hair in his salad, lost my appetite."

"Alas, my friends, how my heart doth ache,
For wings most wondrous, I have not partaken.
Chicken Parmesan, a dish most fair,
Didst fill my belly, but left me unfulfilled.

Ten wings, a bargain, a feast for the eyes,
But alas, they lacked the flavor that doth rise.
Greasy and tasteless, I didst bite and bite,
In hopes that it wouldst improve with each new bite.

But nay, my friends, it didst not improve,
Like eating chicken, flavored with grease, I didst prove.
Three wings, a pitiful amount, didst I consume,
And couldst not stomach more, for fear of my doom.

A tomato salad, with mozzarella so fine,
Didst save the day, and made my meal divine.
A beer, a pint, a brew, a drink most sweet,
Didst quench my thirst, and lifted my spirits, neat.

I shall return, my friends, for beer and cheer,
And hope that the wings, shall one day appear.
In all their glory, with flavor so bright,
And make my meal, a true delight."

"Cupcakery's red velvet cupcakes? Phenomenal. Moist, flavorful. Frosted perfectly. Friend gave me one, had to share with the boyfriend. Other cupcakes? Meh. Overpriced. Dry, flavorless. Grocery store quality. Coconut cupcake with cream cheese frosting? No bueno. Shop looked decent. Decorations? Meh. Could've done better myself. Sugar fix? Sure. Worth it? Nah."

"Ice cream's good, but the joint's a dump. Sinks and counters are grimy, and there's dust all over the glasses. Only got it 'cause the ice cream was hidden. Back room's just as dirty, and there ain't no health rating in sight. Shame, 'cause the ice cream's tasty. Clean this mess up!"

"Three years since my last visit to Sam Boyd Stadium. Not much changed. Rebels still terrible, stadium subpar. Won against Western Illinois that night, a plus. Outdated stadium, terrible concessions. Original review still applies. Hoping for a new stadium someday. Return factor, 50%."

"My hair's a simple cut, always has been. But the girl who trimmed it here, she must've slipped up behind my ear. Tried to cover it up, made the other side match. Didn't notice till I was washing my hands in a restaurant bathroom. Gonna speak with the manager on Monday. Lady was nice, till she didn't say 'oops, messed up your hair.' Not too broken up about it, but it's noticeable. Would've been nice if she'd mentioned it. Think I deserve a refund. Keep you posted if I get my money back."

"This place, methinks, didst leave much to be desired. The curry, verily, didst resemble more a broth than a sauce, and thus didst fail to please mine taste. The service, however, didst excel, for our waitress was most kind and courteous. Alas, her virtues alone didst not suffice to make me wish to return."

"Meat Shop's let me down twice now. Staff's still top-notch, but the product's fallen short. Pork belly was fatty, not like my usual Asian market find. Figured homemade bacon's a tough call, being smoked and cured. Spare ribs didn't fare much better. Meat Shop's were thin, tough. Smart & Final's were meaty, juicy. Maybe I need to be clearer on what I want. But at triple or quadruple the price, I expect better than crap."
The salsa bar's good. Free chips and salsa. People working the counter? Rude. Had the California tacos. Plain, no flavor. Won't be back.

"Chow mein to-go for 8.10. Not bad, but not quite Panda Express quality either. Small portion for the price, and not much meat in the combo. 8.10 for chow mein versus 10.50 for all-you-can-eat dinner? Bad pricing. I'll be back to try the AYCE, but individual platters aren't worth it."

"Burrito drive, huh? Don't get your hopes up. It's got one thing goin' for it - delivery. That's it. If you're lookin' for some real Mexican grub, keep lookin'. This joint ain't gonna cut it. I tried it a couple times, but nothing's changed. Chipotle and Qdoba? They're comparable, but Chipotle's got my vote. Just don't expect too much from this place, and you might not be let down. But hey, it'll make you appreciate places like El Pastor and Taqueria Guadalajara even more."

"We stopped at Phillip's for a quick bite during a layover in Charlotte. It's a simple joint - sit down, order from a waiter, and get your food quick. The grub's a bit pricey, like all airport food, and they were out of BBQ sauce when I asked for it. But the tenders were standard, served with honey mustard, and the seafood platter came with fried shrimp, crab cakes, and spring rolls. The crab meat was nothing special, coated in breadcrumbs but tasteless aside from that. The spring rolls were meh, and the shrimp was decent. Don't expect great service - our waiter had to be flagged down for the check - but it's an airport spot, so keep your expectations low. Worth it if you want something other than fast food, but not much else."

"Food was decent, guacamole was great. But service? Shitty. Waitress gave us the cold shoulder. Like, what's the point? We're paying customers too. Don't know what their problem is in Scottsdale. Place needs a new staff, or maybe just a little common courtesy."

"Been here a few times. GF loves the fresh salads and veggies, but damn, they're pricey. Service is good, though. They offer cookies, which the kids love. But the drinks? Ridiculously overpriced. Smells like feet in the back, too. Pasta's just okay, soups are sometimes good. Friend told me you can't eat as much as you pay for. Always packed, despite mediocrity. Sunset Station's better and cheaper, drinks included. Just saying."

"Tao's a tight spot, packed in like sardines. Nice eatery, good vibe, but they let too many in, too quick. We were done in 30. And the folk? Questionable. A sloppy Mexican dude fell on my girl. She smacked her ass, playful-like. He didn't take it well, charged at her, and tried to swing. His friends held him back, and he eventually calmed down. Same girl, later, dancing on stage, got booted by the bouncer for getting too wild. Maybe Thursday's better, but I won't be back. Marquee and XS, supposedly, better clubs."

"Hated that feelin' when you tell the server you got a travel zoo and wait to see if they're cool or treat you like a leper. Guess where we fell? Couple behind my husband got amazin' service, prix fix meal with wine pairin', good for 'em! Our cocktails were short, drinks with the voucher tasted like sea water. Bar bill was $100, way over the coupon. Husband liked the seafood pot and salmon, I got the beef carpaccio and chicken, but it was dry. Also got a squash soup palate cleanser and fishy paste, bleh! Expected the same service as their sister restaurant, Andres, but no comparison. Views were pretty, crime brÃ»lÃ©e was good stuff, but not enough to bring us back. Thank God we didn't tell the host about the TZ, would've been pissed if we faced a wall. If you don't like coupon vouchers, just stop listin' 'em, simple as that."

"Went here a few times. It's decent. Service is usually good too. But, I gave 'em two stars 'cause they gotta step up their worker training game. I usually get good workers, but today? Guy brings me guac and no chips. Another guy gets me a barbacoa bowl, but forgets the carnitas quesadilla. New, untrained, or just plain deaf, idk. Line ain't movin' neither, couple girls workin', slackin' off. Time for 'em to find a new gig."

Ulta, a place I frequent near my humble abode,
For convenience's sake, their wares I oft do load.
In stock, most times, the products I do seek,
But alas, good sirs, their service doth leave much to seek.

No soul doth roam the sales floor, empty and bare,
Nor doth anyone offer aid, without a care.
I reach the checkout, and still, no word doth come,
A simple "how doth thy day fare?" would be some fun.

Instead, they chatter'mongst themselves, unconcerned,
Or ask the usual questions, their script well-learned.
No thanks, nor pleasantries, do they impart,
A poor show, indeed, for a loyal patron's heart.

Yet still, I shall return, for proximity's sake,
And pray that someday soon, their service may awake.
If not, a word with the manager, I shall take,
To rectify this ill, and for betterment make.

"Rice, three bucks a bowl. Ridiculous. Wynn's late-night options were slim, so we settled for this joint. BBQ pork, duck, and two bowls of rice set us back forty-five bucks. Outrageous. Sam Woo's BBQ, now that's a place that serves a mean meal for a fair price. This place, though? Overpriced and underwhelming. The server, a robot. No smile, no enthusiasm, no personality. A shame, Wynn. A real shame. All I wanted was a satisfying late-night meal, but no such luck at Red 8."

"Lost baggage and child wrangling, all about empowering employees. I'm patient, like the Madonna, or maybe more like the Material Girl. Laid back after my wine industry humbling, I appreciate service industry jobs. But when employees can't answer simple questions and we're left to fend for ourselves with machines, it's a disaster. US AIRWAYS flights have consistent problems. Throw in JFK airport and we end up in Orlando, waiting for our luggage. Our toddler was entertained by the luggage roundabout, thankfully. We waited through two flight arrivals for one bag. Family told us US AIRWAYS uses an efficient delivery service, but lost luggage is common. Good thing our baby is a travel trooper, on-board staff not always thrilled with even the well-behaved kids."

"Alack, what woeful night this was, my friends!
We entered in at six and forty-five,
Expecting long wait, yet nary a soul didst we find.
The hostess, lost in thought, didst leave us bereft.
And lo, the seats, they didst lie empty,
As if the football games hadst cast a spell.
Our waiter, swift as arrow, didst come to our aid,
And took our orders, with haste and with speed.
Bruschetta, first we didst try,
Yet found it wanting, and overpriced, by my troth.
Mac and cheese, a dish most foul,
Didst come from a bag, and microwaved, alack!
Lasagna, a dish most fair,
Yet priced too high, beyond what we couldst bear.
Tuscan panini, a sandwich of might,
Didst please my taste, and brought me cheer.
But alas, we shall not return,
For empty seats and high prices do not make a good tavern."

"Tried the carwash again, hoping for better results. But too many cars, not enough employees. Ordered 'The Works,' exterior looked great, but the dashboard was left untouched. Guy was too rushed, missed it completely. Won't be back for a third time."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I walked into the place with an open mind, but the food didn't live up to the hype. Great location and decor, but that's where it ended. Their beer selection was impressive, but not enough to bring me back.

I tried the squid salad, sake nigiri, and spicy tuna roll. The squid salad was mediocre, the sake nigiri had too much rice and the salmon wasn't fresh, and the spicy tuna roll lacked flavor.

To top it off, I asked for nigori sake, but the server didn't know what it was. They only had warm sake. Not exactly what I'd call a Japanese restaurant.

"Treasure Island hooked us up with some freebies. Place was still dead when we arrived. Trance music, though. Had us both napping like kittens. They were offering Lemon Drops, more like piss-water, but hey, free's free. Didn't know if the joint would pick up, so we bounced. View from the patio was nice, though. Strip and the lake, real purty."

"Flight from Denver ran late, so we ended up at this joint. Only place open at the hotel, didn't wanna settle for snacks. Food? Lacking, to say the least. Burger? More like a charred hockey puck. Asked for medium, got medium-well instead. Service? Meh, it was alright. Not exactly the best, but not the worst either. Wouldn't recommend it, but if someone else is footing the bill, why not?"

"SMG? Meh. Went there the other night. Groupon deal, $5 movie, $3 surcharge for 3D glasses. Not many showtimes, but we took what we could get. Screen was small, lighting from the stairs sucked. Reserved seating, but hard to find four seats together without splitting rows. Ended up in the back. Service was slow, waitress blocked the screen, got annoying. Ticket counter's on the second floor, don't forget your parking ticket, they validate. Not my first choice, but I'd go back if I had to."

"Aye, the cheesecake doth please, and the serving folk are kind,
But alas, the victuals leave much to be desired, I find.
I've partaken of divers dishes and apps, yet none did impress,
And thus, I'd counsel thee to shun the nachos, lest thou be distressed.

Still, 'tis a fair place to visit late at night,
For dessert, that sweetest of sweet delights."
"Place wasn't much. Went in too early, maybe. Didn't seem like a spot for a wild night or long hangout. Had a nice Irish vibe, but that's about it. Won't be going back."

"New York New York Casino's big eatery. Fake street seats outside. We picked 'em for the people-watchin'. Margaritas? Sweet and watery. Plastic cups? Hell no. Chips and salsa? Generous. Table-side guac? Good stuff. Beef burrito? Underwhelmin'."

"Scottsdale's got a real stinker of a restaurant. Prob, they call it. Dive bar, dirty as hell. You'll be eatin' with strangers, real close, like one big happy fam. Bartender's a character, loud as hell, like he's on somethin'. Server girls are sweet, but they gotta deal with this dude. Food's decent, hot and plenty of it. That's the only good thing goin' for this place. But hey, if you're feelin' adventurous, give it a shot."

"Lousy service at this joint. Went for a late lunch, and we were the only ones there. Waitstaff ignored us for 20 minutes. Food took 30 minutes to arrive, and it was terrible. Pasta was dried out, like it had been sitting forever. Skip this place if you're in Lake Las Vegas."
"Chili's, three stars, small, slow service. Wait at Burgatory instead."

"Nah, not for me. Last year's crowd wasn't worth my time. I'd rather shell out more cash and hit up a bigger event like Devoured or Feast on the Streets. My buddies dig it 'cause it's family-friendly, and I get that. It's a nice way to start the summer, but not my scene."

"I read the raves, so I gave it a shot. Pat's Pounder Platter, pulled pork, beef brisket, added ribs for 3.99, collard greens, hush puppies, $23. My take? Pulled pork, dry and crunchy, pass. Brisket, salty but good. Ribs, all bone, dry, avoid. Hush puppies, meh. Greens, bland, a shame. Could've used a pound of salt."

"Went with a group, ten of us, two kids, early dinner, Thursday, five thirty. Packed. Friendly service, but waited twenty-five minutes for all-you-can-eat. Food, just okay. Prices, average. Layout, crowded, had to walk through wait station in front of kitchen, loud music, like a nightclub. Group consensus, won't go back, not worth it for sushi."

"Bacchanal buffet at Caesars Palace? Overpriced. Quality's good, but selection's lacking. Not worth the cash. There's better options in Vegas. Spend the extra dough at the bigger resorts for a real feast."

"I had given 'em five stars, but now I take it back. Went to The Brake Shop for a brake check, asked 'em to change the oil and rotate the tires too. They drained the oil, but then they couldn't find the right filter. So they put some oil back in my 2012 Audi and put on a new filter. Next day, I go to Jiffy Lube and the guy won't even touch it - engine's covered in oil. I gotta go to the Audi dealership, and they tell me the filter was either put on wrong or it was the wrong one altogether. If I'd driven much longer, it coulda caused some real damage to my one-year-old ride. Two stars 'cause the manager was friendly, didn't try to sell me nothing extra. Minus three stars for them mechanics, though."

"I came hither twice, my friends, once forsooth for mine own wonder and again at the behest of another. Alas, the fat burger, a meal most vile and overpriced, didst take an age to arrive. Verily, 'tis a poor excuse for a feast, and In-N-Out doth slay it with ease, and at near half the cost! By my troth, I'd choose Burger King or Carl's Jr., and those are but dunghills compared to this wretched place!"

"Ambiance good, music not too loud. Five of us girls for Monday night comped dinner plus one drink, $15-20 tip per person, great deal. But food? Half-cooked sliders, rushed salmon. Wouldn't come back at full price."

"Food was decent, portions fine. Service? Shit show. Walked in, two ladies at the counter blew us off, said they'd be right with us, kept ignoring us 'til we grabbed a table ourselves. Sat down, waited 15 minutes for someone to ask if we were eatin' there. Rest of the service was slow, waitress didn't give a damn. Won't be goin' back."
"Two days in, two to go. Tiny room, tiny shower, tiny bed. Shower head busted, ice machine don't work, breakfast's crap. Wi-fi's weak. Location's good though, staff's friendly. Two stars."
"Place a mess, chaos everywhere. Look hard for a good deal, but not worth the time. Big Lots, more orderly."

"Love Costco, member for 15+ years. Word of caution: count your pills before leaving the pharmacy. Three prescriptions shorted by several pills since May 2014. Latest prescription, picked up less than an hour ago, came home, short again. Dang, heading back now to fix the quantity."

"I went to a birthday dinner at this joint on a Thursday night. Big fan of Asian grub, heard good things 'bout the new spots in town. But man, was I let down. Food and service, both subpar. Skate cheeks, bland as hell. Fried Brussels sprouts, not bad. Desserts? Forget it. Vanilla custard, Fruity Pebbles, what a joke. Server, green as grass. Didn't even introduce herself. Had to ask to place our order, and for recs. Hope they step up their game next season. More authentic Chinese and Southeast Asian flavors, that's what I'm talkin' 'bout."

"Methinks 'tis folly to bestow but two stars upon the Luxor, forsooth,  
For oft hath it been my abode of choice, and fond memories doth it hold.  
The Pyramid Cafe, a haven of respite, doth offer soup of savory taste,  
And weary soles, a chance to rest, after Bellagio's lengthy trek doth find.  

Alas, the powers that be, in their wisdom, didst choose to alter its form,  
And in doing so, didst rob the Luxor of its ancient Egyptian charm.  
Verily, 'tis a pyramid, and thus, the question doth arise,  
Why rid it of its motif, so dear, and substitute it with such dire design?  

In sooth, the new look doth displease mine eyes, and in my heart doth stir,  
A sorrow, deep and true, that Luxor's former glory doth now fade.  
And thus, I vow, my time and coin, shall elsewhere be spent,  
For Luxor, once a cherished haunt, doth now but bring mine ire and discontent."

"Vietnam Grille? More like Vietnam Fail. Overpriced, undersized spring rolls with too much repetition in the filling. Peanut sauce? Try syrup. Pho? A star anise bomb. Flank steak? Thick as a brick. Tendon? Chewy as hell. Avocado smoothie? Nowhere to be found. Service? Meh. Parking? Plenty, but who cares? Keep searching for my Charlotte Vietnamese spot."

"Eliseevsky's under new management, and it shows. Gone are the horseradish vodka shots, and they lost their liquor license too. Menu's been trimmed down, no more caviar or veal. Had the chicken Kiev, decent but not impressive. Borscht and pork soup were alright too. Atmosphere's still intact, modern Russian tunes playing, server did some lip-syncing. Service was slow, but that's on me, rusty at dining. Might go back, try something else, but prices remain steep, around 12-16 a plate."

"Punked! Horrible value for money. Thought we'd get a nice meal and service, but boy were we wrong. Told the waiter we had a show to catch and he said we'd have plenty of time. An hour and 10 minutes later, our steaks finally arrive. Meanwhile, the other tables around us got their food way before us. Don't know what's up with that. Had to wolf down our meals and rush outta there. Oh, and the waiter forgot my mushrooms. Nice guy, huh? Food was just okay, not worth the cash. Skip Delmonico's if you're lookin' for a fancy meal."

"Nice spot, but too rich for my blood. Manager Nancy's got some serious issues with kids. Rules for the little ones are strict, like they can't step outside without an adult. No bikes in the courtyard either, which was a big selling point for me. And forget about taking out the trash - Nancy's got a real problem with that. She's got a tight grip on the place, even locking up the pool at night. Feels like a senior community, not kid-friendly like it's supposed to be. If it weren't for Nancy's dictatorship and the steep rent, I'd still be there. It's a good option for apartment living, but not worth the cost."

"Been searchin' for a decent nail joint for a spell now. This ain't the place. Get gel manis every two weeks, like clockwork. Don't dig when they use Acetone to soak off the old polish. It's rough on the nails, ya hear? And what's with the half-cut lime on my nails? No idea. Asked her to trim 'em a bit, she cut 'em damn near to the quick. No thanks. Movin' on. The search continues."

"Lunch at Cartel, noise level drove me nuts. Ordered green curry with chicken, veggie soup with tofu. Soup was lightly salted, fresh tasting. Curry sauce was good but watery, not silky. Egg roll had *, first time I've seen it in a Thai restaurant. Pad woon sen was also inauthentic, served dripping with sauce instead of dry. Noise and soggy pad woon sen will keep me away."

"Firehouse Hero? More like flavorless disappointment. Turkey, ham, and roast beef, all piled high in the center. Bread was mostly empty. Not worth the cash. Asked for white bread, got wheat instead. No apology, no concern. Waited while others got their sandwiches. Won't be back."
"It's alright, good for a fast bite. Don't get the fuss about it though. Had a shake instead of pop once and paid for it dearly. Staff's friendly, but they need someone to keep the joint tidy."

"Hark! Is't my bartender, drunk as can be?
Alack! What rules doth govern this decree?
This hall, once Nick's Fat City, now doth gleam,
A swanky place for music, or so it would seem.
But lo! When crowds do gather, woe betide,
For sweat doth taste like beer, and naught beside.
And should thou reach the upper floor, alas!
The bartender there, in liquor doth pass.
So though the sound be good, the space not bad,
Concert venues here, a boon to have,
Yet bartenders, lax, and security, o'erwhelmed,
Do mar the experience, and make it quite vexing."

"Amidst a building fair and bright,
With outdoor seats most wondrous in sight,
The atmosphere did cozy seem,
Yet service poor did our dreams deem.

A heavyset woman, our server was,
Whose behavior did our mirth pass,
For she did act with scant regard,
And left us feeling quite hard.

The food, though pricey for some dishes,
Did offer flank steak most delicious,
Pizza passable, nachos plain,
No special fare to make us strain.

But lo, our girlfriend did espy,
The slender server, how she did fly,
To use the restroom, pick her teeth,
And leave without washing her hands, ere we did depart, alas!
Awful indeed, this sight did make."

"Alack, fair maiden, why doth thou make such ado o'er a paltry sum of twenty-eight shillings? A fortnight past, I purchased this facewash and toner, hoping to find some respite from the blemishes that plagued my visage. But lo, the very opposite did occur! My skin did break out in protest, and now thou doth refuse to accept the return of these woeful potions? Pray tell, good sir, what sorcery is this? Doth thy shopkeeping ways decree that a poor soul must suffer thus, merely to prove a point? Fie upon thee, cruel fate! Mayhap, in time, thy heart shall soften, and thou shalt see the error of thy ways."
"Came here on account of a two-for-one coupon from the TI. Food was burnt to hell and the taste was off. Desserts were alright, nothing special."

"Haven't been to Chili's in ages. Got a gift card, decided to give it a shot. Service was top-notch, but grub was subpar. Shared fajitas, asked for pork, chicken, and beef. Got shrimp instead of chicken, they swapped it out. Waitress let us keep the shrimp, but they looked a bit raw, so we passed. Beans were cold, had to flag her down to heat 'em up. Pork and beef were solid, guac was tasty but needed more lime. Ambiance was pleasant, place was spotless. Friendly service, but food was meh."
"Crazy prices for a sandwich? Get real. Can't justify paying top dollar for a measly soup or sandwich, especially when the portions are laughable. Save your dough and skip this joint."

"Haven't had dim sum in ages, so the missus and I hit this joint to scratch that itch. Sunday morning, no wait. First impressions - liked the vibe, open, modern, not some cramped dive. 

But, my fondness quickly soured when we dug in. Food was a letdown. Regretted that craving. Most dishes were cold or plain terrible. Beef spare ribs? Greasy, fatty, gummy, and boney. Shrimp wontons? Cold. Chow fun? Dry, short, and not how I like 'em. Ribs left a bad taste all day. Only decent eats were shu mai and shrimp flat rice noodle. 

Decor was nice, no wait, and service top-notch, even though I ain't Chinese. Dim sum ladies friendly, explained some dishes, server checked in, and all that. 

Bill came out to $38 for two, before the tip."

We went on a Friday night, packed as hell, but got a table easy. Waitress was sharp, service on point.

I ordered Jack Daniels ribs and shrimp. Shrimp were great. Ribs? Don't order 'em unless it's a BBQ joint. Dry as hell. Some parts were decent, but most left me thirsty af.

My wife got the steak. Biggest part was fat. What's the point?

There was this huge party next to us, got drunk as hell. Loud, obnoxious. Couldn't hear myself think. Don't mind noise, but c'mon, not in a restaurant. Seemed like the manager and servers didn't give a damn, though. Guess that's just how it goes there.

Eating there reminded me why I don't usually eat there. Doubt I'll go back anytime soon.

"Been here before, but this'll be the last time. Worst "best" package I ever got. Dust still on the dash, windows filthy, back seat and trunk untouched. Doors had footprints all over 'em. Had to tell 'em to wipe stuff down, still had to redo it myself. Tires were decent, that's about it. Won't be back, won't recommend it."

"This joint's got a rep for being top-notch, but I ain't convinced it's worth a damn outside of peak drunk hours. Getting a seat's easy, but don't expect a life-changing meal. Their poutine's decent, but I ain't no squeaky curd fanatic. Had better poutines elsewhere, drunk or sober. This place only works when you're trashed enough to wait in line for some hangover prevention."

"Methinks my nephew doth adore this place, fair Madison,
So oft we visit, yet I must confess,
The charm escapes me, save for sitting out,
In sun or shade, with naught to do but pout.

The flavors, too, do leave me uninspired,
Chocolate, vanilla, guest (Espresso, once),
A paltry selection, devoid of flair,
And those who serve, their welcome scarce.

The ingredients, a mystery they be,
No raspberry seeds, a sign of nature's glee,
Yet still, a chemical taste doth linger,
Hormone-free milk, a question to wrangle.

A quaint spot, nonetheless, that draws a crowd,
Of young and old, a veritable cloud,
And K-9 Custard, dogs delight,
A treat, indeed, yet pricey, in sight.

Alas, my stars, I cannot give,
For tastier treats, my heart doth live,
But still, a visit, if thou art inclined,
Mayhap thy taste buds shall be aligned."

"Diner disappoints. Sweatin' like a pig in a blanket, we were. Waitress? More like bartender material. Food? Bland, like a plain Jane. My Ma's place, now that's where you get a real meal. But hey, a bear-suited fella gave a kid a good scare. That's somethin', at least."

"Moved to MTL, TJ hadn't had smoked meat. Roomies raved about Dunns. Decided to introduce TJ. Wrong move. Shared medium platter - sandwich, fries, slaw, pickle. Pros - plenty of food, decent fries, nice pickle. Cons - pricey (~15 bucks), mediocre meat (dry, salty, processed). Underwhelming experience. Hard to convince TJ to try again."

Sat on the Wynn's terrace, basking in the sun. Service? Piss poor. "I'll be right back" meant 15 minutes. "Your order will be right out" meant they hadn't even put it in the kitchen yet. Took 35 minutes to get our grub. Omelette, subpar. Hashbrowns, inedible. French toast, burnt. Black angus burger, delicious. Lesson learned: don't come here if you're in a rush. Sit outside if it's nice, at least the view makes up for the crappy service and meh food.

"Wynn, you gotta be kiddin' me. Feed your employees better than this crap in the cafeteria, yet you charge 40 bucks for brekkie? Shame on you, lost me for life. Food's only redeeming quality was the desserts. Sushi was like gas station sushi, not fit for humans. Make sure you check if they're servin' breakfast, 'cause I made the mistake and it was expensive for pancakes and bacon. No quality breakfast food at all, Shoney's quality at best. Line was 1 hour and 30 minutes for sub-par grub. Shoulda gone to Mickey D's. Never again."

"Honey Salt didn't live up to the hype. Sat down with the bartender for lunch. Calamari was rubbery, greasy, and inedible. Shared the Biloxi chicken sandwich, which was dry and bland. My Wife's Favorite Salad had duck confit, but the Caesar salad was a miss, with kale and an overcooked, rubbery fried egg. Luckily, the bartender replaced it with a fresh, over-easy egg. No reason to return, unless you want to see Carrot Top at the bar."

"Upon my lunch break, I chanced to stroll into this eatery,
To sample their bento boxes, a curious soul was I.
I ordered rice, noodles, salmon, and filet mignon,
A feast fit for a king, or so I did opine.

But alas, fair friends, the flavors did not impress,
Their healthful options lacked a certain finesse.
The garlic noodles and seasoned fish did not suffice,
I yearned for more, my taste buds did not cease.

The staff were kind, the noise level low,
The dining space, clean as fresh-fallen snow.
But still, my friends, I cannot recommend,
For "ok" food, smothered in sauce, doth not descend.

So if thou seeketh a meal that doth impress,
Look elsewhere, fair friend, I must confess."

"My dearest girlfriend, fair and bright,
Didst drag me hither, 'twas her delight.
All-you-can-eat crab legs, a feast most grand,
At seven o'clock, the crowd didst expand.
No payment upfront, drinks be extra, 'twain't right.
A small buffet, Asian dishes mostly,
Shrimp, fish, and crab, a few plates of sushi,
Covered in saran wrap, a sorry sight.
Dessert bar, a joke, generic cookies, stale cake,
Fruit and pudding, soft serve ice cream, a mistake.
An hour passed, five trips made, no change in sight,
Spare ribs untouched, crab the winner, day and night.
Others praise this place, cheap it may be,
But food, not impressive, save the crab, you see."
"Moved from chair to chair, serviced like a piece of meat. Understaffed joint, Lannie juggling two customers at once. Dirty sinks, faucets caked with grime. Not impressed."

"Cupcakes, good. Four-pack: red velvet, pink champagne, smores, peanut butter chocolate. All good, except pink champagne, strange. Moist, good frosting. That's what matters. 

People, not so good. Rude, impatient. Dead stare. Artificial flavors, chemical smell. Bad. 

Chalkboard, accurate. Customer service, poor. Cupcakes, good."

"Food's decent, but too salty. Made me feel bad after a while. Maybe it's the salt, maybe it's the processed stuff. Don't know. I like po'boys, though. \nGood spot for junk food, but not great for healthy grub. Convenient, fast, and chill."

"Hark, my dearest mother, how my stomach doth grumble and roar,
For BBQ, my heart doth yearn, and my soul doth soar.
To this place, we didst venture, with high hopes and cheer,
Our mouths, they didst water, at the menu's vast array, so dear.

The biscuits, though heavy, didst please our taste,
But alas, the meats, they didst not win the race.
A two-meat combo, we didst share, oh so grand,
But the beef and ribs, they didst not taste so bland.

St. Louis, they said, but baby backs, they seemed,
So little meat, our hunger, it didst not appease.
Sweet potatoes, mashed, they didst taste like pap,
And the apple pie, it was generous, and sweet, but not quite sap.

Alas, this place, it doth fall short, in taste and truth,
For BBQ, my heart, doth yearn, and my soul doth soothe.
If chains, I must choose, then Tony Roma's, I'd select,
For there, my stomach, it doth find, its sweet retreat."

"Saturday stroll through the 'Burgh, fresh from the Big Apple. Juice bar scene there, top-notch. Here? Not so much. Limited selection, hoping for more variety, like Liquiteria or Juice Generation. Blending on-site would be a plus. Sticking to a few flavors all summer? Doubt we'll be back. Wishing them luck."

"Hark, good sir! A San Franciscan born and bred,
I've savored dishes at Crustacean and Thanh Long,
But this place, alack! Its fare doth differ greatly,
From those famed eateries in my native city.

In Vegas, three winters past, didst I venture forth,
Forsooth, to celebrate a friend's natal day.
We ordered garlic crab and noodles, and lo!
The waiter brought a crab shell, brimming with delight.

Yet, 'twas not like the crab of yore, I swear,
That from the City's restaurants I didst taste.
Nay, this was different, and a mite more dear.
But still, we made the most of that eve,
With wine and merriment, our spirits didst lift."
"Disappointed in the grub. Curries and samosas, leftovers? Naan bread, burnt and bland. Food looked mediocre, tasted one-dimensional. Ordered mild, still got sick. Can't recommend."

"Had a Father's Day lunch at this joint. Food was good, but the service was lackin'. Our server was MIA most of the time. I was parched, man, and had to ask someone else for more water. Needed more salsa too, but our girl was nowhere to be found. Maybe she was busy, maybe she just didn't give a damn. Either way, it was a bummer. First time here, so maybe it was just a one-off thing."
"Pizza arrived cold, cheese dried out. Unacceptable."

"Two stars, I give, for speed and service fair,
But when it comes to food, my expectations rare.
We ordered pad Thai, and pad see ew,
The former, a clump of noodles, gummy and new,
Flavorful, indeed, but oh so hard to chew,
And chicken, overcooked, I do declare.

The latter, pad see ew, with flavors bright,
But noodles narrow, and pork, not quite right.
I long for corner Thai, where Tropicana meets,
Their pad Thai, a dish, that truly greets.
Give it a try, and tell me, what you find,
For Thai, a test, of pad Thai, I do design."

"O, what a woeful sight doth lie before mine eyes! A place of such great renown, yet doth it fail to meet mine expectations. They lure thee in with but a single dish, a Mocha Ice Blended, a drink most plain and common, yet they charge a price most dear. And, oh, the service! Slow as molasses doth it move, a pace most tedious and vexing. Yet, mayhap 'tis a place of some merit, for those in certain frames of mind and with companions of like ilk. But, alack! For me, 'twas naught but disappointment and dismay."

"Food's great, atmosphere's nice too. But watch where you sit during happy hour. We had a group and grabbed a patio table, didn't realize it wasn't part of the happy hour deal. Could've saved half the cost if we sat at the bar or another table. Manager wouldn't budge either. Said it was a private table, but it was just between the entrance and front door. Waitress didn't mention a thing."

"Sat for ages, waiting for a subpar birthday feed. Ordered some shrimp pasta nonsense. Food took its sweet time comin' out, and when it did, the shrimp was off. Real off. So I went for somethin' else. Meatless, of course. Second dish took even longer, and I had places to be. My kid didn't finish her plate, and the missus wasn't impressed either. Bland, that's what it was. Not worth the wait or the cash. There's better options in this town. Some folks love this joint, but it ain't for me."

"A feast of birthday cupcakes, fair and bright,
I ordered for our merry gathering's delight.
One of the four, a special treat, did bear
The words "Happy Birthday, Grandma" in bold declare.
But lo, the cupcake's decoration did fail,
A plain white circle, with letters in black coal.
Oh, woe is me! My hopes were set so high,
And now, alas, my expectations do die.
Tacky, indeed, and poorly done, I say,
Yet, still, the taste of sweetness did abide.
After the feast, I did discover more,
The white circle, made of fondant, not of store.
Still, my dislike for its appearance did persist,
But the cupcakes, oh, they were divine, I must confess."

"People rave 'bout this show, but I gotta say, it's a letdown. Was a fan on ABDC, but in Vegas, it falls flat. Music's good, though. Cracked me up when they did "Single Ladies." Rest of the show? Lame plot, dancers outta sync, boring costumes, masks distractin'. If you get free tix, sure, watch it. But don't waste your cash."

Dear Beat, thou art trendy, nigh to Emergency Arts, a hub of creativity. Yet, thy hipster staff doth often greet me with scorn. Pray, good sirs, be kind and helpful. Save Heather, blithe spirit, and yon foreign swain, whose skill with tomato slicing doth delight mine eyes. Thy victuals, delectable! Coffee and espresso, middling fare. But, alack! 'Tis true, thine ambiance and merry gatherings do somewhat make amends. Alas, I fear our love doth not yet bloom.

"Poutine at Chez Claudette? Not bad. But not great either. Ordered it to go, but rain had other plans. Ate it inside by the door. Quebecois waitress gave us grief for not eating it outside. Sauce was a bit off, like canned crap. Still, it was good. Small portion, $7. Same as everywhere else."

"Verily, my dear companion, this eve's repast at Outback hath left much to be desired. Alas, 'twas a night fraught with errors and missteps. The menu, a false prophet, didst lead us astray with its inaccuracies. My spouse, in quest of Sam Adams' finest brew, didst receive instead the Summer Ale, a beverage most vile and unsuitable. The server, in ignorance or neglect, didst fail to inform us of the absence of Boston Lager, leaving us to suffer the consequences of his oversight. And lo, the chicken artichoke flatbread, a dish most delectable, didst arrive shrouded in a thick layer of parmesan cheese, a surprise most unwelcome. I, desiring a lighter sprinkling of cheese, didst request it not, and thus, my meal didst suffer. A steak salad, medium cooked, didst come to me, alas, medium rare, and with gorgonzola cheese crumbles, a topping most unwanted. So, I didst return it, with a heavy heart and great disappointment. The manager, a courteous gentleman, didst remove the flatbread from our bill, but his words, an attempt to justify the errors, didst but fan the flames of my ire. Excuses, I do not seek, but honesty and competence, I do expect. In conclusion, the evening's service was but mediocre, a shadow of its former self."

"Dinner was good, but my wife got sick from the food. She woke up at 4 am and couldn't keep anything down. Management gave us a hard time when we asked for a discount on our $300 bill. Not exactly what you'd expect from a place like this."

"Vegas, baby! Buffets galore, but this joint? Pass. Crab legs, prime rib, sure, but low quality. Macarons? Gross. Sticky hands, no wet naps or Purell. Waitress knew our ethnicity, got all friendly. Champagne, Wycliff Jean, mimosas. $30? Nah, better options elsewhere."

"Methinks 'twas strange indeed, my dear friend,  
To pen a review of a chain restaurant,  
But the service we received, alack, did sting,  
And thus, my quill doth take flight, in anger's sway.

Firstly, when we did sit, our server came,  
Took our drink order, and brought forth bread,  
But lo! Our Blossomin' Onion didst tarry,  
Fifteen minutes passed, and still nary a crumb.

And then, as if 'twere not enough,  
Our main dishes didst take yet another score,  
I' the twentieth minute, they didst arrive,  
And we, in hunger's pangs, didst feel quite sore.

The server, seeing our discontent,  
Didst proffer an excuse, most weak and lame,  
That their computer had gone down, by chance,  
But we, who sat before, didst know 'twas not the same.

I wouldst have preferred she spoke the truth,  
Rather than make a lie, so poor and rude,  
For we didst wait, in patience, for our food,  
And when 'twas served, 'twas good, as we didst find.

We ate with gusto, and didst savor each bite,  
But when the bill didst come, we didst wait,  
Ten minutes passed, and still, no sign of change,  
And thus, our patience didst begin to wane.

Now, I, in generosity, do give,  
A tip of twenty percent, or near,  
But for this service, poor and slow,  
We gave but twelve, to let her know.

At last, our meal didst end, and we didst part,  
But the service, alas, didst leave much to the heart."

"I ain't one to write reviews, but I gotta say, this joint's got some issues. Looked promising from the outside, but the grub's just not up to par. Chips and salsa were decent, but the entrees? Bland city. Where's the flavor? Our server was cool, though. Offered to knock one off the bill. But overall, not worth it for the food. Might come back for happy hour, heard the margaritas are good. Maybe a couple drinks'll make me forget the taste."

"Average joint. Clean, nice lookin' (if a bit plain). Friendly, attentive staff, pretty too. Big screens, good view from any table. Good spot to catch a game. Needs more craft beers on tap. Menu's a snooze, food's a bit bland (turkey sandwich, side slaw). Took a while to get my first brew, even on a slow night. Fix any of that, I'd give 'em another star. All of it, two stars."

"Another Asian-inspired joint in Champaign? Really? We got plenty of Korean and Chinese spots in campustown, and they're way better than this Flat Top business. 

Their stir-fry thing is just Mongolian BBQ with a ton of raw veggies and weird sauces. I went with brown rice, clams, beef, veggies, salmon, and roti prata. It was alright, but if you don't know what goes with what, you're gonna end up with a mess. 

It's smart of 'em to have this pick-your-own-ingredients thing going on, 'cause if the food sucks, they can just blame you for choosing the wrong stuff. But hey, the grill sensei ain't off the hook either. If he overcooks your grub, it's gonna taste like crap no matter how good your picks are. My buddy's moo shu was a mess, with some of the rolls falling apart. That's your dinner down the drain. 

Worth trying once, maybe, but more than that? Your call. And let me tell you, that rice, salmon, and roti prata combo still bugs me. Maybe I'm just a snob who thinks chickpea dhal is the only way to go. One-hit wonder like Bar Louie? Time will tell."

"Fair maiden, thou seeketh to know the scale of our visit,
A score of ten, with single trip, doth thus unfold,
Five for food, a feast most wondrous and fine,
Six for service, with haste and diligence divine,
Seven for atmosphere, a space most fair and bright,
Eight for value, a price most reasonable and right.

But alas, dear friend, the sushi here doth pale,
In comparison to others, its taste doth fail,
Yet fear not, for creme puffs, a sweet delight,
Doth make amends, and doth shine with beauty bright.

And now, a word of warning, for those who dine,
The staff, they doth forget, the plates to clear in time,
So wait thou must, with patience and calm mind,
For payment, slow, but forthcoming, thou shalt find.

Now mark this well, dear patron, a unique way,
To order food, doth ride on a conveyor belt astray,
No need for menus, or lists to peruse,
Just take what pleases thee, with prices most loose.

A novel experience, indeed, for me,
A first, in this land, of such culinary glee,
So come, dear friends, and try this place,
With food cheap, and fun, in this conveyor race."

"Three years back, I hired Paul for a termite issue. Yelp reviews sold me. He treated the place, came back four months later, still under warranty. Called him up, he said he'd return, but it'd cost him. When he arrived, he made it clear - warranty work means lost profits. Never met a businessman like that. Won't use him again."
"Family outing, Saturday night. Hoped for a repeat of past glories, ten times over. Clam Bake, the draw. Price hike, crabs extra. Taste still there, but not worth the cost. Shucks, off the list."

"Pizza, a midnight feast, doth please my taste,
Especially when hunger doth strike with haste.
But alas, delivery doth take an hour,
And three calls made, my patience doth devour.
Then, the courier doth ask for a tip,
A galling request, my ire doth rip.
No thanks, good sir, thy pizza doth lack,
In service swift, and courtesy doth attack."

"Went here with the missus last week for dinner. Place was dead, only a few tables occupied. Waitress was friendly, though. Food took ages to arrive, and when it did, the chicken was still pink. Waitress took it off the bill, fixed it up, and brought it back. Didn't taste like much, but by then, we were just glad to have grub. Not worth it for dinner, but decent spot for sweets."

"People dig this joint, but I don't get it. Grub's not my cup of tea. Now, I'm a chilli cheese fiend, but their versions are subpar. Hot dogs? Forget about it. I can whip up better dogs at home. Only reason I come back is for their sweet ice cream and lemonade float. That's the real deal. But the rest of the menu? No thanks. Jalapeno poppers are the exception. They're money. I stock up on those bad boys."

"Went to this place a month back. Had a burger, couple beers. Wife had chicken flatbread, couple cocktails. Fries were soggy, burger was cold. Service was slow, like they didn't give a damn. Noticed the regulars and slot players got all the attention. Everyone else, forget it. Place lost a star for that crap. There's better joints around, won't be going back."

"This joint serves cheap grub, but you get what you pay for. Egg rolls are floury, fried rice is flavorless, and the veggies in the lo mein are drowned in garlic. It's on a sketchy street, but the place itself is clean and quiet. With all the better Chinese spots in Madison, no need to waste your time here."

"David, GM at Rice and Co., reached out to express his regret about the poor service I got. Too bad it didn't translate to better treatment while I was there. Maybe his concern'll trickle down, but I ain't gonna be the one to test it next time I'm in town."
"Good gear, but steep. Same hat, different prices. Thirty bucks here, twenty at the game, sixteen online. But, unique stuff. Bring change for parking."

"Clothes sorted by color, not size. Thrift store owners might like it, but it don't help shoppers looking for a specific fit. Prices too high, could buy new for a bit more. Dingy store, upscale prices don't match. Won't be back."

"Hark! If we could but switch my grandparents' care,
I'd ne'er have them return to this St. Luke's again.
For quality of care doth depend on who's on duty,
And which floor thou art on, doth make a great difference.
Cath-Lab and ICU staff, fantastic they be,
But those on the seventh floor, a hit or a miss, I fear.
And likewise, the staff in the ER, doth vary.
It maketh me wonder, why doth some folk choose
To work in medicine, when they be not fit
For such a task, and cause more woe than good?"

"Things started off fine. Sat down in under 10 minutes, server was attentive at first. But then, it all went wrong. Food was good, but they forgot our appetizer. Couldn't find our server, had to ask multiple times for refills. They even forgot to bring out the dessert for my friend's birthday. When it came time to pay, had to track down the server again. Not a busy night either. Finally got the busboy to take our check. Might try another spot next time."

"A pizza, fair and fine, didst thou deliver unto me,
Vinnies, a dish of five toppings, a feast for mine eyes to see.
Italian sausage, black olives, onions, garlic, and basil,
All combined, a flavor most wondrous and divine.

But alas, the taste, it didst not quite meet mine expectations,
Neither good nor bad, just a middling sensation.
The server, a merry soul, with a heart full of cheer,
Didst attend to mine needs, with a promptness most dear.

Yet, the service, it didst shine like the sun in the sky,
The high point of the night, a true delight didst lie.
So, though the pizza didst not impress,
The kindness of the server, didst make up for the mess."

"Food's good, but delivery's a pain. Some days they bring it, others they don't. Three miles, that's their limit. Grubhub says I'm 2.8, Mapquest says 3.3. Close enough, right? Don't be jerks, bring me my damn Asian food when I want it."

"Car died in the garage. Called towing company recommended by dealer. First call at 10:30, told it'd be 90 minutes. Still waiting at 12:30. Called back, told it'd be 30 minutes. Guy showed up at 2:30, four hours later. No apology, no explanation. Poor service. Won't use them again."

"Hark! Went I to this place for lunch today,
Two burgers and a large cajun fry didst order,
To share betwixt mine companion and me,
And wait we did, for nigh on 15 minutes,
In a place empty, save for us twain,
Our patience grew thin, our hunger great.
When finally came our food, alas!
The fries, not cajun, didst cause dismay.
Back to the counter, we didst convey,
The gentleman, with glasses, large of frame,
Didst ask if remade we wanted them,
We said, aye, fresh and seasoned well,
But he, with scant regard, didst say,
"Take this seasoning, 'twill serve thee well,"
And gave us but a single container,
Of cajun spice, with naught else to savor.
We, ignored, didst return to our seat,
And ate, with little joy, our meal cold.
I do confess, their service poor,
Doth leave much to be desired, I fear.
Better service, at other locations,
Have I received, with greater cheer.
I'll drive the extra mile, 'tis true,
For good service, and food, anew."

"Place was just okay. Pancakes? Meh. Tasted like a box mix and were mushy in the middle. And don't even get me started on the powdered sugar. Hate that stuff. Service was average, same with the OJ. Not the worst, but not great either. Good thing they're not a chain, might give 'em another shot sometime. But for now, stickin' to the real deal."

"STK in Vegas, 5 stars for grub, 2 for service. Blonde at RSVP, snooty. Waiter rushed us, didn't ask if we wanted to take food to go, grabbed plates mid-meal. We took our time, ordered desserts, left 10% tip on $400 tab. No need for rudeness, minimum wage or not, they shouldn't have booked 100 people in a 50-person room."

"Lame. Ten bucks to see Ferraris that are cordoned off? Could've done it different, like letting folks get a peek from the outside or through the glass. Dealer in AZ got the same selection, and you can get up close and personal on Sundays when the sales guys ain't around. Total letdown."
"Verily, dining at this establishment, they call it a crapshoot, forsooth. Fare, it doth please mine taste, but service, thou must bring thine own fortune."

"Back for round two. Greek salad with kabob, but the plate was laughable. Couldn't even cut the bird without a mess. Iceberg lettuce? Forget about it. And the chicken? Swimming in sauce. Stick to the gyro, that's the ticket. Had it last time, pure gold. Good folks here, no doubt."

"Upon a whim, we chanced upon this place,
And found our time there, quite mixed in grace.
The tofu rolls, they pleased our taste,
But not so much, the lemongrass broth did waste.
My pad se ew, it was good, I must confess,
But sweetness marred its flavor, I do profess.
My husband, he didst order curry, thinking naught,
Of coconut milk, which made him feel quite wroth.
Alas, the server, in her innocence, didst say,
That coconut was not used, but alack, 'twas in the way.
He swapped it out, for pad Thai, with haste,
But lo, the spice, it didst burn, and left a nasty taste.
In sum, Curry on Murray, doth win our praise,
For service, decor, but food, methinks, doth raise.
A mediocre score, doth this place receive,
For though the meal, didst start well, it didst leave us grieve."
"Folks said they laughed 'til they cried. Didn't see much of either from where I sat. Maybe it was the age gap. This show ain't for the young bloods."

"We checked this joint out after reading some reviews. I was let down 'cause I had high hopes. It's just your average coffee shop. I was with my husband and one of our twins. I was gonna get the breakfast burrito, but I wanted turkey sausage instead. The girl at the counter said they couldn't do it. So I went with turkey sausage, egg, and cheese on an English. I asked for a scrambled egg for my little girl, but the girl said they couldn't do that either. The eggs come pre-made in a patty, which sounded about as appetizing as my sneakers after a 3-mile run. I canceled the food and paid for the coffee and OJ I got for my baby. Too bad, I'm always lookin' for breakfast spots."

"Affecting airs of elegance, yet lacking substance to match the cost,
Their pomp and circumstance doth not befit the fee they boast.
I do confess, a better view could scarce be found,
Yet for the price, my expectations were not quite profound.

The service, too, did leave much to be desired,
With naught but empty words, their claims uninspired.
For though they strove to seem refined and grand,
In truth, their efforts fell flat, like sand.

So if thou seekest luxury, look elsewhere, my friend,
For here, 'tis naught but show, with little true intent.
But if the view alone doth please thee, then by all means,
Prepare thy purse, and suffer their pretenses."

"Listen, I ain't payin' no $50 for a pedicure. Not ever. And I sure as hell didn't pay it this time neither. We asked how much, I told 'em what I wanted, and the only thing that changed was I decided on French tips instead. If I was gonna spend that kinda cash, I'd go to The Bath House. Now, what got me was why they were moppin' the floor at 9 am. Salon just opened, who wants to be there while they're cleanin' up yesterday's mess?"

Thus did we come upon a Thursday eve,
A night most strange, and full of woe,
Our band of men, nine in all, did gain entry free,
By some strange chance, or so it seemed to me.

My first time in Las Vegas, a city bright,
And first club visit, with anticipation great,
But alas, the place did have a deadly feel,
As if none there did truly wish to revel.

The outdoor patio, up above, the only space,
Did hold the crowd, a mix of young and old,
With cougars and manthers, in a lonely race,
Did seek to find some mirth, their hearts cold.

One bar alone, did serve the multitude,
O'erwhelmed it was, with drinks untold,
A sorry sight, and cause for much dismay,
Did leave us all, in sorrow's sway.

Never again, have I returned to this place,
With memories of joy, forever effaced.

"Service was decent, but the grub wasn't great. I had the Tuscana Sausage Soup, which was too salty and the potatoes were undercooked. The sausage was alright, though. I tried building my own pasta, thinking it'd be a better option than pizza, but I was wrong. I got spaghetti with bologonese sauce, meatballs, and mushrooms. It cost around $22-$24, but it wasn't worth it. The pasta and sauce were just lukewarm, and the meatballs tasted like they were straight from the freezer. All in all, I wasn't impressed with the pasta. Maybe I'll stick to a slice of pizza next time."

"This joint wasn't my cup of tea. I dig the retro vibe, but this place was just a dump. Not cheap either, and the burgers were subpar. Awkward setup, hard to get a refill on your soda. Tourists keep it afloat, they don't know any better. I won't be back."
"Rude waitress. Food mediocre, but not worth a single star. First and last visit. Better options nearby, cheaper too. Only plus: veggie options on menu."

"I tried twice to reach Sherry's Pampered Pets by phone, but no one picked up. I left a message, but they never called back. After waiting a few days, I gave up and made reservations elsewhere. If they couldn't be bothered to return my call, I sure wasn't going to leave my dog in their care."

"Stayed at a crummy joint for a night. Decided to go cheap, but it was all show and no go. Beautiful from the outside, but inside it was old and grimy. Service was terrible too. Asked for a non-smoking room, but it reeked of smoke. Called down to the manager's desk, but no one helped us. Finally got someone's attention, but she was rude and sent us to the other side of the lobby. Had to wait 10 minutes for someone to help us, and even then, they told us to go back to the other side. Long desk, especially with two full bottles in my bag. Overall, bad customer service. Maybe if we had arrived an hour earlier, it wouldn't have been so bad. But still, wouldn't stay there again unless I really had to."

"Chopstix, a name that rings of authenticity, but don't be fooled. The service is as fake as the smiles of the staff. I ventured in, hungry for some decent Chinese grub, but what I got was a taste of disappointment. The card reader was busted, so I had to trek to the nearest ATM, shelling out an extra three bucks for the pleasure. I returned, cash in hand, ready to devour my wor wonton soup, house fried rice, and orange chicken. But alas, the man behind the counter was too busy taking a personal call to bother with me. I waited, patiently at first, but as the minutes ticked by, my hunger turned to frustration. Finally, another man sauntered over, sans apology or acknowledgement of my wait, and took my payment. No discount, no freebies, nothing but a bland, unfulfilling experience. Save your taste buds, folks. Chopstix ain't worth the trip."
"Nah. Not worth it. Vegas has better buffets - Wicked Spoon, Bacchanal. This one's a dud. Dry food, sitting out too long, and it attracts the wrong crowd. You're in Vegas, splurge on the good stuff."

"Service was adequate. Menu options were overpriced. I ordered the street-style pork sandwich. Pork was blue rare. Sandwich was small, like a biscuit. Underwhelming experience. I also had a pork taco with green salsa. Pork was cooked well, but taco was soggy from pork grease. Friend had dim sum, no issue with size. Dim sum had an odd smell, but tasted fine. Place was sub-par. Wouldn't go again. Drinks come in small bottles, no free refills. Some bottles are smaller than others. Not worth the money. Wouldn't recommend."

"Hark, our first visit doth unfold,
A tale of service most divine,
Our waitress, friendly and bright,
Didst make our stay most pleasant and light.
The location, priceless indeed,
Westgate, a place of mirth and good deed.
Alas, the pizza, a disappointment true,
Tasting of frozen fare, meager and new.
The sauce, a grossness did impart,
The crust, too thin and soft of heart.
A shame, for such a place of renown,
The pizza should be far better known."
"Staff unimpressive. Food, just okay. Overpriced. Trying too hard to be upscale, but falling short. Limited wine list, small portions, and snobby staff. Better options in Charlotte."

"Been meaning to hit this joint for a bit. Now that I have, I'm good. 

It's the kind of spot you hit after a night of drinking, when your standards ain't so high. It wasn't all that bad, but not great either.  

I gauge Latin eats by their chips and salsa. If it's not good, I know what to expect from the kitchen. With that said..
the chips were greasy, salsa tasted like Pace. 

Had the two taco plate - grilled chicken and steak tacos with re-fried beans and rice. Steak taco had good flavor, but the chicken was real dry. Added lime and salsa to try and juice it up. All in all...it was decent, but not any better quality than a late night taco stand."

"Stayed here last year on a family road trip. Enjoyed it. Room and bathroom were clean. Convenient location, close to I-77 and a great mall. Returned this year, but room wasn't as clean. Hair on the floor, noisy AC kept us up. Staff still friendly, but might look elsewhere next time."

"Cool joint, good hood vibe. But the grub? Bland city. Store-bought chips for dips? Gimme a break. Kiddie mac 'n cheese? Gritty, tasteless. Chicken in the salad? Overcooked, unseasoned. Arugula piled high on my pie? No thanks, pal."

"Food's still great, price is right. But, man, the place is crawlin' with douche bags now. Heard some fatty talkin' 'bout how he scored a table for four for under thirty bucks. Thought to myself, uh-oh, trouble's brewin'. Got there around one twenty, usually it's dead, just a few students or a couple finishin' off their lunch. Now it's packed with soccer moms and cheapskates who found it on Facebook or Yelp. They're makin' it tough to get a table, ruinin' the joint. Tell 'em to knock it off, will ya?"
"Reservations unavailable post five. No phone charging station, bloody hell. Waitress, top-notch. New barkeep, slow as molasses. Dreams took an age. Won't return past five, that's certain."

"Pizza joint claims to have vegan menu, but after 10:30pm, not a single vegan option to be found. Every other pizza available, but not a single one for us plant-eaters. Feels like they're just pretending to care about our business. No offer to make a vegan pizza, even when asked. Shoddy customer service, if you ask me. Feeling mighty disappointed."

"I'll return for a must-see band, elsewise, no dice. 

Security's cool, helped my buddy propose, no issues there. 

Parking's a bitch, limited spots, pricey too. Get there early or you're screwed. 

Sound's mediocre, not the best, not the worst either. 

Drinks? Ripoff! Don't drink, come drunk, or sneak some in. (Not advocating for sneaking it in, but they do pat you down at the door.) 

In summary, this joint's a ripoff, but it's the only game in town for big acts. Screw it."

"Methinks I do adore the notion of delectable, wholesome fare. Four times didst I venture forth to yon establishment, hoping against hope that they might provide a satisfactory repast. Alas, fate didst conspire against me. The first time, the victuals were palatable, but the service, alack, was woeful. Upon my second visit (ere the sun had dipped beneath the horizon on a Friday eve), lo and behold! They had exhausted their store of flat bread. Pray tell, what eatery doth run out of a staple item ere the evening had truly begun? We made do with bbq beef sandwiches, verily, yet the sweet potato fries, alas, were burnt to a crisp. Aye, 'twas a sorry sight indeed. My third visit didst yield more of the same. And thus, upon my fourth attempt, I didst decide to partake of their morning fare. An hour past the appointed hour, the portal stood ajar, nary a sign of a breakfast menu in sight, nor a soul to greet me. The staff, they didst espy me, yet didst ignore me for a full four minutes. As I didst depart, one of them didst bid me 'good morrow', alas, too little, too late."

"Einstein's bagels, now those are something special. Been here a few times, and I gotta say, they're top-notch. Sure, Bruegger's has decent sandwiches, but their bagels can't compare. You can find better bread and bagels elsewhere, easy."

"Greek restaurants should be off-limits to corporations. Family-owned, with hairy, ugly Greeks running the show - that's how I like 'em. There's probably an inverse relationship between the quality of the grub and the looks of the owner. Remember that movie about fat Greeks who ran a diner? Yeah, like that. Anyway, Daphne's is Exhibit A. Craving meat, bread, and fries, I strolled in. My gyro? More like styrofoam. Cold, flavorless meat, and the pita was like a rotten Frisbee. Crumbly, man. The fries were hot, but you could taste the freezer bag. Only bright spot was the diet Soba grapefruit drink. Now that was tasty."

"Terrible service, decent drinks. Booked a table five days in advance, no answer, so gave up. Called back two days later, confirmed high table by window. Arrived on time, table given to someone else, no acknowledgment. Four walk-ins arrived after us, got served first. Took 40 minutes for drinks, 10 minutes for snacks. Server was nice, but arrived 25 minutes in. Would have walked if not for the voucher. Friend had horror stories of bad service."

"A bar most curious, where fortune doth play a part,
In choice of bartender, a matter of the heart.
Some nights, a skilled hand doth pour the draught with grace,
Whilst others, a laggard doth mar the drink's embrace.
I shall not name the culprit, lest I cause offense,
But on certain eves, best to avoid the place, my friend."

"Good people, good vibes. BAM, pickling factory smell, but don't worry, fun bar. Bad experience though - undercooked noodles in ramen, made me feel sick. Small person, but can still eat. Spinach, refreshing. Carrots, lovely. Pork, cold, but good. Nori, standard. Broth, salty, but good. Tried Pai Ton, tonkotsu broth without pork. Friendly staff, made us non-alcoholic shots. Super nice, but food doesn't agree with me. If sensitive, try Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe, more classic and authentic."

Upon mine arrival, high expectations didst spring,
As tales of this place had oft been told and sung.
The decor and ambiance didst please mine eye,
But alas, the pizza didst not meet mine expectations nigh.

Thin crust, it was, and difficult to consume,
For toppings didst slide off with ease, 'twas no boon.
And cheesy bread, I didst prefer Little Caesar's fare,
To this, which left me in a state of disrepair.

The waitress, kind she was, but long didst disappear,
Leaving me in want of her gentle cheer.
Yet still, I wouldst give this place another chance,
For calzones, they didst seem most delectable and grand.

"Thursday night, busy as hell. My date and I hit up this joint, hoping for some decent grub. We get seated quick, no complaints there. But the food? Not so much. My date's chili was drowning in cheese, tasted like spicy marinara with beans. I went for the beef stroganoff, big mistake. It was swimming in oil, made me feel like I had a grease fire in my gut. Maybe I'll give their burgers a shot next time."

"A friend raved about this joint for six months, so I had to check it out. Turkey sandwich was just okay. But let me tell you, they don't even have Sweetener for their unsweetened iced tea. What a bummer. Not worth my time."

"This joint used to be alright. But, last time I was here for lunch, it was a bust. Server was jabbering to his pals about how crappy the tip was from the table before me. And they were out of the two drinks I wanted. Not going back."

"Celebrated my birthday at this joint and the service was top-notch. But the grub? Not worth the scratch. Ribeye, pork, bone marrow, and a couple glasses of vino set me back $250 for two. Skip it. Head to Bobby Flay's for a better steak and a fairer price."

"Airport's clean, but it's a den of sin. Booze, gambling, and likely strippers too. Plenty of grub, always neat, and easy to navigate. Give it five stars, except for the damn taxi line. It's a mile long and moves at a snail's pace. Unacceptable, especially since the casinos can't seem to fix it. They should be ashamed. Get your act together, airport."
